description:
I went here with 11 people after stuffing ourselves with pizza at a nearby restaurant. We came here around 11:45pm and they still had plenty of seats for my large group. They were quickly able to accommodate us, asked our IDs, and what drinks we wanted. I got some type of alcoholic apple cider (forgot the name since my friend ordered it for me). My drink was very good and was also my first time trying hard apple cider. I also sampled one of my friend's whiskey sours drink from the bar counter which I liked more than my hard cider.

This bar also has darts for you and your group to play with, while having some type of sports show to watch on TV. We left the bar around 1:45am only because they were about to close. I'd recommend this place because it's a fun bar with activities.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Great place, Bring your own pizza! No pool table or darts, so that's a giant bummer since it's quite spacious.

Drinks are weak, but service is good, and the big open area and ability to bring in food is pretty cool.

Good bet for Inner Sunset with groups.

Needs narcotics dealers like at 20th and Irving locations.
author: Enoch K.

description:
EVENT: tryna get turnt tonight - JK, not really! It's such a great little place to have a chill drink with friends and catch up! 

DRINKS: If you're beer loving - there's a good selection of beers! IPA my favs - I think I tried 3 different ones in one night. 

DARTS: Yes! Darts! My favorite!!! Give your driver license to the bar tender, they will give you 4 darts and you share and take turns. Don't forget to grab it back at the end of the night!

**OVERALL: great place for a chill night of darts and drinks!!!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
This is definitely a classic sort of place. There's no hip new gimmick, no fancy dressing on spirits. What they do have is a large (and solid) draft selection, a neat atmosphere, reasonable prices, and little fanfare.

We happened by on a mid Saturday afternoon, and the atmosphere was just right - a few people around so that it didn't feel empty, but quiet enough you could happily carry on a conversation, and you didn't have to wait for the bartender.

The bartender was also nice enough to let our friends play some music while we relaxed. There's ample seating, too, which was a wonderful attribute for our group.

I got a heretic chocolate hazelnut porter and a Wyder's Pear Cider, both of which were delicious. $14 for two pints ain't bad, either. I didn't get any cocktails but I did notice a pretty decent happy hour menu and a wide variety of different types of spirits.

Don't forget to peek at the old secondary bar on your way out, where they have several vintage cash registers ;)
author: Chris S.

description:
My go-to in Inner Sunset after a long day of work. Sometimes you just need a drink, and often times you may be too lazy to change and wear your nicest clothing. Yancy's is the perfect place for you to crash at after work, grab a fairly priced drink, and chill at a table under some dim lights. 

Lots of people watch sports here, and it gets pretty crowded during big games (i.e. Warriors playoffs)! Other times, you can find people relaxing, playing darts, eating pizza, etc. When you come, don't expect anything amazing - you are safe with expecting a solid/relaxing time.
author: Michael N.

description:
Never went dart place before, and it was the first time that I've been going out saloon beer place.
Darts: The darts are super fun, but not trying to get really hard as well.
author: Tatiana V.

description:
I have been coming to this spot for 10 years, on and off. The staff has always been friendly and the drinks are pretty stiff. They have a decent selection of beers and a large sort of liquor. 
Recently within the last couple months, they renovated the darts area. They have 3 new boards and it looks brand spankin' new. They have a jukebox with tons of music, if you like that. However, I usually come to this spot to grab a few drinks and play a quick game of darts, to start an evening off right.
author: Christian M.

description:
This is our guys' "go-to" place for sports events.  It bring together all the locals for the NBA, NFL, MLB, etc...  I grew up near here and its been THE place to be.  If you are coming to view a sports event, be prepared to get there early or have someone stake out an area to sit down.  Because if the game is big enough, you will be standing for the entire game!!!  And that's not necessarily bad.  I've don't many times but it can be annoying.  Sitting down is more comfortable but sometimes that too is annoying because now in your fixed position, another standing person will conveniently block your line of sight of the TVs.

Whatever the case may be the drinks are relatively cheap!!!  And now they take credit cars!!!  In the past it was all cash...

Come!  Enjoy!  Drink!  Watch! ...or just play darts.
author: Cary L.

description:
Been here twice.

1st time:

I like their long island teas & whiskey sours.

2nd time:

I got hornitos tequila chilled. I learned I don't like tequila so much though even if I'm on a happy buzz. The taste ain't for me.. but I had tequila at The Little Shamrock and you're not supposed to mix.. and I had volunteering the next day.. so couldn't switch to my go-to whiskey drinks.

-

I don't have much to say, it's one of my favorite bars. It's actually one of my cousin's favorite as well. The owner, Allen is super cool.

I got to bring in pasta from down the street to eat in here this past Friday night. 

-

It's not a crazy loud bar or anything, it's a chill bar. It's nice.
author: Lilian L.

description:
A neighborhood classic! One of my favorite places to watch any sporting event since they have so many TVs and a lot of seats all over the place! They don't employ too many waitresses, but the couple they have during big game days (such as WARRIORS CHAMPIONSHIP RUNS!) do a great job of making rounds. Guess what, they also now take credit card! For the longest time, they were cash only. That was the only drawback. Problem solved!

You're also allowed to get food from surrounding places and eat inside Yancy's. They don't serve any food, so it's awesome you can pick up some Pizza from the corner or garlic noodles down the block. It's not fancy inside, but it's not called "Fancy's". There's little air flow in the back, so on crowded game days, it can get quite sweaty back there. 

On other days, it's fun to come and play darts (there are 3 boards in the back). Drinks are priced pretty nicely and they're friendly here. If you're a douche, you don't have to come in. Feel free to let the locals enjoy their spot!
author: Aaron Y.

description: It might be a weird bar, but you know what I like them! I like them more than Blackwood and I like them about the same as Mucky Duck. I review them though because when I decide where to go in the neighborhood I bring people to Yancy's. It is four stars though because I will bring people to Shamrock over Yancy's but besides that Yancy's is my 1st to 2nd choice. I have never had a bad time here. The bartenders and nice and it is a big bar.
author: Aili P.

description:
Nice place. I live in the neighborhood and had been going there for a long time. I used to like to stop by for a beer after a long day of work. Unfortunately tonight the bartender was really rude and I'm never going back.

I spent the day doing moving work, so it's true I had been sweating. Still, the way the guy looked at me was beyond belief. Like I was smeared in my own feces or something. I went up to the bar and he told me I had to get out because I smelled. The place was pretty dead. The door was open. I take a shower every day. I wasn't even sitting at the bar, but a little table off to the side. 


Went to a different bar afterwards, no problems. I've never had this happen to me before. When I got back home I asked my boyfriend for his honest opinion. He didn't think I had a strong scent at all.

 So, whatever. Just a rude, miserable person. Hate to piss on another prole, but c'mon.
author: David M.

description:
3.5 STARS

We were looking for a decent sized bar to go to last Saturday since we had a group of about 10 people. We were already in Outer Sunset, so one of my girlfriends suggested Yancy's. I'd never been, but my gf said that it's a good size and we could play darts, etc. We got here last Saturday, May 14th around 8:15pm.

It was pretty busy when we got here. We managed to find a small table off to the side that realistically fit about four people. We managed to fit about 6 people at the table since we all got there at different times. Shortly after we started in on our drinks, a row of tables opened up, so we snagged them. This was much better and way roomier. We pushed the tables together to make a giant long table.

I was pretty much done drinking by the time we got here, so I just got a Jameson on the rocks and a Blue Moon. Nursed it for the two of hours we were there. We never got the chance to play darts as it always seemed busy and we never signed up. Might be fun to do next time on a chill day.

Nice neighborhood bar.
author: Elena N.

description:
There are so many things to say about Yancy's but I'll stick to the basics - this place is my go to spot to watch sporting events, especially the Warriors, Giants and 49ers (ehh).  It has a neighborhood-bar vibe and they decorate for the holidays (Halloween was insane!) which contributes further to it's presence in the community.  On nice days the windows in the front are open which creates an inviting feeling.  

The darts in the back come in handy on date night or with larger groups and the ability to bring in outside food really cinches this place as the go-to spot for a drink in the Inner Sunset.  Highly recommend Yancy's if you're looking for a casual but fun place to grab a drink.
author: Kelsey K.

description: Not a good bar.  Like a relic from a bygone era.  Smells super bad, it's carpeted!  They put Guiness in pint glasses.  Often empty.  Just a weird vibe usually.  Amazing space though, you could do so much with it.
author: Frank P.

description:
I went here with a couple friends on a weeknight and it was pretty great. We sat at a table and a waitress served us drinks. They had a decent selection of beer, ranging from common cheap ones to craft beer. The menu had each beer with the location from where it was brewed, but I wish they had a short description of each one so I wouldn't have to ask the server unnecessary questions. 

I really liked the ambiance of the place, at least from what I observed on a not too crowded weeknight. They have a nice area for darts in the back, but no dividers between each dart board which is a little dangerous lol
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Pros
- Great beer selection 
- Lots of TV's for sports 
- They take credit cards
- Darts in the back of the bar 
- Food can be brought in
- The bartenders are pretty friendly 

Cons 
- The bathrooms could be a little nicer
author: Dipesh G.

description: Awesome neighborhood bar with tons of tv's to watch sports. This is definitely not a fancy place just a very casual kick back bar with nice friendly people and dart boards in the back for your entertainment. The bartender Bryan is beyond amazing, he's always attentive, friendly and can make a very good cocktail. Overall, great place to grab a few drinks with friends. Will definitely be returning here for the warrior games.
author: Daisy W.

description: Usually only stop by on a weekday afternoon when they first open.  Like the place enough, except for the young bartender who seems very unfriendly. Clearly wants nothing to do with the customers - not rude, but only answers questions, pours drinks, but otherwise has no interest in customer service.  Seems to hang outside smoking or focused on his phone.  Clearly just a job for him.  Too bad, because I like the music he plays - bluegrass, folk, delta blues - have complimented him several times on his taste, thinking he might open up as to his musical background - no luck.  Same thing with trying to talk sports - save your breath.  I am hardly high maintenance, but think he might at least make an effort to attract and keep customers.  Thought maybe it was just me, but noticed he seems to treat everyone that way.
author: Gary M.

description: Love coming here. Its always filled with locals and nice people. Bartenders have always been nice. Good for free popcorn, free wifi, and darts.
author: Katelyn S.

description: Haven't been here since college days in the late 1970's. It was one of our watering holes when we were students at San Francisco State University. Nothing seems to have changed. Came her for a drink after having dinner in the neighborhood. Still noisy as hell, but the drinks are still reasonably priced, and nice ambiance. Nice visit down memory lane!
author: Norm D.

description:
He bar is right off of Irving. I've been here many times to watch a bunch of games. It's a great spot with great company. Food from outside the bar is allowed. If you're a regular, they accept cards now! Awesome news! They also offer free wifi! There are dart boards to keep you busy too.During the day, I sometimes see folks studying or on their laptops. If you're looking for a place that's fun, chill and not too fancy, this ur best deal.

I have nothing but great experiences here until tonight...
I'm changing my rating from a 4 star to. 3 star. Only because they asked my friend for his I.d. He's clearly over 21 (way over), but they asked him to leave. They said it was "bad for business" to have ppl in the bar who are NOT drinking. So he offered to buy everyone else at our table a drink to stay at the bar. Which I thought was really  odd and unfair since we had a large party of more than 10 people. But I understand business is business. I would've given this place a 4-Starr, but that situation happened AND...their atm machine ate my other friend's card. But other than that, this place is pretty cool.
author: Bel O.

description: Came here for a St. Patty's celebration. It's a quite a large space especially for SF. They have two dart boards in the back, which can get crowded but you can make friends and get your spot.
author: Laurisha C.

description: No table service and grouchy arrogant bartender. No cocktails listed on menu to make it an easier experience. Just a sad sorry place. Will never return.
author: Virgil W.

description: The bartenders are dicks.. they treat Women very good or really disrespectful. This place just all around sucks.
author: David Z.

description: Best packer bar in SF by FAR. You won't be able to walk out without packer colored necklaces. Go Packers!!
author: Ali O.

description:
If you're looking for EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE, you're going to find yourself at the wrong place. Potbelly guy with the red haired beard was one of the grouchiest people I have met to this day in the service industry. YOU ARE SERVING PEOPLE, for crying out loud, if you're having a tough day, let it out--but not on this establishment's customers. This guy lashed out on my friend and told her to MOVE OUT OF THE WAY. She, then, mentioned that she was trying to make a payment and he responds with "don't give me attitude." Clearly something is wrong with him. I have yet to have a positive experience at this place and I hope that guy either has 1) makes a positive change 2) do something else that will make him happy because this is clearly not for him.

The one star is for being a space for people to watch the game and have the choice of a varied selection of beer.
author: Bern M.

description: A perfectly good bar. Funky. Dark. Lots of tv's. Open daytime. Chips behind the bar. Eclectic and varied customers. I dunno. What more is there to say?  Want a drink?  In the inner sunset?  It works!
author: Katherine E.

description:
Had a very negative experience here today. Came with a group of 8 coworkers around 4 pm after a day of training. My friend transferred her out-of-state driver's license to a California license last week, and when she presented her temporary California license and her out-of-state license (not expired but with a hole punched through it) to the bartender he was extremely rude and refused to let her stay in the bar. His rationale was that people pass down expired licenses to their friends, which made no sense as her old license had her photo, her (over 21) birthdate, and an expiration date in 2021. If identification is suitable to give to a police officer during a traffic stop, I'd hope that it would also be suitable for admission into Yancy's Saloon. 

I understand that the bartender had to enforce the rules as he understood them (even if said rules were completely nonsensical) but the accusatory, aggressive, and rude manner in which he spoke to my friend humiliated her and made her cry. Our whole group would have left but some people had already ordered drinks. I will not be giving Yancy's my business in the future - there are plenty of other bars within a two block radius with employees who understand how to treat customers with respect.
author: Emily M.

description: I was suggested to this place from my boyfriend. For going on a late afternoon on a Saturday. Less people. Great. It's what I need to avoid crowds. Only serves drinks but saw they had I believe a bags of chips and popcorn as well. I like that they have selections of drinks that you can't find at other bars. Would go back there again to try a different drink and play with the dart board.
author: C G.

description:
Yancy's is a decent spot to get some work done if you want to pair internet with a drink.

The space is huge and they have a multitude of TVs if you're hoping to catch a specific type of sports game as well.

That being said - I've come to discover that Yancy's is not my go-to hangout.

I stopped on by Yancy's this Sunday to watch the Warriors game. The place (as I'm sure most bars were due to the Warriors game) - was busy.  I found a seat at the bar. The bartender asked if I wanted a drink. I asked if I could buy water  - since I didn't drink. He said that they didn't serve bottled water and that there was a 2 drink minimum to sit at the bar. 

And so - I headed on over to Little Shamrock - where they proudly hang the Welsh flag, where they have free water in a self serve section, where there is a multitude of low-key warm faces, where there is plenty of sitting space, and where there is no two drink minimum to sit at/or around the bar.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: This is a cool ass bar and a fun spot to watch games. We arrived early to save seats to catch game 4 of the NBA finals. Played a round of darts before the place filled up and discovered that I'm actually pretty good! Good thing we came early because the place got packed very quickly but they had bartenders on the floor taking drink orders so we didn't have to move. They also allow outside food, since they don't serve food, so that was pretty cool. I'm not a big basketball fan but I still had fun eating, drinking, and trying to catch a glimpse of my idol, Ayesha Curry. Next time I'm gonna wear a short sleeve top though because it gets real hot towards the back.
author: Mymy N.

description: Casual bar with a mixed crowd. 99% of the time I come here I run into someone I know haha.  It's chill to throw darts with friends and have a couple beers to catch up with people.  It's my go to spot to accommodate people in the sunset if we want to get a drink together.
author: Christina L.

description:
Horrible service. 
The servers at the bar are extremely rude!!! 
Zero hospitality and customer service!!!
author: Megha P.

description:
Very great bar.  Unpretentious.  Tons of screens for any game you're wanting to see.  Awesome selection of beers on tap.  Not the greatest wine, so just don't order that.  They have menus from restaurants around the area for you to order take out and bring in.  Tons of space and places to sit.  Right outside the muni line.

I started this review with a 4-star, but after writing this, changed it to a 5-star.  There's no reason this shouldn't be rated a 5.  I've been here numerous times for numerous occasions (to watch a game, book club, hanging out), and I've loved it every time.
author: Ghizal A.

description: Really chill bar if you're looking for something more low key. A lot of seating, they have three sets of darts in the back and clean bathrooms. Drinks were reasonable priced too.
author: Joy-Alonica B.

description: I would frequent here pretty often after work or while waiting for MUNI. Bartenders are friendly and some would remember me. They carried Boddingtons which isn't the easiest to come across.
author: Evan C.

description: The bartender is very very rude!!! Even though the darts spots were open he straight up said no to us. He would not let me and my friends split the check. He ruined our night!! I was standing by the bar and said "excuse me" 10 times and ignored me even tho there was only one other costumer by the bar. Even tho I was very nice and respectful he was very disrespectful!! Never have I ever received this treatment at a bar in my life!!
author: Jipsa P.

description: The best sports bar in the area.  I have been going to this place with my friends for over 12 years, and they do a great job.  Feel free to bring in food as they do not have a kitchen, but wash it down with all the great beers on tap...
author: Jai V.

description:
This is a chill place and it's really our go-to spot after work. It's never that loud or busy, so you can have a nice chat with your friends while grabbing a beer. They will give you free popcorn, or if you'd like you can grab a pizza or burrito next door and bring it in for your dinner. Darts in the back if you like.

Oh, plus they started taking credit cards months ago, so don't worry about that.

Great place to grab a beer in a relaxed, not too noisy environment.
author: Brent W.

description:
In the handful of times that I've been to Yancy's I have yet to have a bad experience. Good beer, plenty of places to sit, and the sweetest bartenders around. One of them handed me my drink last night and said, "Here you go, dear." Dear! That just about melted my cold, dead heart. 

I'll definitely be back for a brew or two the next time I'm in the neighborhood!
author: Cecilia C.

description: When I asked back my ID after I left them there for darts, the bartender took his time to return it to me. I was in a rush. When I pointed that out he freaking ignored me. There were 10 ppl in the bar. The bartender with redhead is a complete dick, enough said. A bar where bartenders don't know how to act is just a waste of space. Sell the business and let people with customer service skill run the place.
author: Ashish N.

description:
This is a pretty solid bar-- I understand why a lot of people come here to chill. There are so many TV screens playing all types of sports: basketball, football, hockey, etc etc. Plus, there are plenty of tables to sit at, and the drinks are cheaper than the average bar. What more can you ask for?!

Downside is that it's cash-only. I totally didn't expect that. Also knocked down a star because the bartender was being pretty rude. I was taking pictures of the interior (they decorated for Christmas, really pretty lights!) and the bartender was being really impatient and kept pushing me to order. "Order now, pictures later." Well geez, I apologize wanting to admire the interior design... He also looked really pissed handing us the drinks. We did not get a good vibe from him at all; it was like "take it and leave" vibe. No bueno.
author: Jenny C.

description:
I came here with a pretty large group, and everyone had a great time! The saloon is spacious and even though there was a lot of people we felt like we had our own space. There's an app where you can choose the music that plays in the bar which was cool! My beer was very warm and foamy, but maybe it was just the beer I chose because everyone else's seemed fine. 

I love how they let you bring outside food in! Also, the place is really relaxed, but also a great place to hang out, play darts, drink, etc.
author: Hoku L.

description:
There's darts in the back! Bet ya didn't know that since this place is always full of people.

Yancy's is super chill. You can bring food in from anywhere and have a drink to enjoy the game on one of their many, many TV screens. Drinks are cheap too - what's there not to like?

Cash only!
author: Sandy T.

description:
I usually hate places that don't take credit cards. Yancy's doesn't take credit cards. SUPER INCONVENIENT! But.....I think Yancy's is still worth 5 stars.  Why? Because Yancy's is there for all my needs.
1. I can go there in the middle of the day to do work when the nearby starbucks is packed. They have wifi, and PLENTY of space. 
2. I can go there when I just want to drink and hang out. It has been the space for many of my fight makeups with my bf/potential future husband....if he is lucky ;)
3. I can bring in food from the surrounding food establishments.  Yancy's doesn't have food but I have eaten pizza,  mediterranean food, a bagel, arizmendis, etc. while in there. 
4. Cheap....which is perfect because I am cheap.
author: Julianna I.

description: Awesome local watering hole. Bartenders and ambiance are super chill. They have a jukebox that plays all my favorite bands for a nominal fre (Spice Girls, Backstreet Boys, Creed).
author: Ali A.

description:
Let's admit it, all work-hard-play-hard grad students need AM doses of caffeine and PM doses of ethanol, PRN.  It is all too necessary to have a local sports bar,  turned down a notch from the classiness of Inner Fog, casual and good for groups--whether it be for spontaneous hangouts or end-of-the-quarter celebrations with an objective of getting wasted in the early afternoon.  It is well within walking distance of 10 short blocks, though it easily goes unnoticed so it can be a bit difficult to find when you are wandering around the Inner Sunset in post-exam sleep-deprived delirium.

It's fairly spacious, with a notable large comfy loungey couch in front of the TV's in the main area.  There are a lot of tables, but the chairs have armrests so it gets awkward and clunky when you try to fit too many people around one table.

Nothing stands out in terms of drinks/bartenders, except the black velvet is quite popular and the layers look cool--the macchiato for after 5.  People who detest beer love the pear cider.  Beer selection is not amazing but okay.  Margaritas are too juicy.
author: Edna C.

description:
When you need a bar with enough space for a large group? Yancy's is the first thing that comes to mind. Sometimes I think we come here too often, however it's still one of our favorite spots. Although it's a "sports" bar, the atmosphere here is pretty relaxing and nice. Theres a diversity of groups here too. Another nice thing about Yancy's is that you may expect to run into some familiar faces every now and then. One of the best thing about Yancy's is that it's right next to a Pizza shop, so when you feel hungry you can always grab a pizza next door. Shots are relatively cheap in my opinion. The waitresses are very nice and attentive, they will come to your table and ask if you need anything instead of having to squeeze in at the bar. 

There are TVs All over the bar and lots of tables and seats but when it gets crowded usually there will be no seats left. There is also a little room where there are 3 dart boards for a little more fun with friends. And if you ask them they usually have dices and cards. 

The only downside is that this place is cash only so remember to go to the ATM first.
author: Lisa S.

description: I used to like this bar a lot. It was our chill hang out place and they have darts. It all changed last night when we met the rude/racist bartender. He refused to give us darts and called us nasty! It was horrifying and very disappointing. I don't know what makes you think we are nasty but I sure hope you encounter some "nasty". We asked to keep our individual bar tabs open and he didn't like that. So I paid for the four of us and I thought it was fine after that but he walked away very rudely. Later, we asked for the darts, and he lied to us and said that three people had already given him ID's. we noticed that only two groups were playing and the middle dart board was free. So we were talking to the other two groups to see if someone else was playing and they said it had been available for a long while. They said "we are leaving anyways so you can have ours". I went with them to the bartender to give him my ID for the darts and he said "no im not gonna give them to you" and then said "you guys are nasty". I know people are racist but it is not okay to be openly racist like that. Do that crap in your house. If you want to refuse to Indian girls that put a board outside that says "we are racist, Indians are not allowed" and we will get the message. Don't be an asshole to five girls. We walked down the street and found a better bar with a pool table. Much better. They were nice and very friendly.
author: P W.

description:
Yancy's is one of those local favorites that's pretty solid.  It's spacious, the bartenders are pretty social and friendly, and drink prices are on point.  The two negatives are that it's a cash-only bar and the fact that there is literally no AC but hey they have the fights on with no cover and because of said cash-only requirement, you can pop in for a drink without getting overcharged.

That all being said, it's a good place to meet friends for a cold beer on those rare nice days.  Good times most definitely will ensue.  Not ideal, but it'll get the job done nicely.
author: Chris C.

description: Horrible bartender ever! Completely misusing his power. Never have we been so disrespected. We asked to split the drinks between 4people and he refused to do it when there were barely any people at the bar. He also refused to give us darts to play with. We were perfectly nice to him and friendly and he thought he would get away with miss treating us! He might be a littler racist might I add.. rudest arrogant person ever
author: Chandni P.

description:
As someone who spends a lot of time boozing it up
In the inner sunset, I unfortunately don't end up here enough! My friends really hate on this place for some reason but I love it. So it's not the most clean bar and sometimes smells like puke but there's a great atmosphere that feels special to me. 

The bar is spacious and a great place for a group of friends to get together and drink all night. The drinks are reasonable too. 

Come here on a weekend night and it's packed (sometimes it can get rowdy). Always great times here!
author: Anastasia P.

description: Definitely a kewl place to chill if the game is on or just lookin for a college crowd. Youngster spot for sure, but compared to fireside at least they have free darts that u just need to leave your ID for to get darts. 2 of the 3 boards are jacked...not really sure y they would replace 1 instead of all three! Oh well..the cash only does kinda suck but eh..lots of TVs to watch a variety of games. With all the cash they make and how cheap board are...that is my main complaint. Other than that a great local bar to hang out with friends.
author: Austin C.

description:
July 2014.
During a beautiful walk through the Inner Sunset we stopped in for some drinks, great atmosphere and Mike really took care of us!
author: Jon U.

description:
Where yancy's shines is just by being big. And on a lazy afternoon you don't have to sit anywhere near folks and can just do you. 

The inner sunset doesn't have enough bars though and that's what puts Yancy's at 4 stars instead of 3.
author: Misha T.

description: Cheap drinks! Nice atmosphere, cool bartender. Darts and hella tvs. First time here and I will definitely come back.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
I ventured out to Yancy's after reading they had dart boards. I really wanted to throw some darts.

I walked a few blocks and walked in. Sitting down at the bar at 7pm on a Thursday night, I found it pretty empty. I wasn't served immediately, but was helped shortly. I asked about happy hour, and was informed that it's from 2pm-7pm, dollar off pints of beer and bottles. Well, I just missed it, so I got my 5 dollar beer. They have a large selection of beers and a full bar.

Grabbing my beer, I head to the darts area where some others were playing. There are 3 dart boards of terrible quality. They have been overly used, and should really be replaced soon. So, there are 3 dart boards in a row... and facing the boards I played on the most left board. I was up against the wall, and there were kegs of beer on the ground that were in the way. The middle board is the best board to play off of. The right board is in the way of people walking into the room. I pulled out my own darts (not trying to sound pretentious... I just like heavier darts. They have darts, but you have to let them hold your ID or something... not too sure about this. The most disappointing was the quality of the boards. They metal that create the circles around the bulls eyes and dividing the number sections is protruding. My darts have hit some and bounced off. Some also bounced all the way back to me... RAWR.

I played darts and when I finished my drink, a staff member came over to clear my glass and asked if I wanted another beer. I said yes, and it was brought over to me. 

Meh, I'll see if I can find better dart boards in the area, but for now, I'll settle for the cheap bear and darts. 

They have plants hanging around and large TVs. Good for groups and lots and lots of seating.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
Nice little spot with a taqueria just a few doors down. I popped in post-taco, grabbed a spot at the bar and watched some Shark Week programming while waiting for my pals. It was a nice day out, so they had the windows open. I sat there, leaning in the dark comfort of the woody interior with my drink, wondering how it was possible that I was first. I shot a couple glances at some dude vogue-ing across the street , back to the sharks, back to my drink, and then to the oddly familiar-looking dude standing on the curb- my old pal, Yosemite Sam! That's not his real name, btw. But if they had the windows closed, I would have never seen my old friend, waiting. So, I'm a fan of their windows.

The lounging area is also pretty cool and instead of one of the wooden chairs, I claimed a spot on an old lounge-y sofa that made me feel like Lady Gaga. If you don't like feeling like Gaga, there's plenty of wooden chairs and regular bar stools.

All in all, a very lovely spot to catch up with your pals and eat their nachos.
author: Loli L.

description:
Incredibly ageist, incompetent bartenders with no regard for people or the neighborhood. Didn't do anything when the ceiling started leaking on the tables.  The red heads attitude made me feel super degraded. I do not recommend it unless you are a middle aged white male. 
A big part of the reason why the city is increasingly overrated.
author: Lisa F.

description:
This place is super chilll to come and watch a game or just grab a drink with some friends! The drinks are pretty cheap (but.. from my experience not really strong?) and they have a jukebox where you can play your own music! It gets super crowded during game nights but it's defs a good, hyped, environment. 

There's an area where you can play darts too. Only downfall is.. this place is CASH ONLY. Sooo be aware and be prepred to bring cash!
author: Krystal O.

description: Fun bar with lots of space and a great vibe! Loved that they have darts and give free popcorn. I'm a huge fan of Ballast Point Sculpin and they carry both the mango and grapefruit versions. Will definitely be back!
author: Neel P.

description: I love yancys. It's our local bar and the cocktail waitress named Stephanie is such a sweetheart. We go here and the staff knows are names. It's comforting. No food sold here except popcorn but you can bring food from outside. They now accept credits which is awesome! Darts, tables a couch. Juke box and his/her bathrooms. Love it.
author: Vanessa G.

description: I really like Yancy's. Unassuming, old sports bar. Great place to see a game, have a beer, and play some darts. Gets very crowded on game days but otherwise is pretty empty. They don't have food but if you're hungry, get wings or pizza and bring them in.
author: Ryan Y.

description: Yancy's is a great place to watch sports. They now accept credit cards! I went here for the Warriors game last night, and they have a lot of TVs and a lot of space, so it's a really fun atmosphere to watch the game. Arrive about 30-40 minutes early to get a seat. Also, you can bring in your own food and everyone does that. The best part was the really friendly and attentive waitresses who come around to your seats to take your drink orders. Our waitress always came back at the perfect time - I was never once waiting for her and wishing I had a drink. She was also so nice and friendly and in a great mood despite the fact that the place was totally slammed!
author: Brooke R.

description:
This place is low key, relaxing, and full of hanging plants. It has Cheap drinks and friendly service!

I learned they don't serve any food, so ended up ording pickup from Yumma's mediteranean right across the street and eat it with my drink. It was the best decision! the food was excellent (where I couldn't say about bar food usually), the drinks were excellent, the atmosphere was relaxing! This is going to be my to go place from now on.

Yancy's is also great for big groups!
author: Mina D.

description:
Step 1. Go to San Tung and order some spicy dry chicken wings. http://www.yelp.com/biz/san-tung-chinese-restaurant-san-francisco 

Step 2. Walk around the Inner Sunset for 28 minutes. Now face west. Think about direction and wonder why you haven't before. 

Step 3. Pick up the chicken wings (see step 1) and make a beeline (or cross safely at a crosswalk, I don't care) for Yancy's Saloon, where cash is king and the beers are cold. When the bartender identified the source and style of our chicken wings from 14 feet away by smell alone, I knew we were in the right place.

Step 4. Eats your wings, drink some beer.

Step 5. Retreat to your home in the Mission. Think about the place where you live. Wonder why you haven't before.

Obligatory Title Pun: YANCY doodle went to town. 

Menu Readability: I don't remember a "menu."

Need to mention: There are a trio of dart boards in the back. Perhaps not the best for aficionados, but they get the job done.

What this place teaches me about myself: Does anyone else remember Get A Life?
author: Vivek S.

description:
Excellent place for a bar.

1) Location
Great location. It's smack dab in the middle of many fast food/sit down restaurants and a starbucks. If you need cash, there's a Well's Fargo, Bank of America, Citibank ~100 feet away. Tart to Tart is ~200 feet away. 

2) Transportation 
Bus: N-Judah, 43, 44, 71, 6
Car: public parking lot 1/2 a block away

3) Huge space, many tables

4) Games: 3 dart boards

5) TV Screens - to watch the sports games

6) Outside food allowed 
Get a gyro or burrito from down the block on 9th between Irving and Lincoln or a pizza from Cybelle's or Pasquale's.

Just go here if you want to hang out with friends, family, or by yourself okay?
author: M L.

description: This is the best place to watch a warriors game in the Sunset. Here with a friend last night and the atmosphere was electric! Good vibe and good times. Lots of TVs and other sport options too, bartender is great, and the waitress killed it, both worked hard and that made a big difference. It was packed and we never waited empty. Ordered a pizza from down the street and ate it in the bar! Many good options in area for food and most deliver right to your table.
author: Pete S.

description:
Well Hello Yancy's! It's a funny thing how we didn't meet each other earlier!  I was introduced to this wonderful spot by a couple of my great friends, and now i am absolutely in love!

What does Yancy's have to offer?  First off...

* Location is wonderful.  Located on Irving at 9th Ave I believe.  Parking is never a problem.  Everytime we come here, we find parking right away.
* Walk in and suit yourself.  Feel free to find a table or seats at the bar.  You're on your own here.  Make yourself comfortable like home!
* Very soon, a host will come and greet you, check IDs, and take your order.  The girls are friendly and helpful.
* Sip on your drinks while you enjoy complimentary popcorn! Oh the popcorn is much needed!

Other things you should know..
 - They have flat screen TVs all around!
 - Dart room with 3 dart boards and tables are towards the back!
 - Draft beers are all $5! My snakebite (Guinness and cider was also $5)
 - you get your order, you pay right away at the table.  Whats better than NOT having to get out of your seat and to wait in line and pay for your drink at the bar?!
 - Shots are $5-8 ( according to the boyfriend) Depends on what you get!
 - Cocktails are delicious and strong here. Not watered down crap.

Overall, Yancy's is one of those places where you will go and enjoy a drink..or a few and not need to feel stuffed and cramped.  Definitely a place for just you and your boyfriend, or with a group of friends looking for a chill night out.
author: Stephy L.

description:
UMMMMMM............ this place is cool... large space.. bartenders are alright.... drinks are priced fair...


BUT I will NOT be back... scared $hitless... does anyone know if this place is known to be haunted...??? cause IT IS!!!!!!!............ :( had an experience a few weeks ago......... Not even joking... Yeah, no thanks.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Love this place, especially when hometown teams play such as the warriors. The vibe for this bar is really nice. The ambiance is perfect for a sports bar. There are multiple TVs set up to the best channels there are, of course ESPN, FSN bay area, etc.

The beer on tap is all good here as well, though it may be a dollar or so more expensive than other places for a pint, it definitely is worth it for the comraderies. My favorites here are the hefeweizen and the blue moon, they place a lemon slice in the hef and an orange in the blue moon, makes  them perfect and they are always at the perfect temperature.

They also have several dart boards set up as well but it's mostly packed, so you might have to wait. This place is also perfect for large parties as they have a lot of seating.

One of the best sports bars in SF in my opinion definitely.
author: Benjamin W.

description:
Yancy's Saloon
SF: Inner Sunset
Sunday March 4, 2012
Three Stars

[SF#11]

Finished watching the Lakers Demo the Heat.  We drank countless Vodka Sodas and Campari & Sodas.  We played some free darts.  They use Paper and Pen (instead of chalk boards).

Cash only
author: Leonard L.

description: Yancy's has a chill atmosphere. They don't play really loud music. Great for chatting and hanging out. I loved the dart area. 3 dart boards and a seating area behind it for people to watch and drink. Service was good. Fast, but the bartender wasn't very chatty. Just got our orders and left. Lots of seating area so it didn't feel too crowded. Also thought it was cool that they let you bring outside food.
author: Carmelisa M.

description:
I've been coming to Yancy's since I was legally allowed to enter through their door.  I love that they periodically still card me!   

Yancy's is nothing fancy or trendy, but it's the place my friends and I go to for a laid back, casual, fun time.  The pours are generous and the drinks are very reasonably priced.  Popcorn is free and patrons are allowed to bring in their own food (notice all the pizza boxes stacked up near the door).  TV's are every where showing the latest sporting events and dart boards are available in the back.  The staff there is friendly and orders are taken in a reasonable amount of time.  Tables and chairs are abundant.  On some occasions, the designated driver's order was on the house.  Does it get any better than this?  

The crowd is mixed - mostly students from UCSF and folks in their 20's and 30's during the prime weekend hours, but I've seen a good mix of folks from all walks of life and ages on my visits.  This is a place to hang out with your friends and everyone is casually dressed.  No attitudes or snottiness to be found here.  The folks I've met have all been friendly and nice.  Halloween here is a bit of a hoot.
author: Melissa L.

description: A fun, exuberant (and large!) neighborhood bar with friendly service & pretty reasonable prices. All in all, it is what it says on the tin. Will be back!
author: Fi M.

description: I really prefer writing good reviews. However, I just moved into the neighborhood and was looking for a friendly local bar. My partner and I found Yancy's and went in. The bartender wasn't very friendly but made a good drink. We wanted another one but neither bartender looked at us. My partner raised her empty glass and a different bartender came over. Also not very friendly. He delivered our drinks which were okay. When we got ready to leave, my partner went to the bartenders to say that we were new to the neighborhood. I'm not sure what else transpired. Apparently the second bartender told her to f**k off and leave. I will never go back.
author: Kathy J.

description:
Hmmm......

What I love about Yancy's:
-Relatively cheap alcohol
-Complementary Popcorn!
-A million TVs all showing different sporting events.
-It's spacious and they leave a lot of openings allowing the cool air to flow through.
-The waitresses are very cute and fun to flirt with.
-Seating.
-Darts and video games!
-Jukebox!

What I don't like about Yancy's:
-CASH ONLY??? It's the 21st Century!


whatever...I'm giving it a FIVE STAR  I had to think about this one and the cash-only thing is really inconvenient because you have to walk ALL THE WAY to Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Chase...but it's not too big of a deal.  I love this place.
author: Sam K.

description:
Yancy's been our group's go-to bar in San Francisco since we all turned 21.  We come here so often that the waitresses know our drink of choice.  I think the question should be, what is there NOT to love about Yancy's?!
1. Drinks are fairly priced, $5-$10, cash only! but you're covered since there are 3 major banks within an 1-block radius and there's even an ATM inside.
2. Plentiful selection of beers on tap and spirits
3. Free popcorn and wifi.
4. Plenty of TVs
5. Abundant amount of tables and chairs which is a gem in SF
6. Darts area
7. You can even bring your own food! (some great suggestions are the pizza place down the block or even San Tungs chicken wings!)  

ps. Does it serve coffee during the day?  Why is there an espresso machine in the front?  On another note, I came to Yancy's around 5pm once and it looks completely different!  There are skylights that lit up the entire place.  That was also the same day I realized..is it just me or is Yancy Chinese themed? The next time you are there, take note of all the decorations.  Hint: in the back next to the TVs. and along side the right wall.
author: Mandy L.

description: I went there to celebrate my birthday with two of my friends and it was a great experience overall. We went at 5:30pm and it was not busy at all. I believe it was only us and two other people in the bar area. We got three beers and it was refreshing. It's a pretty big place, I would love to come back when it gets busier. HH is always awesome. Parking sucks.
author: Amy C.

description:
Yay for Yancy's!

-It's really warm and homey inside.
-Great place to watch games! Especially if you're too cheap to get Comcast ie me
-FREE CRACK-INFUSED POPCORN! Maybe they don't really use crack, but it seems like it. I could eat bowls of the stuff.
-Decent prices and friendly staff who will keep re-filling your popcorn bowl!
-Darts in the back!

Really, what more could you want in a local bar?!
author: Kei H.

description: If you like spicey, you'll love their $7 Bloody Mary's! Awesome service and atmosphere.
author: Marissa P.

description:
It's been awhile since I've been back, but nothing much as changed. Still the same old very happening spot where people are welcome to chill, have fun, throw some darts, and of course, drink to your little heart desires.

Love the crowd, the rustic wooden cabin look with wood columns, decors, and furniture. This place is larger than normal bars, but it still gets pretty packed during the weekends.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I came here to watch a 49ers game and had a great time! The drinks are fairly cheap, $4 beer, $4 mimosas but the place was so packed that I swore I was at a house party that was over capacity. It was definitely a 20 degree temp change from the inside to out.  If you want to go for a football (particularly niners), I recommend snatching a table an hour before the game but make sure that it's next to the exit.

Go niners!
author: Joyce M.

description:
Great local sports bar. There's alot to like about this place. Stiff drinks at a cheap price. HH makes it even cheaper. Darts area. Plenty of tables and TVs. 

Best of all, you can go around the corner and bring a whole pizza in if you wanted to! They don't mind which is definitely a plus. 

Only thing, CASH ONLY. (they have sweet old cash registers that 'cha-ching')

Great place for Bay Area Sports games.
author: Chris E.

description:
I've been hearing the name Yancy's for awhile, and I always thought it was a person's house! My bad! 

It definitely wasn't what I was expecting, the atmosphere was pretty cool, definitely not your typical dark dingy bar with moppable floors. It was very homey and comfy with the couches, and the lights made me think of old homes in detective novels! It's loud and  busy, but not so loud that you can't have a real conversation with the people around you.

There's also darts in the back!
author: Christine L.

description:
I can bring in my own pizza from Pasquale's? That itself deserved some well earned stars! Drink prices are average, ranging about $6 for a standard mixed drink and no more than that for a beer. It's a comfortable local bar with a diverse crowd. There are flat screens lining the walls, an area to play darts, a couple of old school arcade games like pacman, and tables everywhere.  I always heard they provide free popcorn but i didn't get any :(

Cashhhh only!
author: Samantha L.

description:
I'm not going to take off a star for poor service as the only had one really nice waitress on game day. I'm taking a star off for them only having one waitress on game day. The bar was packed for the niners game. You could go to the bar to get drinks for the table or wait for the poor girl to make her rounds. What's special about this place? I'm not sure. They did have free unlimited bowls of popcorn which was nice. We ate a ton of popcorn. There was a lineup of like 8 TVs playing the niners game but the setup wasn't aesthetically pleasing and for half the tables it hurt to look up to watch the game (including our table). They did let you bring your own food in; that was kinda cool because there's a lot of food places on the block.

Oh yeah and it was hot as hell in there I had to keep coming outside for fresh air.
author: Christina S.

description: Fyi i hope you like your free popcorn extra salty. This divey bar has been around for ages and is a regular hang out for many locals. There is no food other than free popcorn offered however you can bring in outside food. Ecclectic rotation of Asians, college students, hipsters and the like. Nice big tables in the back for groups and cozy nooks you can lose yourself in. popular game day hang out with 3 dart boards in the back.
author: Norris T.

description:
Down the street from my house, big screen TVs, tons of table space.....

Nice place to bring your friends, or grab a drink by yourself while wandering around Irving st.
author: Cassie B.

description:
My favorite local pub to come to. Very good location and easy to find. Plenty of street parking. They have a great selection of draft and bottle beers. If you are hungry they don't mind if you pick up something and bring the food back in the pub to eat. They have plenty of tv's located throughout the inside. 

The atmosphere is vintage and has a home feeling to it. Plenty of seating at the bar and in the dining area. The noise level is well balanced because you can have a conversation with your friends without having to raise your voice nor worry about other people listening.

Cash only but there is an atm located inside. Wells Fargo and Bank of America atms are located across the street.
author: Paul V.

description:
The girls and I went everywhere to find a "crackin" place to chill and catchup. Yeah it was a weeknight but it was "Thirsty Thursday"! After going to probably almost a dozen places we settled here and we should have settled here in the first place.

I ordered a white gummy bear which is basically:
1/2 ounce Raspberry Vodka 
1/2 ounce Peach Schnapps 
1 ounce Sweet & Sour Mix 
1 splash Lemon Lime Soda 

I actually didn't really know how to make it before so I couldn't really tell the bartender how to do it but he wanted to wing it and put Vanilla Smirnoff and Sprite together? It wasn't exactly right but it was OK. After he saw the weird look on my face, he told me it was on the house. Sweeeet!

People are so nice here and there were plenty of seats available. There are 3 dart boards with people looking super serious and concentrated when they play and even keeping score (I'd probably just randomly throw and have no idea what I'm doing).

Will be back!
author: Lauren K.

description:
I live in the area, and Yancy's has become a regular stop after a long day, or whatever. There are other good bars in the area, but Yancy's is especially good because they have cheaper drinks (cash only!), plenty of room for a big group of friends to gather comfortably, and although they don't serve food, you can bring in your own food. 

The decor is very cozy and relaxing. It looks like someone took the living room and dining room furniture straight out of some older house nearby and planted it all around this bar. They have some big old Victorian couches, coffee tables, and a big old oak dining table. Plus, they have a few big TVs for watching games, and a sectioned off area for darts in the back. The place is designed well to get you to come in, kick back, and forget what day it is out there in the rest of the world.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
This place is super chill and has become one of my favorite spots in SF. When I'm in a low key mood, Yancy's is the place I wanna be. I've noticed that as I've progressed into my mid-20's, I appreciate chill nights at places like Yancy's more than crazy nights at the club. Those times are still fun in moderation, but I'll probably opt for a night here more often than not.  I must be getting old! 

Atmosphere here is really casual and relaxed.  Lots of plants hanging from the ceiling, along with a bunch of colorful, antique lamps of varying shapes and sizes.  There are also darts in the back and lots of TVs...so it's a good place to watch games too. 

Drinks are cheap! Only about $7 for strong stuff like AMFs and Long Islands. Granted they do use cheap alcohol...but if your aim is to get messed up, Yancy's will allow you to do it on a budget! I usually opt for a Pear Cider or Hefeweizen when I come here and those are only about $5/drink.  Very wallet friendly! And what's more?! There's free popcorn! Can't go wrong w/that =] 

All in all, Yancy's has excelled in all fronts. Good prices, good atmosphere, and just an all around good place to chill with good  friends. 5 stars!
author: Natasha H.

description:
Always a fun place to hang out with friends, play darts, and grab cheap drinks. Bartenders are always friendly and in good spirits. Tons of TVs and a big screen to watch any game. You can also bring food in!

Sometimes it gets a little loud and some party kids can't hold their liquor so they stumble around... maybe onto your table. Anywho.

To get the darts, ask the bartender and you'll have to give him your driver's license. Just remember to pick it up at the end of the night!  

CASH ONLY!
author: Arleen F.

description:
I've been to Yancy's several times over the past couple years, mainly because of its close proximity to UCSF.  It's surprisingly pretty good sized; with seats at the bar, several tables, a couple couches, and even an area for darts.  

It's not the fanciest, or cleanest of places, but it definitely works.  They seem to be very willing to let us use the area for events and bring in our own food too.  Drinks are relatively cheap too.
author: Samantha L.

description:
you can bring in your own food here, yay!

CASH ONLY, but yancy's is a chill place to watch the giants play and is fun for people watching. the waitstaff is also always super nice, which is a big plus for a divey-type local watering hole.
author: Sam D.

description: This place was bomb and theres much to do here than just drink. I can't wait to stop by for NBA Playoffs later this Spring. They are also very generous when making their drinks. Great Bartenders and waitstaff. Love the darts.
author: Anthony P.

description:
Love it here for its chill atmosphere.  A popular spot among Sunset kids and UCSF kids... so, I come here quite often for school functions or if my friends from out of town come visit...we go to Yancy's!  Drinks are strong and cheap.  AMFs and Long Islands here taste like pure, cheap alcohol, so having a few too many may get you in some trouble.  They have a fine selection of beers and a few ciders, which is to be expected of an Irish pub/bar!  

The atmosphere of Yancy's is really cutesy with all the decorations on the walls.  Yancy's uses this ancient cash register probably from the early 1900's which I thought was pretty cool since it gave the whole bar an old West feel.  Sadly, they do not accept credit card, so this is why they lose one star.

What other things do I love about Yancy's?  The many activities you can do!  There's darts and cards, play with your buddies, watch sports...and there's POPCORN!  Coming into Yancy's you can smell the sweet smell of melting butter... and it's free.  Yancy's NEVER charges a cover, which is great for everybody!
author: Matthew L.

description:
It is a great dive bar, and has kept its shape for years and years.  We told my BF's mom that we went out here one night, and she could name seats and other items in the place that are there today; which were there while she used to go to the place.  And that's awesome.

They still have the free snacks, lots of games, surrounded with TVs, and great music selections.  It can be a little hard getting a drink sometimes, but nothing like any of the clubs.  This is a great chill spot to catch a game, grab a drink, play a game, or just to sit and relax after a long day of whatever.
author: Pia V.

description:
I'm rating this for the usefulness factor. Does the place serve food...  No, but they do allow you to bring outside food in to eat (and with all the available options in the area, that's pretty awesome). They have a pretty significant list of alcoholic beverages however. 

Do they have lots of giant TVs w/ sports on... YES YES YES.
Do they have wifi... YES.

They even have the little game machines and for any professional dart players, there is a dart board.

It was a nice spot to stop in, grab a drink, enjoy the Warriors game and NBA Coast to Coast, while surfing the web or reviewing on yelp on a quiet Tuesday night.

Service is good, plenty of seating. I'd definitely make a planned stop in if I needed to find a place to watch sports, surf the net vs. the neighborhood Starbucks.
author: Danny N.

description:
I come here way too often for me not to give them 4 stars. I live in the Richmond and I work nearby this place so it's easily accessible for me. However, why do I come so much?  
1. Cheap drinks
2. Friendly bartenders
3. Lots of seats at big & small tables or the bar 
4. Pregame for giants games!

There's tons of sports fans here on game days so it's a great place to be when you're trying to catch games!
author: Connie Y.

description: Caitlyn was fantastic. Brought us waters when desired. Had so much fun here. Would definitely come here again thanks Caitlyn
author: Alex D.

description:
Awesome beer prices & servers! 
My only issue was that it was darker than most bars which made for bad group conversations with friends. 
Free Darts & Popcorn, just ask!
author: Catalina F.

description: This place smells pretty bad, but it's a dive bar so what do you expect.  Young crowd, great for large groups.  It's somewhere to chill out, bring cash.
author: Sarah S.

description: I really like coming here it's pretty low key and the bartenders know how to pour drinks. Plenty of TVs to watch whatever game you want and the free darts is always fun. They allow outside food which is great. Also happy that they had my favorite rum Flor De Caña. Overall my favorite bar to go and relax with my friends.
author: Javier G.

description:
Great neighborhood pub, always supportive of the ma and pops shops. Not one of those "you can't get in wearing yo crocs" fu-fu spots. Real chill place. You can bring in your own food, $5 beers, TVs, plenty of seating, and darts. What else you need?

The ambiance is a little more dated than your modern hipster bars, but it is a local delight!
author: Cookie M.

description:
I came here for the first time to watch Game 5 of the 2010 World Series: IN-SANE. Tons of TVs, including one big one near the dart boards...so awesome. I've visited plenty other nights since then and it's been fun every time. 

The bartenders are all really friendly and helpful. They get your drinks fast but I've never felt rushed while ordering. Last night I finally sat at a table and our server was quick, especially for a Friday night, and kept coming back to our table to check if we needed anything else. Thank goodness; I was not ready to battle the crowds around the bar area.

Cash only, but there's a Wells Fargo directly across the street so it's not a problem. Just make sure you don't decide to head to the bar after losing a ton of money from gambling, then keep buying rounds for the ugly sweater party group. Although that's less of a review for Yancy's and more for the inebriated guy with an affliction for Irish car bombs so...who am I to judge? Carry on.
author: Ally W.

description:
Yancy's rarely impresses me - but I do come back a lot because it's one of those 'safety' places you go when you don't have anywhere else to go to. 

It's a neighborhood establishment, a place for UCSF students and staff to go hang out after work to grab a beer and unwind. It's the kind of place you show up in your sweatshirt and jeans and feel like no one is judging you. I've carried my backpack in here after classes and no one has a problem or says anything.

CASH ONLY. Cheap drinks $5-$7. The only food they have is free popcorn, which I see once in awhile.
author: Christine B.

description:
Excellent neighborhood pub, and they have Strongbow on tap! In fact they have an amazing number of things on tap.

I have to admit from the outside it looks a little dark, and you think it might just be a dive bar... I had hesitated going in, but I'm glad I did; great music and great neighborhood feel... And maybe the best thing is that since they don't serve food, you can bring in pizza from Pasquale's down the street. It's like having your own fully staffed and stocked man cave. :)
author: Jeff W.

description: Your regular ol' sports bar. Saw the last bit of the Superbowl here, and it was packed but no particular festivity from the actual bar itself. Happy hour is just $1 off. No food, but they're happy for you to bring pizza or whatever in from neighboring businesses.
author: Vivian H.

description: Great place to catch a World Series game - thanks to my friend who went 2 hours early to snag seats for the crew.  It was packed to the rafters & about 90 degrees inside (body heat)!  Flat screens everywhere & a giant screen in the far back so you can always see the game.  A big plus is you don't get stuck eating subpar, greasy, overpriced food some sports bars are known for because you're allowed to bring in food.  The location is perfect for that because there are good restaurants just steps away.  Yeah it's not a posh pub but the World Series vibe was sizzling.
author: Kim S.

description: I love Applebee's    This place has a tired floor, the dreaded TGIFs lamps, and the excessive TVs that no one is paying attention to.  Knock off a star for lack of flair.  I spilled on the carpet.  My apologies but in my defense, it should have been replaced when  I was masturbating to She Ra while collecting coins in the 4th grade.  The plants draping from the ceiling are a plus.  It reminds me of my Florida keys grandma.   The staff is great and for that  I'm grateful.  Odoyle rules!
author: Michael A.

description:
Pros: laid-black vibe, plenty of seating, fully stocked bar, friendly/helpful bartender who recommended drinks, and darts.  

Did you know they hold your driver's license when you get darts? ...maybe in case you decide to poke someone's eye out using the 3 darts they give, they'll hunt you down..of if you steal their darts?  It's the perfect place for people to chill..don't expect anyone dancing.  

Cons: cash only, no complimentary birthday shot or anything!..even though my friend bought drinks for the four of us ($26 +tip) and mentioned it was my birthday.  bartender pretty much ignored the fact it was my birthday..LAME.
author: Kimberly C.

description: Between the TVs , posters on the wall, jungle ambiance, and classic chandeliers, this bar has an engaging atmosphere without being overwhelming. The beer selection is varied and the table service is quick and friendly. Great bar for a first, or any, date.
author: Mike S.

description: Being a big Basketball fan this is my go to sports bar right now. Good crowd especially when a games on, great drinks and friendly service. not much more to say about this place other than if you're in the area and you want to catch the game at a bar then your first stop should be Yancy's
author: Peter B.

description: Pretty much my go to spot in the IS. Love this place. Bar tenders are great with just the right amount of tude! Good beer selection and 3 dart boards with tons of TVs. Bring in your own food and actually get a table.
author: Benjamin W.

description:
I like Yancy's. It's low maintenance. It has a jukebox. It's a great place to watch sporting events. I was there practically every game of the 2010 World Series (Go Giants!) and I watched a couple of the Olympic swimming competitions with fellow San Franciscans cheering "USA, USA, USA." Always had a fun time.

They have a ton of screens, so Sundays are probably packed for football.

I would recommend it to people who are looking for a casual night out. If you're afraid of the occasional sticky spot on a table, this place is not for you.

Cash only. Bring your own food.
author: Gloria B.

description:
Nice place to chill out.  Came here on a Saturday night for some drinks and to catch up with friends.  It wasn't too loud so we were able to carry on a conversation - but not too quiet to where you felt like everyone could hear you breathe.
Our waitress was super nice and helpful.  I love whiskey (just like her) and she recommended I get a Jameson and ginger ale.  A new favorite of mine!
Cash only!
author: Michele S.

description: I really like this bar. It's a little divey, but they have interesting drinks, and there's a section for darts in the back. It's also very spacious for a bar, so it doesn't get crowded. The drink selection is decent, but the only downside is that the drinks are a little pricier than other dive bars. They do give you free popcorn though, so you've got something to nosh on when no other bar would do the same.
author: Danny C.

description:
Really cool place to grab a drink. Just happened to walk by and peek in. The decor caught my eye....and the fact that it wasn't packed with people.

The bartender was really friendly, and their selection of alcohol is varied. They have darts in the back, and its got a mellow atmosphere. 

I'd definitely stop by again!
author: Greg S.

description:
it was great to finally come in! I grew up in this neighborhood, so i saw this place all the time. I went here last night with a few of my cousins to get an irish car bomb (never had one before). I really liked it! I like baileys=] My cousin treated his brother and I and paid about $22. The waiter was nice. The atmosphere seemed popping. The people were ok-- some outlaws here and there. In example this straight up drunkkkk  guy sat at our table and didn't say a word. 5 minutes later he stood up and stumbled out the door.  Finally! I really felt like he was going to throw up all over me. 

Anyways, Yancy's was great! There were a bunch of college students--very diverse crowd by the way. The decor was cool with a bunch of portraits. Another thing I noticed were the endless boxes of Pasquali's pizza-- down the block from yancy's-- at the bar, tables, and counters. It seems like that's the thing to do--grab a whole pizza from pasquali's and a drink from yancy's. Maybe i shall do that next time! 

I'm pretty happy that I finally went to this place! I intend to go again in the future!
author: Briana H.

description:
If you live in the area, it's a great spot to hang out for a mellow night on the weekend.  It's CASH ONLY and they've got some specialty drinks as well as a pretty extensive hard liquor and beer tap.

I always come here to play darts and just have a mellow social night out with friends.  They have numerous TVs everywhere so it would be a good place to watch sports and/or right now, watch the Olympics!  They have three dart boards... you just have to give your ID and they let you play with the darts for an unlimited amount of time.

Other than that, it's just a regular/typical bar but a reliable place among my network of friends to head when we have no other evening plans.  Hope to see you there!
author: Sandy L.

description:
First star: As soon as I walked into Yancy's, I felt like I was in one of my favorite "blue-collar" bars in Chicago. Not even the tiniest whiff of pretense. I immediately felt at home.

Second star: The layout of the room is such that, even at its most crowded, you don't feel claustrophobic.

Third star: Even though I ordered my first drinks (yes, plural...I'll explain later) after 7 p.m., the bartender winked and said "you just got the last happy hour price". I fell in love on the spot.

Fourth star: Our waitress was supremely patient and gracious with our raucous group.

Fifth star: My typical drink order is a double shot of good tequila with a Mexican beer back. I had ordered my first two sets at the bar; toward the end of the evening I ordered my third set from the waitress, but with a single shot. Even though the bartender couldn't see who had ordered because of the crowd, he recognized the combination and sent the waitress back to be sure I wanted a single and not a double. Really? With all the customers he was juggling he remembered that?

I'm both relieved and dismayed that Yancy's is so far from home!
author: Valeria R.

description: I came here for my birthday to drink because I know this place would have tables to accommodate my random group of friends. I was super surprised actually that most of the people on my invite list actually showed up. We took about four tables. Back to the review, the drinks are cheap but require cash only which is why I gave Yancys -1 star. But I do like that this place has lots of tvs, casual, and has darts in the back. Many people at the bar also were playing many different drinking games if you ask. I'll probably come back to play some darts again some day.
author: Jason L.

description:
Love coming to this place when there is sporting event that's happening because it's a great sports bar with huge TV'S, three dart boards, and lots of tables & chairs but it can get very crowded if you don't show up early enough before a game starts.

Mike the bartender is a sweetheart! But..... the reason why I'm giving this place 3 stars is because of the tall waitress with black & blue short hair who is completely rude for no reason. She told my friend to "move out her way" because he was in her "spot" at the bar, lady you could've waited 15 secs for him to get the beers. And the entire time she was glaring at everyone and my friend & I from a distance... like ok what's your problem? So Yancy's staff please do something about her attitude. 

Overall your experience at the bar going to be awesome as long as your not being served by the blue haired monster.
author: Alicia K.

description:
Very chill place. Friendly bartenders and decent priced drinks. I like how you can bring in your dinner or lunch or whatever and eat inside. 

One down side to this...cash only =/
author: Serena F.

description: Awful. I'm all about dive bars with dark atmosphere but this place is a major bummer. Don't even get me started on the extremely rude owner (bald as a baby) who snapped at me and embarrassed me for absolutely no reason. Total jerk, and just eavesdropped the entire time on me and my date. Will never go by here again even though I'm around the corner. Avoiding. Plus the amount of fruit flies swarming told me this place was pretty unkempt.
author: Kelly W.

description:
I don't like sports bars, most of the time. Not because I'm one of those delicate flowers who recoils at the thought of brute athleticism and organized cheering. (Or am I?) It's mostly because I don't like all the TVs on inside bars all the time. (Insert the animated GIF of Steve Carrell from "The Anchorman" going "LOUD NOISES!")

I also don't like faux Tiffany lamps. And dead plants. And college students. (Whatever, kids, I'm in my early-mid 30s now and I'm still bitter about the fact that the 90s are suddenly considered retro nostalgia. I do what I like.)

So all those factors together, I probably shouldn't really in any way like Yancy's, right? I should just stay home sitting on my piles of doilies and drinking from my teacups. Except, I actually really like beer and darts. And I like any place that without reservation will ply me with said beer (a pretty decent selection on tap, for your average sports bar) and let me have sharp, pointy objects I can throw around. This is amazing. Have you ever really given thought to the fact that potentially deadly weapons (if used correctly) are actually provided as a source of entertainment to people with decreased hand-eye coordination and lowered sense of, well, everything? That's what I call living dangerously.
author: Tanya F.

description: Yancy's is definitely one of my go to bars in the Sunset. This place gives you options and I like options. You can come chill by the bar and watch THE game, or come and create your own game of darts, or just screw all games and sit in the corner and enjoy an intimate conversation over a couple drinks and free popcorn.
author: Cindy A.

description:
I haven't been to many bars or pubs in the city, but Yancy's does the trick for me.
I'm not a big fan of beers, but when I came with a friend he ordered three different ones and I was pleasantly surprised with his choices. Still, I would never a beer to myself (just because I know I couldn't finish it all)
They have a full bar so it was able to accommodate for my non-beer needs. Drinks were well made and weren't too weak or watered down.
With me and my one friend, each round was $10. (He would get beers, I'd get a mixed vodka with juice)
Waitress was friendly.
Plenty of seating.
author: Jenna H.

description:
Yancy's is cash ONLY, folks.

What's great about Yancy's? Well.... they don't have a kitchen... BUT they do have a chunky folder of menus from restaurants in the area (mostly located at 9th & Irving)... which means... they allow any place to deliver TO the bar. Pretty awesome.

Ordered an extra large pizza from the corner pizzeria with a huge group of friends after a crazy evening at NightLife. Thursdays are the most packed nights at Yancy's. Generally a pretty young crowd.

No pool tables, but there are 3 dart boards. Just give the bartender your ID to check-out some darts.

Great place to drink some relatively cheap, STRONG whiskey drinks.

Be sure to grab a complimentary bowl of the slightly burned popcorn at the bar!
author: Drea B.

description: This place is pretty huge! Has plenty of flat screens, there are dart boards in the back, and a jukebox. The bartenders are really friendly and nice. Typical neighborhood bar that has a really laid back atmosphere. Yancy's is a good place to meet up with friends for a drink and to have chill night.
author: Elaine N.

description:
I think that this was the first bar that i ever went to in the city when i first came here for college.  This fact might have something to do with my 4 star rating for this random dusty bar in the inner sunset, but hey, it's my review.

Tons of hanging plants, lots of booze, a bazillion TVs, darts, and plenty of decorations to look at.  They even have a couple Pacman machines.  Great place to come during the week or on the weekends!

Also, the owner is super nice and so is the rest of the staff.  Love this neighborhood bar!
author: Laura P.

description: Love this place. Cheap drinks. Great ambiance. Friendly bartenders. My friends and I always catch a post season Giant's game here for good luck. Great service. Can get very crowded. CASH ONLY!
author: Nancy P.

description: I can't say enough nice things about this bar.  For starters, the place is massive so you rarely feel claustrophobic. I'm also pretty sure they have something like 20 TVs with just about every sports channel possible. As a transplant this is really nice for when I want to watch my Bruins or Red Sox. The drink selection is massive and changes periodically so you don't get tired of drinking the same thing over and over again. Finally, and this is the number one reason why I keep coming back, the staff is second to none.  The bartenders and waitresses here are some of the kindest and friendliest people I've come across in this city.  Just watch out for the Blue Haired Monster...
author: Jeff P.

description:
I live around the area, so this is probably my go to pub. Tons of TVs, great beers on tap and the bartenders are super friendly. I've never done it, but it looks like you can bring outside food in. I've seen lots of guys bringing in pizza from across the street to eat and drink at Yancy's. The darts in the back is cool, but there are a lot of drunks that play and can get dangerous...

All and all, I love coming to this place just to catch the baseball or basketball games. Oh and they have wi-fi which is awesome.
author: Cody M.

description:
07/14/12

It was my friends pre-birthday event day, and had drinks here. 

Wasn't anything special about the place, other than a good for groups vibe. There's a pizzeria next door that got our group hooked onto their pizza - I think that was more interesting then the bar itself - actually practically everyone in the bar had slices from the same pizzeria.
