Prices were decent, however it's a cash only place, sure there are three major banks on the same block (Wells Fargo, B of A, and Chase), people like me don't like to carry cash, in any case I had to go out just so that I could pay for my drink, my friends had to as well (It's a new day in age where people like plastic).

Oh in addition, our waitress was quite slow, we had to ask for her three times just to get our drinks.....hmmmm okay.
author: Alex C.

description:
Parking is okay-easy to find for SF.
Good prices for drinks.
Good for groups (:

Bathrooms are sorta clean, teehee.
author: Adorable T.

description:
Okay, so today I had to knock these guys down a peg because they were'nt open for the Italy vs Paraguay game.

What's up with that?  Looks like The Taco Shop at Underdog's for me.
author: Anthony D.

description: This place is a dive bar for younger people (think Asian Marina).  There were surprisingly a lot of Asians here but it was a good mix.  It got really crowded around 11-11:30p.  They ran out of three beers before our friend asked what they actually did have left, which was Sam Adams and the Oktoberfest blend.  Our waitress was really sweet and the bartenders were cool.
author: Chris L.

description: Awesome bar. Friendly bartenders. Loads of TV's playing sports. Cool local spot. Also popcorn, fuck yeah.
author: Jp L.

description:
Everytime I go here it is either sparsely crowded (any weeknight), or very crowded (any weekend night), no in-between. Besides barstools, there are plenty of chairs, tables, benches and even a sofa. It's a fun place since it's a mixture of divy bar and sports bar, with a youngish Gen-X and Gen-Y crowd from nearby SFSU, USF and probably some of CCSF. And due to the vicinity to UCSF, there seem to be more grad students than undergrads? And you'll even hear people - who would never karaoke - sing along at times to whatever happens to be playing on the jukebox. Either way, it's a bar for fun drinking, not drunk drinking.

For this Wednesday at least, happy hour had $1-off beers on tap (e.g., $5 for a pint of Bass Ale) and $3 well drinks. It was a somewhat good evening since the Giants won, the A's won, but the MLS All-Stars lost to the EPL's Everton in penalties - but it was due to the top-notch play of US soccer Men's National Team's starting goalkeeper Tim Howard (go Timmay!).
author: Peter L.

description: Yancy's is an interesting place. It's a huge bar that feels like a pub, but isn't. You can however order food and get it delivered to Yancy's with is pretty cool. Watch out though: they don't have silverware on hand.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
This is a decent neighborhood bar. They have a lot of TVs, so it's good for watching sports, especially on Sundays during the NFL season. They let you bring in food too, which is nice. I used to get a breakfast sandwich from Posh Bagel next door and bring it into Yancy's on NFL Sunday mornings.

They also have some dart boards, though the quality of the boards and darts are questionable. The 3 darts I got were mismatched, and the flights (ie. the plastic tails on the end) kept falling off. Also, there are no blackboards to keep score; only pen and paper.

Unfortunately, they are cash only...
author: Jang K.

description:
I'm somewhere between a 3 and a 4 for this place. I love the atmosphere, love the shit loads of seating, and lot the selection on tap. But there are sometimes you try to be nice about and just doesnt work, such as the slow service. The ridiculously slow service. And let me just explain why I'm annoyed by this.

Walking in with a group of ppl is hard, and finally getting a table is even more difficult. But here's the thing that gets me, being told by the waitress that we should order from her since those are her tables. Okay, that makes total sense, but she never comes. As in, she tells us she'll be with us in a moment, doesnt show up until 20 minutes later. We ask for more popcorn (which costs $1 jtlyk), she never delivers. At some point, we stopped ordering from her and basically just started going up to the bar and ordering ourselves. Let's be honest, when a girl wants her drank, a girl wants her drank. But in her defense, she was more attentive later on in the night, maybe its because the crowd died down or maybe because D and a few other friends were ordering more and more hard liquor.

Btw, they have cards. Sad side, the cards don't match. As in, they didn't have a 3 of diamonds, but had two 3 of hearts. What?
author: Jessica H.

description:
Nothing really that special about Yancy's. It's a very spacious bar with plenty of room for bigger groups. There are plenty of TV's that are mostly playing games of whatever season it's at. There's also 3 dart boards in the back. The saloon isn't anything fancy, but it seats enough people and a pretty chill place to kickback with some friends.

What I like about Yancys is that they let you bring in food from other places which is great when you have the munchies late at night. They also provide popcorn (no other food there). Good selection of beers, ones you would normally find at bars. I generally grab a sierra nevada. 

Downside is cash ONLY. Beers run for $5 a piece. Service is good, servers are always really nice and accommodating.
author: Angela K.

description: Awesome place to hang out groups.. Good people good vibes...also if you get hungry you can order pizza nearby.  I like the decor..random jungle, drinks and friendly peeps
author: Sandra S.

description: I live 4 blocks away. I come here for the major games and the drinks aren't outrageously priced like other places in the city. I would have given this place 4 stars gut guess what, they accept credit cards now!!!! So with that said, if you just wanna get a drink and bring your own food to enjoy a game, this is a good spot.
author: Yevgeniy K.

description:
Been here a few times, I've always found the crowd young & inexperienced drinkers. I got the feeling the staff could not handle a customer over 30 years of age.
Service was alright but then again I was sitting at the bar & I tip well.
Probably will come back, Maybe???
No credit cards = bummer
author: Jennifer R.

description: Nice neighborhood bar, great for bringing your own grub and watching the Dubs.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Yancys is a place that never fails! It has plenty of tvs and space to sit although it does get quite packed during the weekends. Their Guinness is always on point and have a large variety of mixed drinks like snake bite and Black and Tan. When I need a place to drink, I always come here! There's a nice pizza joint a few stores down too for those late night cravings!
author: Calvin Y.

description: Nothing special about this establishment. Just a nice local place to grab a drink and hang out. They have a bunch of TVs to watch any of the games on and 3 dart boards in the back and that's about it. No food. No surprises.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Very good place to go to watch NBA and baseball games.
PS : you can bring your own food inside.

Super endroit pour regarder les matchs de basket et baseball.
PS : vous pouvez amener votre propre nourriture!
author: Mark B.

description:
I LOVE YANCYS!!! Free popcorn, small divey sports bar, AWESOME bartendars, right in my backyard!?!? Yes please!

This place is a nice quaint little place to make either a nice pitstop or park it for the night

In the heart of the Inner sunset at 9th and Irving, toooons of great restaurants nearby.

If you havent been, you should try it at least once! The drinks are cheap and the bartendars pour heavy ;)
author: Julia D.

description:
CASH ONLY!  FULL BAR!  Woohoo?

If you show up without cash, like boy toy did this past weekend, then you better:
A) Hope for an awesome girlfriend (moi) who carries cash on her all the time
or
B) Walk across the street to the Wells Fargo ATM to get yourself some greenbacks.

We swung by here for the first time to grab some drinks w/ our buddies.  Parking is meter on the street - found one near the front after circling the block once.  

Friendly waitress who recommended some different mixed whiskey drinks.  She even brought us some complimentary popcorn as it got made.

Got an old Cheers bar feel to it with darker wood interior - comfy wood chairs - several tables to sit around & chat w/ old friends about weddings coming up, new jobs, gossip about mutual friends, etc.

Noise level was bearable w/ dart board games in the back.  No shouting required during the exchange of gossip.  TVs here & there on the walls.  

Cash register behind the bar is old school - literally with those circular buttons you punch downwards on individual levers (like old school typewriters) - should've taken a pix of it...wanted to take it home actually but it's so heavy, anyone trying to rob them would probably pull a muscle.

Would definitely come back here if we're ever in the neighborhood again.
author: Julia L.

description:
Always a seat at the bar for this area dive. $5 pints are about par for the city and the extensive selection makes this a go-to spot. 
An INSANE number of TV's make this great for watching sports and the FREE Wi-Fi makes Yancies a great stop for a study beer.
author: Chuck M.

description: Love that Yancy's allows you to bring in outside food! This is the ultimate hangout spot for UCSF student groups for that reasons this past Thursday they were hosting a fundraiser for a non-profit organization that does surgeries for uninsured people. How great is that? As a nurse I totally support that. The lovely waitress working hand also contributed, so sweet of her! One of the waitresses, Georgina, put the fundraiser together, awesome people work here! I had the best pear cider ever here and enjoyed it here for $4.50. Will definitely plan my next group event together.
author: Crys L.

description:
Don't order a Bloody Mary - their bartenders don't know how to make a good one. In fact, don't order any mixed drinks. Stick to beer.

Not a terribly inexpensive place given how dive-y it seems, and it's cash only, but there are giant flat screen TVs that show every single football game known to mankind on Sundays, so it gets three stars just for that. 

Sundays obviously gets very crowded and the patrons don't leave until all the games are done so it's hard to find a spot if you don't get there early enough. It's pretty roomy, though, and the atmosphere is mellow, despite the fact that it's filled with football-loving dudes.

Oh, and it's a total sausage fest, but the guys are too wrapped up in football and various bromances to be hitting on you.
author: Logan The H.

description:
Oh, good ol' Yancys:) I live right around the corner and this is definitely my favorite bar in the inner sunset. I don't think I have ever been into a bar as cozy as this one. It is so warm and inviting. It's very big and spacious with dim lighting. The bartenders are very nice and they always remember you. I usually spend every Sunday here watching football. They have the best drink specials on sundays btw for football season. There is T.V.s all over the bar so you never miss a second of the game. 

I love coming to Yancys with a big group of friends, order a pizza from Milanos and just kick back and spend hours there. 

The music here is really fun too. Its the only place where you can be listening to Journey at one moment and the very next song will be Dr dre or ice cube. I'm pretty sure I went there last night and the place broke into a sing along of Santeria. Loved it!
author: Cindy E.

description:
I've heard some not so good things about this place, but decided to give it a go. 

Male bartender was rude and short with us. Will not return.
author: Nathan D.

description:
I've been to a couple pubs in SF and I thought this place would fit the same category: dark, cold, filled with old white men that had beer bellies. However, I was pretty surprised this place had quite a few young adults my age.

I really like the environment in Yancy's Saloon. There were a lot of seating areas that made it nice to sit back and chit chat with good company. They also had a lot of T.V.s set up at the bar and a big screen in the back with more seating areas fit for larger parties. I also like the fact that they set up 3 dart boards at the back. Even though half the time my darts hit everywhere but the board, it was still pretty fun to play against friends. Definitely a game of luck instead of skill. 

Anyway, the only thing I didn't enjoy was my candy cane martini. I should have expected the drink to taste no where near like the sweet midori sour a friend ordered, but I like trying drinks with interesting names. Overall, it was a good night! I was already in a good mood because the Lakers won against the Knicks, and the martini made my mood even better by giving me a good buzz.
author: Michelle R.

description:
They pour a mean cranberry juice.  I'm worthless now that I don't drink anymore.  I won't dance on the table tops.  I won't slip and fall on my way to the bathroom.  I won't smear my makeup all over your nice shirt.  I didn't do that when I did drink, but now, the chances of seeing the above mentioned things are scant.  But I'll always be the designated driver. 

Yancy's has a terrific front room.  It's awkwardly small with a ridiculously large flat screen TV.  Right in front of the ridiculous TV are 4 bar stools.  If you sit at those seats and try to watch the TV, your neck will never straighten and your eyes will be perpetually crossed.  But a little farther away are two intimate tables and a separate bar-height table.  For bootleggers?  Back when prohibition was cool?  Maybe for card games?  What is the purpose of that slim, bar height table that was packed to the underarms with Bulgarians.  

I was there on Sunday and I don't think they were really Bulgarians.  They might have been Russian.  In college, there was a sizable Bulgarian population sent over by the Bulgarian government to learn our countries top nuclear secrets and chemical engineering.  Sitting next to this group on Sunday reminded me of college.  Except that these guys did not smell.  Nor were they listening to polka.  

It was warm inside.  There were some drunk people cheering on Tebow.  Tom Brady is not aging well.  Green Bay suffered their first defeat.  We brought pizza over from Pasquales and it was delicious.  I guess I review "bar atmosphere" now.  I look over the interior design with my shrewd eye.  Or is it my shrew eye?  I don't imagine shrews have very good eyesight.  

I like watching cable.  But I don't have cable at home.  So I go to places that have cable.  And in exchange, I order a sad, lonely cranberry juice which I can nurse for 4 hours.  Yancy's did not give me the hairy eyeball for being such a square.  Thumbs up.
author: Christina C.

description:
Where can you watch Dora the Explorer, NHL, and NASCAR all in the same place?  

Here!

And you know what, coffee + alcohol tastes exactly what you might expect except that your drunkenness might not hit until all of a sudden later. 

And now you're prepped to rumble in the Inner Sunset.
author: Kenny L.

description:
Yancy's... What can I POSSIBLY say about this place? I LOVE IT HERE.

It is indeed a sports bar, but to me, it's so much more. This is my all-time favorite bar right now and I think it will be for a while. I am only out there a few times every couple months, but whenever I am there, I have some of the best nights ever.

Something about it just makes you feel so comfortable. I guess it's because you are allowed to bring food here.. lol 

Only down side is that they are CASH ONLY. Kind of sucks, but I guess it's not so bad for me since Wells Fargo is across the street. Reason for my 4 instead of 5 stars.

The bartenders and servers are awesome. I've had a secret crush on Doug ;P lol jk

Come here with the right crowd and you are guaranteed a great time.

i LOVE how they have 151, Hypnotq & Redbull! Not many places have all 3 of these.
author: Heidi C.

description:
I'd never have walked in had it not been sponsored by my company for happy hour, because I'm just not a dive bar kind of girl. 

But this place was kind of surprising; they have a cute little nook in the back where you can sit and play darts - 3 dart boards, pick up the darts from the bar. Also, the bartenders are surprisingly attentive compared to other dive bars I've been to. 

For a dive bar, it really isn't so bad, I just wish the area by the bar was more spacious so I wouldn't have to fight to get a beer.
author: Jess C.

description:
Yeah!
Nice beer on tap (isn't Guinness a must?)  
Decent selection of whiskey and whisky (you know the difference, right?)

Quite a large place.  Ample room at the bar, some tables and a banquette in the back.  Plus, the dart board area is set up nicely.  Well-lit and safely separated, but not completely secluded.  

We visited on a rainy Tuesday, but it probably gets busy on a weekend.
author: Ken B.

description: Good for groups. Lots of TVs for games. Lots of seating. Good selection of beer. No pool tables but they have darts!
author: Gabriella T.

description:
Your typical neighborhood sports bar. Spacious with lots of TVs, also large selection of beers on draft.

Not sure how popular it is in the weekend but pretty empty on a weekday night.
author: F. P.

description:
Yancy's always comes to mind when I'm thinking of a large enough place to accommodate a bigger group. It's always a very relaxed diverse atmosphere. The only bad thing is that it's CASH only. Shots are poured relatively a standard size, drinks are a bit on the lighter side, and service is great. They waitress is always attentive when ordering from tables, in fact they ask YOU if you want anything more to drink, which is usually a yes!

They have TVs all over the bar showing different sport games going on and a dart's room for entertainment. For me, I use this spot to kick back with my friends and just enjoy each others company. It definitely provides us that opportunity, and we always have a good time. The bar is a bit more old school, if you're looking for one of those new hyped up modernized bars with house/hip hop music.. this is not the place. However, if you just looking to hangout on tables or a couch, a spacey area, grab a couple drinks and watch the game, this is a place to checkout.
author: Austin N.

description:
Dear Yancy's:

Thank you for putting up with us. 

Sincerely, 

Drunk Chick who wouldn't stop walking all over your tables.
author: Jaime L.

description: Came here with my coworkers after dinner on a Friday for the first time. Place was starting to get packed around 7. A good mix of people here, so you'll fit in usually and won't feel awkward like other bars that seem to be predominantly one ethnicity. Service seemed friendly and was quick with the drinks. Pretty clean looking bar and very roomy. They even have 3 dart boards in the back that you and your group can play with... which was pretty fun. Definitely will come back!
author: Johnson S.

description:
This was the perfect place for a bunch of dirty, rambunctious, drunk Yelpers to meet.  The ones that took 3 hours to walk 3 miles.  But 3 liters of margarita and 2 liters of vodka + electrolytes later, this is where we settled down to stuff our face with hot delicious pizza.

They score high for hosting us, for being quick on the drink and for having clean bathrooms.  Minus a point for no pitchers and not taking credit cards.  If I were one those naked runners, where would I have been able to hide a wade of cash?  I'd also just walked 3 miles with a meter of alcohol strapped to my back, it seemed such a downgrade to have to drink out of a pint glass.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
Nice local bar. Very laid back. Its got a good hometown feel to it. Plenty of tables and seats and tvs everywhere. Great for getting a drink, some food, and watching a game. Theres always a good friendly crowd there and the bartenders are all very nice. If you sit at the tables, there are also waiters that come around to serve you. It doesn't get too crowded except on the weekends occasionally. 

You can bring your own food in. Theres darts and a jukebox. Decent selection of beers on draft. Great for watching local sports teams. Its not like marina bars where people go to get hammered and dance around. Much more down to earth bar. 

Cash only

49ers Super Bowl XLVII!!
author: Arthur C.

description:
Great bar in a great neighborhood. I'm a simple man. I require a bar to have three things

1 - cheap beer
2 - large tvs that have basketball / football / soccer on
3 - man food (or the ability to bring in your own food

I plopped down after bay to breakers with a ton of yelpers and I watched the Cavs v Celtics game. 

I ordered some drinks and brought in some mexican from La Fonda next door and nobody said anything. 

It's a large space and I would definitely go back if I were in the neighborhood.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Fun bar.  The crowd is young for me, but a good bar nevertheless.

Great bartenders and fair prices.

Lots of people on many nights and free darts.  If you don't like an Irish Bar you probably won't like Yancy's.  

If you are 21 to 27 then this is probably a must see if you like fun casual bars.
author: Brian J.

description:
If you're looking for a local sports bar, this is the place to go for playoff games. 

I've gone here for Warriors, Giants and Niners games and the comrauderie here is amazing. From when the Giants won the World Series to the Niners beating the Saints, you will no doubt be high fiving random strangers and even the bartenders. With that in mind, you must get to the bar probably a good hour and a half before the actual game starts if you want a good seat to watch the game. Would recommend even finding bar seating so that you don't have to wait for the waitress during those times it is so extremely packed full of patrons wanting to quench their thirst while screaming at the top of their lungs at all the screens. 

There is definitely a lot of tvs for you to not miss any part of the game. If you did miss something, it's your own fault for looking away. The staff here is great. Whether you're sitting at the bar or at the tables provided, you don't go too long with out a drink. With the exception of busy times, so like I said above sit at the bar if you don't want to wait too long. 

There isn't food here but you can bring any outside food that you want. So you can't go wrong with a slice a pizza down the street, shwarma across the street or even for the brave, Naan n Curry down the way also. 

Overall would definitely recommend for people that want to enjoy the game at a local bar with fans that are as emotionally attached to the game as you are.
author: Yvonne T.

description:
Doesn't it feel like you're in a giant living room having drinks with a ton of different people?! Definitely get the living room vibe from Yancy's which is pretty cool/unique since it's a sports bar. It's spacious, has a ton of mini tvs and one giant tv in the back and you'll see lots of green plants hanging around with frames all over the walls.  You can order from the bar or grab a table and wait for the waitress to walk by and order drinks from them. 

Another cool thing about Yancy's is the dartboards in the back area which is really popular and even has two video game tables near the big tv. They let people bring in their own food because they don't serve anything except popcorn if they have any cooked. 

They have a jukebox and it's AWESOME.
author: Arnold N.

description:
Atmosphere = cozy and hopping

Seating = plentiful, but old schtuff!

Drinks = decently priced...and refreshing!

We descended here with the rest of Yelpers after B2B! 

Parking = a real S.O.B. per the usual crap of Irving/N-Judah line.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Yancy's is a fun place to watch a game and hang out with your friends. It's not dark and depressing during the day...I hate dark bars when I'm trying to watch a sports game (except the old Brennan's in Berkeley, RIP). I have a few friends that like this place and still hang around the Sunset/Richmond..

I don't go there very often, but my experiences have always been good. They've never complained when I brought in food from Gordo's, so Burritos+booze is a definite possibility.
author: Peter F.

description:
Recently my SF Inner Sunset cherry was popped (can you believe that I've lived in the bay all my life?) and my "first time" experience was at Yancy's. 

Immediately stepping inside, I felt like this was a familiar place. There is a fairly large seating area that reminds me of a friends living room. Not only does it accomodate to small parties, but fairly larger crowds with the sofas, which are perfectly aligned with their tvs. 

Yancy's obviously knows how to do a body good with the oh so inviting bar. Just the decor alone had me feeling so relaxed and ready to take off my jacket and order a drink. (talk about a good first experience, whew) 

She kept me entertained with not only by surrounding me with tvs, but also free popcorn* and even the people watching was fun. There are dart boards and even arcade games so I got to take a breather and play pac man. 
One major plus: This place is diverse, with all walks of life. Young, old, chill, business casual... I found myself sitting next to a doctor munching on mex food from across the way. Totally random, but totally cool.

5 stars for Yancy's. 
+ 1 more star because I was with good company that night and couldnt be any happier:)

Yaaah! My first 6 star review!



*one of my loves: popcorn. read my profile and you will know.
author: Christina D.

description: God I love this bar. It's not the spot to go for a crazy or dramatic night, but it's great for a casual night of drinks, especially with a large party. Very spacious inside with a laid-back feel. No food is sold here but they let you bring any food inside you obtained from elsewhere. Sunday's are my favorite. Cheap PINTS of bloody Mary's and free popcorn, plus darts!!! The music selection is also pretty funny and always a wild card.
author: Liz W.

description:
Ah Yancy's.

#1) Lots of space.
#2) Lots of TVs.
#3) Lets you bring in food from other places.
#4) $5-6 for beers
#5) 3 Darts boards in the back, be sure to check in your ID for the darts though.

I've had a lot of memories of this place, and I have to say it is a great place for reunions and kickbacks with several people.  You can come in and out and it's really lax.  I remember going here for the Giants vs Phillies prior to the 2010 world series and this place was packed and crackin'!!  Everyone had good vibes and I'm very pleased to have this bar in the northern sunset section.  

One thing that may be a bit difficult is the parking situation.  You may have to park a bit or circle around a bit to find a spot.  Otherwise, it's a great place.  Pasqual's is nextdoor, so usually if a friend buys a huge round of beers, and you can tell everyones hitting that post buzz level... If you drop $30 for a pizza everyone will admire you.. haha!  I definitely would come back here!!

The bathrooms are definitely not the cleanest in the world, but you have to expect that when you have people who can't handle their alcohol in there everyday.

Enjoy!
Morris
author: Morris C.

description:
Yancy's is a kiddie bar.  I almost wanna say it's a teeny bopper bar.  It's the bar where most first time drinkers lose their alcohol virginity and idealism.

On weekdays between noon and 7pm, it's a great place to study as it's empty, quiet, and void of distraction.  Because the service is slower than evolution, it's the perfect place to be if you do not want to be bothered by a waitress who really couldn't care less if you wanted service.  This is an example of where bad service can actually be benefiical to one's education.

There's a dartboard and they have dice available.  The interior slightly stairs up to a seating area with a few couches and tables.

Sometimes, George and the Wonders perform reggae music.  Not sure if they still come around.

It's usually a good first bar to meet at or last bar to go to when the night's over.  If you are a college student, you will love this bar and most probably will give it 5 stars.

I've never had a meaningful conversation here.  Well, I remember once many years ago someone was trying to convince me that the Rocky Horror Picture Show was the greatest movie of all time.

It didn't help my hangover pondering that the next morning.
author: Tony U.

description: I've been here a few times and it's ok, nothing special. I came in here once around 1am after being at other bars in the area and they tried to charge me $9 for a vodka redbull. Um, I think not. I highly doubt that is the regular price and so I felt like the bartender was trying to take advantage of me because I was already drunk and it was getting close to last call. I didn't appreciate that and I haven't been back since. Why go there when there are much better bars literally on the same block.
author: Kelsey L.

description:
How could I have not written a review for my dear Yancy's? I've been going to this pub for years. Never disappoints.  Want to socialize? Grab a table with some friends. Into sports? Tons of flat screens to watch the game. Like puzzle games? Play the naked photo hunt game (those of you who know know what I'm talking about haha). Challenge someone to darts. Something for everyone here.

There's something about the people who go to Yancy's. Everyone's so friendly and laid back. The music played is via jukebox and I must say that I've never gone on a night where patron's choose bad music. Looking for a pub with a "local" feel that also packs the good times? Grab some friends (as I recommend going in a group) and go to Yancy's. Another fun one for the books.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
Used to kick it here at night. Good place to drink as long as it doesn't get too crowded. Been coming here to watch the Giants games since they have a huge TV in the back and have the sound on. Good thing about this place is they let you bring food in so you can grab a pizza from outside and eat it there. 

Sucks thats its cash only since we always end up drinking more than anticipated....resulting in us having to walk to another bar that accepts CC.
author: Gary K.

description:
Although I walk by here quite frequently I had never been inside until this past Friday night.  I found myself here with some old friends and new as we said goodbye to an old friend before she journeys back to her native England.  It's a bar, and it was packed.  What can I say?  With several televisions going simultaneously with sound and all, rock music blaring out overhead and the conversations of many this was noise at an inaudible level in the worst way.  

The bartender was cool and poured some great beers, the overworked waitress was friendly and cool and the beer from tap was not too bad at 4.50 to 5 bucks a glass.  Hey, after a few beers you'll eventually have to walk away and irrigate the porcelain.  The men's room was squeaky clean.  Heck yeah I was surprised!  Darts, Pac Man, walls full of framed art and/or photos and what's with all of the potted plants which adorn the walls?  Definitely a little bit of everything here!  Popcorn is passed around intermittently ... great way to meet a stranger as you attempt to snag a fistful of popcorn from him/her.  Good vibes all around.

To my friend Sally T just in case she ever reads this ... I'm gonna miss you, dear.  And ONLY because Sally picked Yancy's for her farewell night I'm adding stars.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
While bars often change hands several times throughout the years, IF this bartender is the same, this is a hateful place, plain and simple.

Look, even if you assume my friends and I were the worst customers this bartender has ever seen (which we were not. we were rowdy, but not mean or crazy,  and our "rowdy" is really pathetic compared to what a real group of drinkers can be,) there would still be no reason for him to call my wife the c-word.

He did call her that, as we tried to apologize if our friends had been to loud. Even though she was very respectful. (The only real reason our friends were "loud" was that they called last call at midnight on a Friday night. They forced us and the other patrons to chug drinks we had just ordered and get out.)

There is more to the story that would make the bartender look even worse, including e-mails he has written us in response to these reviews that are very incriminating, but they are not appropriate, nor needed here.

Until that bartender is fired, there really is no good reason to frequent this bar, as there are plenty of other great establishments nearby (Shamrock's, Fireside Lounge, Mucky Duck)

Beyond all this, their drinks are badly made, and they frequently close hours before their listed closing time. It is bad business. Even if they didn't employ sexist insulting employees.
author: Ed R.

description:
Honestly, nothing wowed me about this place. The waitress was nice, but not very attentive, which is ridiculous since it was 8PM and only seven other people were there. Another thing that bothered me was the fact that they couldn't make the drink I wanted. Okay, does no one else in the world like mango and Malibu? I make it all the time, but I have never been to a bar that has mango nectar handy! The waitress suggested Malibu and pineapple instead, so I was like, whatevs, fine. It was good--tasted like a pina colada, which isn't all that special. 

So anyway, she brought out the drinks and the total was about $27. There were five of us, so we asked how much each separate drink costs since some people had beers and others, mixed drinks.  She stood there dumbfounded. Excuse me, you work here, so shouldn't you know? Just sayin'

I'm not gonna lie; had I been given my mango and Malibu, I would've given this place 2.5 stars (yea, I'm a whiny little bitch, I know). Btw, it's cash only--just a heads up.
author: Audrey T.

description:
An ode to Yancy's:

A home away from home,
but better because you have NFL Sunday Package.
Sofas
Cheap drinks
and I can even bring in pizza from Arizmendi.

Yancy's, you are the neighborhood bar
where dreams
come true.
Thank you.

I love this place because I don't have to look cute to come here. I can bring homework to do during half time. I can watch all the games, and the TVs are even labeled so I know exactly where to sit during the first game so that I'm in prime position if my game is the afternoon game. I love that.

Also, you won't like this place if you're looking for crazy fancy delicious beers. Pretty much just Blue Moon, Coors Lite, and other crap like that. But, the price is right and the people are chill. Ultra awesome neighborhood dive bar.

PS - you might feel a little dirty after sitting on the couches, but I just consider that bonus points.
author: Theresa P.

description: This place is swarming with college students and high school kids even? There's a lot of room which is great for groups but all this place really serves are common beers and very basic cocktails. There's nothing really special about it. Its loud and cluttered with tvs everywhere. There's free popcorn I guess and you can sit and the waiters will come around and take your order so that can be a good thing. Also they let you order Pizza from other places to get delivered so you can eat it there which I've never done. I just feel like Yancy's is a little generic and its where kids go to be kids. It could be so much more, but it isn't.
author: Dexter H.

description: It is what it is. Decent beer selection, prices exactly what you'd expect, a good number of TVs and tables. It's a good place to go and relax and have a drink, but nothing more.
author: Louis D.

description: Wicked place to work if you don't mind that it's a bar, so there will be music. Very quiet during the day and free WiFi. Awesome decor makes it less boring than a standard cafe for working at.
author: Clutch R.

description:
cool decor. professional dart boards (not electronic). lots of seating. 

still not sure if they serve food cuz there are so many tables. so roomy i like that!

didn't get a chance to have the free popcorn people are talking about though :(

slow service and they only take cash...lame
author: Elaine Y.

description: Fun dive bar with lots room for seating.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Great beer selection. I am a huge fan of good beers on tap for an affordable price. I usually get something different every time I'm there.

Oh, and not a fan of beer? They have Strongbow Cider on tap. It's basically an alcoholic Martinelli's cider, that sparkling apple cider you used to have with Thanksgiving dinner when you were underaged. It's cold, crisp, and full of that good appley goodness. It's a great summer drink.
author: Gun-Ik P.

description:
Yancy's is one of those bars that are just nice to have around.  There are no pretentious people there and it's super convenient being off the N-Judah line and a ton of great restaurants to choose from.  Because of their VERY limited food menu, it's totally normal and expected for you to bring your own grub from the nearby eateries and sit it down to one of their draft beers.

It was pretty slow the past Sunday despite the 49ers v. Raiders game showing on the big screen.  You can't beat playing darts too!  With only one person working, be expected to pick up your own drinks at the bar and bring them back to your table.  Then again, that's what makes Yancy's the way it is.
author: Teri C.

description:
OK This is the place to watch Big Time events such as the NBA Finals. Yes ,with the plasma TV amongst the foilage and those great looking bar tenders. Yup yup this is the place to be. Plus hot popcorn.

The crowd was a good mix, it did not look like the BMW crowd there, Thank God I think they all went to Cow Hollow.
Enthusiastic crowd...some Laker fans with full on Laker garb, I was looking for the Laker Nikes.  The guys with their Boston Celtics green.

This is the place to be!!!! I will be there come football time.
author: Jim D.

description:
Unfortunately my first review ever is a bad one.  This happened when FIFA was going on.  My friends (group of about 20-25) and I have literally dropped thousands of dollars at this place.  We've been coming here for many years and some of the staff recognize us to the point where they know our drink orders.  But the bartender, the bald bulky guy, is such a jerk.

We were watching a rerun of the soccer game just like everyone else and the bartender comes up and changes it to Giants vs. Red Sox game.  We called ahead to see if the soccer game was going to be on the big screen so we were shocked.  He changed it back when we made a fuss.  Giants scored 3 in the first inning so he came back and changed the channel.  We moved and were a little upset and talked trash to the people next to us who were also watching the soccer game.

Okay, so did say the bartender was an "a-hole" but it wasn't to his face and it wasn't loud so I suspect he was watching us because all of sudden he was in my friends' face telling him to "f-off" and that he was the "a-hole".  My friend, he's the nicest guy in the world and it's hard to get mad at him with his boyish charm.  What this guy did is akin to kicking a puppy.

I wanted to dump my drink on the floor and walk out but I actually like everyone else that works there.  I don't know if this guy is the manager or owns the place but it's a wonder why he isn't gone by now.  So the stand off begins.  Until that guy leaves we're not going back.
author: Ashley I.

description:
Been here once and another time for the NFC divisional playoff game for niners vs saints. Crowd was awesome and juiced!

Beers are pretty cheap and atmosphere is chill. They have a pretty big bar area and lots of tables for people to sit. PLENTY of TV's but too bad they aren't bigger than they are right now. Parking sucks, but you can get lucky by parking at GGP for 3hour zone. 

Drinks are good and cheap here, cant complain! big ups to the bartenders!
author: Kenny L.

description: Cool chill bar, feels like a garden inside with the many flowers and vines hanging from the ceiling. Service could be better though.
author: Zach M.

description:
When you walk in, it smells old, like a saloon I guess. the bartenders are friendly and if it's quiet, you get to see their personalities more. dart boards are cool and if you want a quickly, the bathroom is in the back. (this couple totally went back there while me and some friends were playing darts) lol 

cool place and I had fun.
author: A L.

description:
Good for watching the occasional game, but otherwise full of bros. 

It's like a little bit of the Marina in the Inner Sunset.
author: Dave S.

description: Good atmosphere! Decent. Usic a more funny eclectic oldies taste. Good drink that went too expensive $5 on a Saturday. Darts, light tournament Style games. Nice access to the sochi. Olympics on a huge gigantic tv...
author: Giulia B.

description: This place is pretty packed on weekends.  To my surprise, it was fairly roomy.  Now, I have to knock down one star because it does not take credit cards.  Even though there are about two atm/ banks in the walking distance.... (what if you did not carry your debit card that day?) sucks for ya... Oh I think there's only one stall for the bathrooms as I saw there was a long line.  anyways, I heard you can order food to this place or bring in pizza, snacks, etc.  That's awesome I say.   Drinks are not watered down, quite strong.  Decent price about $6.50+ (forgot).  There are a few bars around too, so bar hopping is recommended if this place gets too crowded.
author: Ann L.

description: Younger crowd. Irish/sailor wood decor. Every cultural group represented. Good seating options, double row of bar stools, booths, long tables. Lots of space. Lots of TVs. 3 dart boards. 20 taps. Full liquor. Comfortable, social, fun, chill atmosphere.
author: Brian L.

description: One of my fave bars in the Sunset. You can bring food in. Tv's everywhere and just chill atmosphere. Darts are fun and the bartenders/waitresses are always nice. It's a local bar with Tvs all over. Reminds me of a Cheer's kind of place.
author: Jamie B.

description: Went here on a Sunday night, it was moderately packed, which is not bad on a Sunday. The service was great, considering there was only one bartender managing the whole place that night. Beers were $5. Mixed drinks were about $8, which isn't bad because the drinks were strong. It is a pretty calm bar where you would come with your posse and just have a drink or two or three.. And have great conversations, rather than a bar where you get drunk n get ratchet on the dance floor. There is no dance floor here, but there is a area to play darts and the darts are free to rent out.  The crowd was people in their early twenties n like one lady having a mid-life crisis at the bar.
author: Bryant D.

description:
What everyone says is true.  It a cool, laid back bar.  And they have 3 dart boards!  That is kinda awesome.  And popcorn which is also cool.

This place is huge!  Its like a warm, cosy, nicer than dive bar.  More places should be like this.  Casual. 

I feel like this is the perfect place to come if you are torn between staying home but want to be out.  Its the perfect in-between.
author: Alexis B.

description: Good bar with a nice happy hour from opening until 7. I'm a big fan of the darts -- and free popcorn is good too -- but they only get three stars because many times the bartenders are aloof or inattentive, or just generally not very welcoming.
author: Pilan C.

description:
And just when you thought a place couldn't get worse... I visited this "fine" establishment again and wouldn't feel right with out sending an update.

The bartenders are "fine".
The smell inside is "fine".
Marina in the Sunset.. wow thats "fine".
The crowd here always seems to be "fine" too.

Now replace "fine" with "crappy" and you'll know how I really feel.

I no longer want to meet anyone there if they wanted to go. Maybe I'm just a little old for this bar (I'm 34) but whatever the reason... You can keep it.
author: Joel H.

description:
It's an OK local bar. If you really just live around the area and don't wanna drive out to a better spot.

Not my kinda bar so... dunno how helpful this will be.

-Don't go there if you want to hear good music.
-Crowd is kind of lame
-I've experienced... a better atmosphere for sure

Don't think I'll go back. Just not my kinda place.
author: Tania C.

description:
Best dive bar in Inner Sunset.  Hands down.

It took me awhile to come visit this place, which is sad considering my neighbor is a bartender here.  But one night a friend and I, in desperate need of a drink and venting session, came here.  We sat down at the bar and were greeted with laid back service.  There was no pushing to get us to buy more, we just sat and talked, drinking our drinks as we went.  The windows were open, letting in the crazy fog the Sunset is known for.  Finally, after a few hours we left, full of alcohol and with lighter shoulders.  Yancy's, I salute you.
author: Jen K.

description:
Came here last night with a buddy who rarely strays from the Richmond. The service was attentive and the waitresses were very easy on the eyes. I've been here plenty of times and I don't have a problem with the establishment as much as I do with the patrons. Just a little too fratty for me. But a cozy place to have a drink and watch a game, when you're in the mood.

More like 3.5 stars.
author: Art O.

description:
Yancy's gets 4 Stars for: 

*Lots of TV's for your sports viewing pleasure 
*Spacious interior with plenty of places to sit & people watch 
*3 Dart boards for some drunken dart throwing action 
*Old school video game console with classics like Burger Time, Centipede, Donkey Kong, Super PacMan, Space Invaders and many others...@ only .25 per game! 
*You can BYOF which is AWESOME! I chowed down a healthy chicken salad from La Fonda (few doors up) to offset my calorie induced boozing 
*Stiff drinks always a plus 
*Friendly & attentive servers 

Overall, great dive bar in a great location surrounded by plenty of food options! 

Oh yeah...It's cash only place so make sure you hit up the ATM beforehand. There's a Wells Fargo directly across the street in case you forget but DAMN! The $3.00 ATM fee blows!
author: Ally C.

description: This bar is chill. We came here one night to watch some basketball. Bartenders are cool but there is some favoritism towards females. I was waiting for a beer and I had my hand up and there was a group of ladies who walked up next to me and put their hand up and the bartender walked right past me to the ladies. WTF bro, there goes a tip. I would rather get my drinks myself and tip the bartender but there is a waitress and I don't need my drinks brought to me unless I'm already drunk. Place is big and has lots of tables but we went on a busy night so all we could get was a tiny table so it was a squeeze. Cheap drinks. That's what I want, then I went out to the club.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Yancy's is a favorite watering hole in my circle of friends but I don't see what's so special about it. The bartender was rude to some guys next to me trying to order drinks and I had to tell him my order of 4 drinks 5 times until he remembered them, and it was incorrect. The prices are a little high too, especially for an all cash bar where they don't pay fees for debit/credit cards.

Some good aspects of Yancy's are the dart boards and the amount of space the bar has. They fit a lot of people into that bar! 

I'm not going to plan a night around going to Yancy's but if my friends want to go there I'll suggest other places.
author: Kate J.

description: I came here to play darts.  They have a good beer selection.  Good neighborhood dive bar.
author: Ben M.

description:
Favorite bar :)

you will definitely have a good time at Yancy's
the bartenders are all great!
author: Kathy G.

description: I'm starting to understand why people like to go to bars rather than someone's house to drink.  You go for the environment and being able not care about how loud you are.  Yancy is definitely the place to go if you want to go to a place that's not too packed yet not too empty.  The bartenders doesn't really have any tricks to show you while making your drinks, but they provide service to you at a timely manner.  The beers on tap are only 5 bucks compared to other places which are 5 bucks only during happy hour.  I'm not so sure about the mixed drinks though.  They also give out FREE popcorn.  If you ever get bored of the people you're with, just play some darts or talk to people.
author: Steven S.

description:
After living in London for 5 months.. I became addicted to Strongbow, the bud light of cider. They even come in the soda liter plastic bottles over there, how great is that? Amazing.. anyways how this relates to Yancy's is that they have it on TAP! HALLELUJAH!!! I was in heaven when I discovered I live only two blocks from Strongbow on tap... lovely.

Yancy's is a great place. They have darts, huge TVs, popcorn for free snacking and they play great music. Also local pizza places such as Pasquale's Pizza (get the pesto cheese bread, appetizer) will delivery to the bar! You can bring in your own food. It was a great spot to watch the world series, you just had to get their 2 hrs in advance though. 

If you haven't tried strongbow...... go to Yancy's.

-JF
author: Jenna F.

description: It's also a good place to relax during the day since the front of the bar is open, allowing fresh air to circulate. Lots of hanging plants, some Tiffany lamps to add color and a skylight too. Service is okay. Good people watching spot.
author: Cathy K.

description: Yancy's is big, with big tables and lots of seats. Their beer selection is not so great. It's a good place for groups, and sports, and group sports. Also drinking.
author: Jordan P.

description: I don't know much about the bars back home, but my friends seem to have found all the chill local ones. After getting dinner in the Mission, we headed over to Yancy's to see the gang. This place has a very welcoming vibe. The wall decor and ferns everywhere gives this neighborhood bar a very homey feel, which is the idea I suppose. It was also my first time seeing an actual area dedicated for darts, which is pretty cool. There were makeshift tables from old school tabletop video arcades. This place also has plenty of flat screens to satisfy my sports score curiosities and the draft beer comes pretty cheap. It seems like a great place to unwind and catch up with friends after a long week at work.
author: Bailey Z.

description: Not a bad place to grab a pint.  Decent enough happy hour.  I like the place because it's along the N-line, right at 9th avenue stop so you can jump off the train have a couple of beers and go out and catch the next train.  Unfortunately, I've done that on more than a few occasions.  Plus you can walk around the corner and grab a great burrito at Gordo Taqueria for the ride home.
author: Jason Y.

description:
In 2009, I went through a very big Yancy's phase.  Loved it and I even spent my 23rd birthday here.

I've never actually sat through a game here but it seems like it would be a great place to go to as they have a good enough amount of TVs scattered around the room.  They only have 1 really big one and its towards the back.

They don't serve food here but you are able to bring your own!  Spent a friend's birthday here and we were able to bring boxes of pizza from across the street :)

It's chill and they've got a full bar with great beers on tap.  Cash only but at least that just  means I won't spend as much.

Haven't been here in quite some time since I've moved out of the city and I don't hang out with the same people as I used to but hopefully one day I'll be back.
author: Alyssa S.

description: Nice bar with a few dart boards available. Good beer selection. Lots of restaurants nearby yup grab a burrito or something afterwards.
author: Nicole S.

description:
this has become my go to place on weekends.....

1 star for internet jukebox that can download pretty obscure selections...

1 star for the really cool bartender/staff

1 starfor the cute tasty pasty gals that frequent the place

1 star for letting me loiter and crowd watch/surf with only one drink purchase

1 star for being complimented on my jukebox song selections twice

1 star for the many decent sized tv's tuned into sports related stuff

1 star for the dart playing area in the back

1 star for the spaciousness

1 star for the lighting...love the lighting....not too dark so everyone seems attractive but not so bright wehre you can notice the peach fuzz on the gals....altho on second thought peach fuzz is a supa turn on for me...so mayb turn up the lights just a bit?

so there u have it that adds up to 5 stars.......(and one last star for getting me this faded)
author: Sang L.

description: Pretty cool bar, came here with some friends to have fun on a Friday night. Drinks are cheap, only 5 dollars, and really liked the old school cash register. Bartenders were nice, and be warned, it is a very popular bar so might be difficult finding a table, and it does get really stuffy inside.
author: Victor L.

description:
Yancy's is the one bar i go to almost all the time. great atmosphere, great staff (always a plus), and as always a great crowd. there may be times where the crowd or the vibe isn't that great, but the bartenders know where to pull through. i love this place. i have been going there for the past 3 yrs as my spot of choice. my friends and i always find ourselves here. something about the bar is so compelling to bring your friends.

Yancy's always and forever will be one of the bars that i know that i will never have doubts about. and if you are a frequent patron such as myself, u will see me there, i am always there to watch a game or just there to meet new people and to hang out with friends that I'm there with.

the Cash-Only part is a partial downer, but... if you're there to have a good time... its definitely well worth it. Cheers to Alan, Sandro, Doug and Erin for making my past few yrs there, the best it could ever be =]
author: Charlie F.

description: STRONG drinks, nice atmosphere, friendly and engaging bartender and SPACE!!
author: Em L.

description: Went there early 7ish on a Saturday night so were able to sit at one of the tables to be able to play darts in the back. You will have to leave your credit card or id with the bartender in order to get the darts. Noticed that people were ordering pizza next door and bringing it in to eat. Overall it's a nice place to chill
author: Judy P.

description:
The drinks are cheap, and they let you bring in pizza (you should get the pesto) from Pasquales, but Yancy's is just not my fave. 

The service is terrible. They should probably give up the table service altogether because it's so bad. I've been several times, and it's never even been moderately pleasant. Once, the waitress messed up my drink, serving me a shot instead of the drink I ordered. She refused to fix it, and made me go to the bar myself to get a mixer to pour it into... which I had to pay for. :( Wah-wahhhhhhh. 

On the other hand, the bar service has been pretty consistently good. That, coupled with the fact that the drinks are reasonably priced, bumps it up to a 3 star from a 2.
author: Kristen B.

description:
this place is great! a huge selection of beers and cheap shots...tv's are kinda small but there are a lot of them so it makes up for it...there are dart boards and plenty of tables to sit around. You can also bring food and there is table service for drinks....

the only downside is that it is cash only....but there are plenty of ATM's around the bar...there is a great pizza and dessert places around there too! 4 stars for the awesomeness....1 for just being cash only
author: Brendan L.

description:
i used to live near here and whenever my friend wanted to go out but didn't want to venture out of the sunset we'd end up here or i'll get dragged out to join the others..
i'm not a bar person at all, especially a laid back bar person.. i like to get dressed up when i go out.. but i actually don't mind going here..maybe bc they have darts, jukebox, and other activities you could enjoy than your typical bar..after a night out at yancy's we'll end up grabbing a bite at irving pizza on the way home.. oh yeah, that reminds me, you could bring in food here, i've seen people bring in pizza boxes before.. 

yancy's, congrats on being the only chill bar i like so far.. a difficult feat!
author: Raquel T.

description: I have fallen in love with Yancy's the last several months. This is a great bar for a larger group since there is so much space. They let you bring in food, which is clutch being so close to the eateries on 9th ave. I have played darts, watched baseball, and drank a wide array of beers. Keep it up Yancy's.
author: Michelle S.

description:
i love yancys. 

been here before&after a dinner, to watch a giants game, and just because i had a hankering for a nice jameson on the rocks. 

i guess it depends on what kind of person you are - but i never have a problem with anyone here. bartenders have been great and you always end up making new friends as the night goes on. 

see you next week...
author: Maria B.

description:
NFL ticket, tons of tv screens, and $1 off pints of beer on Sunday...nuff said. I'd come back again if this place was a little closer to home.

Cute little sports bar tucked away in the inner sunset district. The people and the bartender are really friendly. My only gripe: they were all out of wheat beers :( And they take CASH ONLY.
author: Catherine M.

description:
So what if this is the first place I take anyone who comes to visit me for drinks?  It's a spacious and conveniently located chill-out-and-have-some-guinness-and popcorn-while playing darts-bar.  Usually always a good crowd gathered here no matter what day of the week it is.  

We usually have a few drinks here and head out to bigger and better things but it's become the first stop of every bar-hopping, blissful night.  

One thing I will say is...there's something in the air at Yancy's that makes people want to talk to random people after having a few drinks.  One guy approached us and got ALL up in my grill like he was the Yancy's Saloon Diva of the Year (it was funny more than rude or obnoxious) but ... I played along ... but it was weird.  That is all ...
author: Kat C.

description:
What can't you do at Yancy's?  Ok you can't play pool, although I could see them letting you bring your own when its slow, but you can play nudie photo hunt, darts, pac-man, cards, etc.  You can also do your homework during the week, it's that kind of place.  

The bartenders are always friendly, the drinks decent and the crowd is usually very friendly.  The one exception was I showed up for the Yankee-Sox series and was practically boo'ed out as the only Yankee fan in there.  I don't hold it against Yancy's, I hold it against the Sox fans.  

For a fun night at Yancy's I suggest getting together your closest buds, grabbing a pizza from the neighborhood and sitting back "Friends" style.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description:
Yancy's is a cool place to kick back with some friends. Very chill and casual atmosphere. There are also lots of seats, so it can fit larger groups. 

If you're looking for a place to hang out with friends after a long day or just a cool sports bar, then this is the spot. 

I'm not a fan of beer, but i really liked the Strongbow Apple Cider. I also want to try their Pear Cider. -- I will definitely be back.
author: Sharon L.

description:
This is a cool place to go when you don't know where to go. Parking can be hard to find sometimes but the place is big. There's a bar area, an area for darts and another area to sit and chat.  All while getting inebriated. 

One major gripe for me is that they're cash only.  I expect that in a smaller bar but for a place this big, I imagine they would make a lot more money if they accepted card.

Solid 3 stars for me.
author: Vicky C.

description:
This was my favorite Bar when I lived in San Francisco, probably I lived right next to it. However, even people from other parts of the city have known this place and it was busy also on weekdays.


 The crowd there is really nice and friendly - you can meet everyone there. The staff was really friendly. They offer a wide range of different draft beers. Additionally, you can watch many sports games, play dart or Pac-Man or just enjoy the music and chat with your friends.


 When someone wants to hang out in a place without tourists  I can highly recommend this place.
author: Aaron G.

description:
First time I came here was in October when the Giant's one!
I had just moved to The Sunset in September and this was a great welcome to the city. (:
I work right down the street from Yancey's and I also live like a block away.
While I was working the night the Giants were playing, I could hear/see everyone starting to celebrate.
My shop decided to close early to celebrate, so when I got off at 9pm, my roommates and I headed straight to the bars.
We hit up Yancey's, it's packed and everyone's so happy. 
People, were dancing, singing, getting totally shwasted.
author: Justine L.

description:
The reason for 4 stars is this place really is much more like a lounge than that of your standard bar. With abundant comfortable seating separated from the bar and well spaced, it is a perfect place to relax and converse with a friend or two. The beer selection is large and the prices reasonable. A bar always gets an extra star when they have a dart board, in Yancy's case its three. 

  It is a sports bar, so there are too many tv's around which adversely affects the atmosphere. The patrons tend to be of the more yuppie, med school, scholastic meat heads. Not my sorts, but again the spacing is sufficient to keep their offensiveness at arms length. While I would not make Yancy's a regular stop for my drinking rounds, I would certainly enjoy the company of a gentler type here, if we were in the neighborhood of course.
author: Christopher N.

description: It's a good place to chill with some friends. There are tv's all over the place to watch sports and there are also fee darts. The beer menu is fairly limited, no exotic items just the basic stuff. The server is very nice and was very quick to come back with the drinks. Keep in mind though, this place is cash only.
author: Leon R.

description: Nice sports bar with lots of tvs and AWESOME Snakebites!  Lots of seating areas and you can play darts here!  I like this spot for a quick night cap or to have a little chat session with friends.  I could get loud on weekends and game days with college kids but its a great neighborhood hangout.  And Alan and Doug are cool bartenders!!!
author: Gina S.

description: Not the greatest service with a crowded environment and lots of douchey people. Even had some homophobic slurs shouted out. Not a happy place for the average San Franciscan.
author: kyle d.

description:
They have two christmas drinks called the Snuggler and the Candy Cane Martini that I was making my depressed friend down and the bartender is like "HEY HAVE YOU TRIED RUMPLE MINZE"? 

Sure why not? Turns out it's some sort of evil 100 proof peppermint german WMD or something and I woke up this morning with a splitting headache (but surprising fresh breath). 

Also thanks to the guy that bought us add'l shots of the rumple and said "ARE YOU LOOKING FOR AN ABORTION TONIGHT?" 

Charming.
author: dr S.

description:
this is probably my favorite bar in sunset, very spacious and theres away ppl here, i know a lot of lowell high folks come thru here (mostly asians), wish they had more beer selection, its always langunitas IPA, they never have any other IPAs :( but awesome feng shui, ppl are chill, its just one of those places to come and talk to yo friends about your trials and tribulations plus they let u bring food in so u can go to san tung and get some wings, or go to pasquale's and get some pizza, or pluto's sandwiches, etc
love this place!

4 stars
author: Michael K.

description: I came here for a friend's birthday celebration. Great place, but the waitress that was serving our section only paid attention to the males at the tables. I tried ordering twice but she ignored me and got the drinks for my guy friend. I work in a bar and I've worked as a cocktail waitress, best not ignore the girl in the group of guys. My girl friend at another table had the same problem, she had to ask one of the guys to order for her cause the waitress wasn't taking her order. We would have gladly tipped, but it seemed like she didn't want our money. Lots of TVs. But if you're female, you've got to grab your waitress and MAKE her listen to your order (then you'll be the bitch of the night) otherwise get a guy friend to order or head straight to the bar.
author: Kimberly S.

description: Cool bar to go to after work to wet my beak!  The staff is extremely friendly They dont care if you bring food from outside in. They have darts and a jukebox. Great selections on beer an mixed dranks. They used to have pacman but I dont know what happend. We alwayz have our work get togethers here at this spot. We will be coming back soon! Real soon!  ; )
author: Rene L.

description: Plenty of tv's surrounds the establishment along with one big screen as you enter.  Can't complain about the drink prices.
author: Jay M.

description:
I just came here for the first time with my cousins during spring break and I have to say this is a nice little bar to chill at. 

We went on a Sunday night and it was pretty vacant. There also weren't any waitresses on duty to take our orders, so we had to go up to the bar to order it. It wasn't bad though. Doug, the bartender, was really cool and funny. The place looks like how a regular bar would look; a lot of wood all over the place. They also have a dart board in the back which is nice, just don't stab anyone while you're playing drunk. 

The drinks weren't bad. He seemed to know his stuff. We told my cousin to order a grasshopper and Doug was like "Ohhhh that's an old lady's drink". We thought it was pretty funny. The drunks are the usual, nothing special. 

This is more of a bar to just chill and potentially meet new people. Doug is really nice and a good person to talk to if you go in by yourself. Definitely going back again.
author: robin w.

description:
A great bar to hang out cause lots of stuff here to keep you busy. Conversation pieces all over the wall, dedicated gallery lighted type area for darts, touch screen juke box, 20 flat screens tvs, awesome decor.

Service is cool. I was the only one who left a tip because my buddies were too cheap. The waitress smiles it off, what a trooper!

They allow you to bring food from outside. How are they making money?

One bad thing! Bring boots when you go in the mens restroom. Every one is too drunk to aim apparently.

TIP: 

- THEY HAVE PACKS OF PLAYING CARDS IF YOU ASK FOR THEM.
author: Keit K.

description:
This place is listed as a sports bar, and I suppose it is (multiple TV screens would attest to that), but it FEELS like more. If that makes sense...
The decor is casual but interesting- there are jungle-like plants surrounding the bar-- and there is plenty of seating, including a large couch. (It doesn't look as seedy as it sounds.) There are also a few dart boards set up. 

The drinks: Tasty, strong, and reasonably priced.

 I would go back!
author: Sonia M.

description:
Came here once at 6pm on a Saturday night and loved it.  This was my first time in a bar where I didn't feel sad and depressed.  Instead, it had a lively and cheery atmosphere.  It wasn't very crowded when I came with pockets of people here and there.  The thing that caught my eye, even though I didn't play it, was the dart room in the back.  NIce.

The drinks here are great and the bartender (Erin) wasn't stingy with the alcohol.  I ordered a jack-and-coke and it was 90% jack, 5% coke and 5% AWESOME.  I could not believe it - they don't water down their drinks.  Allow me to repeat that: they do NOT water down their drinks.  And now a third time in caps for emphasize: THEY DON'T WATER DOWN THEIR DRINKS.

I WOULD DEFINITELY COME BACK IF I NEEDED A DRINK AND A PLACE TO CHILL.  AND CRAP MY CAPSLOCK IS STUCK.  I'M NOT ANGRY OR YELLING JUST EXCITED ABOUT HOW MUCH I LOVE THIS PLACE.

OH, AND BRING CASH.

LOLSORRYCAPSLOCK.

==========

-1 STAR FOR CASH ONLY

*4 STARS OUT OF 5*
author: Chris Y.

description: I came here again last night and this place has grown on me.  It's a pretty chill place for a larger group of friends to go and hang out.  Since we usually go out to clubs and lounges, the beverage prices here are much more attractive as well.  However, it's still disappointing how weak the drinks are...  I'd advise sticking to $5 draft beers and $5-$7 shots.  Also, go early and grab tables!  This place gets packed after 11.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Oh Yancy's, how kind you are. The stairs leading to each section of your bar are petite and shallow, allowing my drunk self to stumble gracefully through the far-more-sober crowd. After just a Long Island Iced Tea and half a Cranberry Vodka, I began to feel warm with joy and happily dizzy. Your dim lighting and comfy couches encouraged my desire to be inappropriate and promiscuous... 

But thanks to my attention span of a 5-year-old, the urge passed, and I was soon distracted by the large, flashing TV monitors with the pretty, bright, moving pictures. 

Not only do your drinks taste scrumptious, but they also make for a lovely improv perfume, as I discovered hours after I drunkenly spilled my beverage on my skirt.
author: Chang L.

description: This place is aight. It doesn't offer much, but doesn't demand much of you either.  Tends to be crowded most nights, but the people who frequent this place are sort of annoying.  Least depressing bar in the inner sunset though.
author: Trini L.

description:
Solid 4 STARS!

If you live in the Sunset or Inner Sunset District this is one of the more cozy bars to go to. Grab a bunch of friends, some pizza or whatever floats your boat, and have a good time. 

This place is awesome for several reasons. First it is big enough to hold a good amount of people, but not too big to the point where it gets extremely noisy(although it can get loud some nights, usually able to have a decent conversation). Second, you can bring in food. Third, the staff are nice and responsive. Finally, the decor inside makes it cozy and fun with the big screen T.V., couch and large tables, dart board, and free popcorn/pretzels (little secret that not many people know. usually if they have some it's yours)

This is an ASSHOLE free place to hang out and have a drink, for all newcomers enjoy and have fun.
author: Nick C.

description:
Good crowd, Parking is doable. Dart boards in the back. 

Totally crowded, but for good reason. Place has a good vibe!
author: Amy S.

description:
Never had a dull time at Yancy's. 

Alcoholic beverages, good friends and more alcoholic beverages while sitting down having a nice conversation is awesome. 

Price is about right. The bartenders know how to make a good cocktail. A bad cocktail is the ones you order from inside of a club- I've never had a watered down drink from them ever and I'm not even a regular or remotely handsome. 

The crowd there is always mixed and friendly- never seen anyone get into a fight or cause a scene while in there. Only peeve I have are the college frat dudes who think it's pretty f'n awesome and cool of them to block everyone who wants to walk towards the restroom and darts. Quit blocking everyone because if you see it from our point of view- you d-bags look like you're having a good time performing a circle jerk with each other. 

I like this place.
author: Danny L.

description:
I guess the first question I have is, after how many gin & tonics are you no longer qualified to write a review of a bar? Arguably, after enough of them, any bar is good.

But that's not the point. I met up at Yancy's with a huge group of friends on Friday night. A group was there, and others came and joined. My $5 g&t's kept me happy, and of course being with such a big group was great too. The most impressive part was perhaps how we were able to get two tables near each other so that everyone was actually TOGETHER! The place is well-lit (important for drinking games) and the staff is super friendly. It's a great place to chill and the music isn't overbearingly loud.

So yeah, major props to Yancy's and for sure I'd go back!
author: Emilia S.

description:
Yancy's has the strange appeal for me where I can never walk by without wanting to stop and get a beer, which given that I live right around the corner means it happens all the time. And that's a good thing in my book. 

There are plenty of other bars in the city with better service, more beers on tap, better mixed drinks, etc, but Yancy's checks all the boxes that are important to me as a friendly local place with a more than sufficient selection of beers on draft. Add in the fact that I can bring in pizza from Milano's and you've got the combo for my favorite bar in the city.
author: Chris S.

description:
Went here on a first date with my fiancee here almost two years ago, so this place will always have a special place in my heart.
Last night, went to watch the NCAA championship game.  While they ran out what I was drinking (Newcastle), and the service was a little slow (1 waitress for the crowded bar), it is a fun place.  TV's are spaced out well and can be seen from almost every seat there...
author: Benjamin T.

description:
I was there when the GIANST WON IT ALL!!!!!

Best celebration ever!!!!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U4JyNDT3HoI

After going crazy inside everyone poured outside and the whole block turned into one huge dance party!!!! I wouldn't have wanted to be anywhere else!!!!

GO GIANTS!!!!
author: Danger R.

description: Place is pretty spacious and drinks are not too expensive. Love how they have 3 dart boards that you can play on. My friends and I played for awhile. You just have to ask for the darts and give them ID to borrow them.  There's pen and paper provided to keep score against your friends. They give free popcorn here too. My friends and I were bar hopping and we came here earlier in the night and came back because the other bars were lame. Very fun environment to chill with friends :)
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
I miss this place. For some odd reason, I stopped comming here for more than a year. I came back 2 weeks ago and I felt like home again.

As usualy, the bar was great, the service was number 1.

Plenty of places to sit and the drinks are always cheap and good.

My favorite drink is the Black and Tan. 

HD ESPN and beer is a place I enjoy.
author: David L.

description:
I LOVE this place. A great happy hour. The atmosphere is the best. You can tell the residences  that came off of their shift from UCSF, so the nature of the place is low key, jeans and a t-shirt. My kind of a place. 

Oh and on a side note, if your dream is to marry a doctor, this is the place to frequent.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Shockingly bad service. I had friends in from out of town and brought them to Yancys (among the how many choices in the inner Sunset?). After we ordered the first of what would be several rounds the waitress brought our drinks and asked for immediate payment. When we pulled out a card, she said "cash only." Cash only? Is it 2011? How many rounds are we going to buy on cash?

Knowing there was an ATM nearby we said we would get the money but she raised her voice and said "I need to be paid now." We looked at each other and she repeated it loudly. My friends were surprised and it was very awkward but being civil, we simply went and got the money - we should have walked out. Terrible.
author: Paulo M.

description:
Yay for Yancy's.
Yay for never having to worry about finding a table for our big group.
Yay for never having to worry about the bill at the end because we pay each round up front.
Yay for never paying more than $5 for a draft beer.
Yay for having TVs at every angle of the bar.
Yay for a dart room.
Yay for Pacman!
Yay for not having to circle for parking!  Bigger yay for a responsible DD!
author: Jenny L.

description:
I've always had a good night here whether I'm there to hold a club meeting or just to grab a couple of drinks with my grad student friends. I love how the tables were made to fit me and my friends for a round table discussion on all things sciencey. Especially since we're not too far from the Cal Academy should me and my compadres want to venture out there for NightLife. 

I should warn ya that they take only cash so hit the BofA on the corner and save the ATM fees for booze money. 

Good location, great service and awesome people make this one of my favorite place to have any sort of pre-party gathering. 

P.S. They're cool with you bring food in. 

Scha-wing.
author: Roth E.

description: Skunkiest beer I have ever had on tap.  If this place didn't have darts, I would give it zero stars.  Save your money and hit up the Starbucks next door.  At least you get what you pay for.
author: Vinh N.

description: Maybe my standards were a little high when I wrote my first review?  Not sure why I gave them a four star rating before, but certainly one of my favorite bars is deserving of a five star rating.  I mean come on...like the first review said...FREE POPCORN!  All that fake buttery goodness goes real well with beer.  Oh beer...how I love thee...
author: Mike L.

description:
This place has got CHARACTER!

I stumbled in here for an after dinner drink. This place was boomin! The decor- crazy! Orange and red patterned old school carpet, plants hanging everywhere, random masks hanging. It's eclectic and unique, to say the least. In the back, they have 3 large dart boards. There is plenty of space to sit and enjoy a drink or play drinking games or you can sit at the bar and chat or watch TV. 

What a nice little unexpected find!
author: Laura D.

description:
Spacious bar with lots of TVs to watch sports on. Great atmosphere especially when you're with a great group of people. All I really wanted that night was a nice cold blue moon and that's exactly what I had. The waitress was very attentive to our group. I was really impressed when she still remembered who ordered what when we all moved to a larger space to occupy and mixed up our seating orders a bit. 

However, my friends and I being in our early 20s, I felt like the crowd that was hanging out there was a bit older (no offense to anyone!) but that obviously makes the vibe of the bar a little different. i'm sure it's just because it wasn't exactly summer yet and was during finals time so not many college students were out and about yet. 

I'll definitely come back again for a drink sometime soon!
author: Julia K.

description:
Yancy's-

Thank you for being there after this long hectic week of finals, papers and presentations. Thank you for your ~$5 Hef, Stella, Red Tire so my student budget can afford to treat my classmates to a round of drinks and not go broke. Thank you for allowing me to bring in 3 boxes of pizza from Pasqual's and then offering to clean it up for me. The only thing I wish you had were pitchers of beer.
