Thank you for being kick-ass and chill.  I love you.
author: Shirley W.

description: if you want a good time and an upbeat place,this is your place.  it can be loud at times.. well.. maybe all the time, but it's fun.  you can be as loud as your want here, and not worry about keeping your voice down.  you can watch sports here or play darts.  if you want. you can grab pizza from next door and bring it in. it should be fine cuz they never said anything to us. the drinks here are good, they are not weak but not too strong. if you have a big group of friends you might wanna come at 9 to make sure everyone gets a place to sit.  there's plenty of parking after 10 b/c most of the restaurants are done serving. if you don't drive it's cool, the muni is right outside.
author: Belinda C.

description: Oh Yancy's.....  I have enjoyed myself sitting at your bar or one of your tables many times throughout the last year and a half since I found you.  You have always offered friendly service, good popcorn, and of course yummy beer.  Great for groups or perhaps just you and your book Yancy's is a bar that is always entertaining and interesting.  So all I have to say is.... Thank you Yancy's.  Thank you for being a solid stand up bar.
author: Kylie L.

description:
If i ever move into this neighborhood, I already know this will be my go to bar.  Lotsa seating and a whole lotta screens to watch all those games.  This place also lets you bring in outside food, which is always a plus.  When we first walked into this place, my friend asked if I smelled something weird, and I said nope, smells like a good dive bar to me!  It was very casual and I had a really good time watching a basketball game here with a group of friends. 

But why all this praise and only 3 stars?  Cash only, ugh.  I never understand places that only accept cash, especially now days.  I definitely would have bough more drinks, but nope, only had a ten on me.
author: Nicola V.

description:
Came on two separate Friday nights. One time it wasn't too packed, but the second time it was super packed with people spilling onto the street and a lof of people standing inside since seats were taken. Luckily we had a table. People come around to take drink orders or you can order at the bar. You can also ask for complimentary pretzels as well. There are many TVs there to watch sports.

Some drunken people did some "interesting" things there. Two girls were hitting each other. Another girl being drunkenly walked out by her friend, almost revealing too much of herself from her short dress.

I'd come back for a night of hanging out with friends.
author: Anita C.

description:
I dropped by this bar one Sunday afternoon for an entire day of drinking and football games with a friend.  This place is ideal for hearing your buddy b-tch about irrelevant games and his fantasy football team.  For instance, how in the hell does Deangelo Williams only have 64 yards rushing last week when the Panthers have Jimmy Clausen as their starting QB???  Yes, Jimmy Clausen.  JIMMY FREAKIN CLAUSEN!!!!

The set up is ideal for a sports bar as there is one big screen and multiple smaller screens around the bar.  There is an elevated area with seating where there are 6 screens side by side.  I almost felt like I was at a casino, especially with the drab carpeting.

Beer is reasonably priced and there are specials like Miller Lite for $3, though the last time I came, they actually ran out of beer from multiple taps.  That seemed strange for a business dependent on selling beer.  This was post a 49ers game.  Poor 49ers fans, I can understand why ya'll are drinking so much this season (I'm a Dolphins fan).

The waitress was very nice and attentive while being the only waitress there.  There wasn't too big of a crowd (after the Niners game) with a decent portion of dudes coming in from their softball games.  Extra plus: they let you bring in food from outside.
author: Mitchell L.

description: SF packers bar. Go pack go. The bears still suck. Liz Doug and mike know what's good. Can't go wrong with a neighborhood dime piece.
author: Michelle P.

description:
i went here after dinner last week for a couple drinks and it was the first time i've been to yancy's in YEARS. I used to come here every week when I was younger (19-20 to be exact...they didn't card on weeknights!)...so much so that I've called it "yancy's wednesdays". Lots of good times at this bar. Being back in here was like a trip down memory lane, except there are a ton of flat screen tvs all over the place now. The drinks were good, they still served popcorn (though I didn't eat any), there are still a lot of pretty plants and the women's bathroom is still painted bright red. 

Someone that night had really good taste in music and just kept getting it right on the jukebox...i mean wow from smashing pumpkins to the humpty dance...I really wanted to find out who that person was and thank him/her personally for making my yancy's night even better!
author: kristin e.

description:
3 drinks for $16. Amazing!
Cash only
Dartboards
Need I say more?

Looking for a bartender?
author: Goldie L.

description:
My favorite neighborhood bar. Great place to meet up with friends for a drink and to catch a game. There are tv's plastered on every wall, so you can get your fix of basketball, baseball, football, golf and etc... 

Lots of wooden tables and chairs scattered about, one couch in the middle of the room and a long bar. Usually on a busy night a waitress will come around your table to get your order. If not order at the bar. You can entertain yourself on the old school video games, three dart boards and or ask for some die. 

They only take cash, but there are three banks and plenty of atm machines on the same block. 

They don't have a huge selection of beers on tap, but they have my staple, Guinness, so I'm usually satisfied. They don't serve food but do have pretzels and popcorn available. You can bring outside food in and you will never go hungry with the selection of restaurants on 9th Ave.

A frequent stop for UCSF'ers. I've seen people studying for their surgery rotation with a beer in hand. Nice! You can be my surgeon!
author: Tina Y.

description:
I've been going to this place for more than five years to watch the football games and NFL playoffs.

The waitresses are always nice but the people that work behind the bar are nearly overtly hostile.  I had a store on market street for many years so I know what it is to deal with people every day. Accordingly I cut people who work retail a lot of slack.  That said, the women who work behind the bar need to realize that when you greet people with hostility and animosity, that's precisely what you're going to receive in return.

There's been times I've been there as part of a large group and spent a lot (!!) of money there.  They will never, ever, comp you a round.  I've seen the son of the owner sell a seven dollar drink to someone who could barely speak they were so drunk and then three minutes later take it away from the same person saying they were too drunk.  The brunette bartender is simply a miserable person to have to interact with.  I'll do anything I can to avoid her.

It's a great place.  It's a lot of fun to go watch sports, particularly if your with a group, and I do really like the place.  Just realize the people that work behind the bar are miserable.  It's a karma thing, tip them accordingly.
author: Michael C.

description: Stopped in when I was in town on business. I found a blonde hard body to take into the bathroom after I pointed out that I didn't want her to get drunk, but that it was a very fine Chardonnay she wasn't drinking.
author: Patrick B.

description: This bar isn't too shabby, they offer a cider type of beer called Strong Bow, goes down smooth & quite bubbly, tastes great! The venue itself is pretty room, but it still gets overly crowded. Though it's a big bar, the restrooms are tiny, but the dart boards make up for that. Typical bar, but most definitely will be coming back.
author: Alex T.

description:
A pretty solid 3 stars.

I thought it was a pretty big layout.  $4.5 for pear cider that was refreshing even though it smelled like crayons.  The gal that served us did a good job cleaning up after the large Couch Surfing crowd, refilling out drinks, et.  They have darts and plenty of seating.  It's a bit out of the way for me but I like going to new bars.
author: Walerz B.

description:
Great place.

Lots of TV's for sports, good draft selection, they let you bring in grub from the awesome restaurants on Irving, and have plenty of space to hang out.

Clean place and quick service. What more could you ask for to go watch a big game, or just hang out?

1/2 block walk off the N. 

Enjoy!
author: Jonathan I.

description:
I really need to get something off my chest.

....

....

....

WHAT THE FUCK IS WITH YOU HETS AND YOUR SPORTS BARS?!? 

So let me get this straight.  Instead of knocking back Sam Adams while on your living room sofa, stuffing your lard ass with 'za, and watching sports on TV, you go out TO DO THE SAME FUCKING THING IN A BAR?!?

WELL. FUCK. ME.   That's just RANK.  YOU HETS ARE DISSSSGUSSSSTING!

We're not like this in GayLand, I promise.  I mean, you don't walk into a gay bar and expect to see porn on the tube, crotch-lifting designer jeans, and ass piracy, RIGHT?  Right.  Fuck that shit.  We just sip tea, read Wilde and Woolf, and admire each others' pinkie rings.

Anywayzzzzz, if you're looking to reproduce the living room scenario, Yancey's is perfect.  It's like Cheers with leather sofas and Bud Light banners.  The bartenders are friendly, drinks are cheap, and outside food is permitted.  I don't remember seeing a dart board, but I also don't notice such diversions.  Besides, it's generally good practice to keep me away from sharp objects lest I purposely cut myself.  

Our group (fabu yelpers Patrick M and MJ T) was blinded by the Plasma TVs they stationed above the raised seating area.  Honestly, I was cool with that since two TVs were showing the US vs. Sweden in the Women's World Cup, and as you all know, if there's one thing I like more than watching sports, it's watching lesbians play sports.

Oh, and the clientele thankfully left their douchery at home.  The asshole to normal ratio was around 1 to 10: pretty good.  In fact, no one around us batted a lash when I spoke VERY LOUDLY about the Friends of Judy (please note, we don't like Judy Garland 'cause she was cute and could carry a tune; we like Judy Garland 'cause she was a drug-addled alcoholic who beat her children).

One thing: Yancey's really needs to ratchet down the testosterone level in the bar.  Some of it even affected me.  I felt like pulling a Norman Mailer and punching my straight male friend in the face the entire time -- in that male-bonding, "I love you dude, let's get naked in the forest" Iron John way of course.

Now that's seriously fucked up.
author: d s.

description:
It's a nice bright bar, with a skylight and lots of plants, OG video games in the back.  

The second room was full of people wearing some kind of uniform, they were all wearing the same T-shirt ... OH YEAH!  It was about 100 Yelpers celebrating after the Bay to Breakers.  

Despite the pandemonium and the clamoring for pizza, the waitress was able to track me down and serve me a $3 Miller Light.  Later she even found me and asked me if I wanted another.  Considering the traffic in here, that was quite a feat.  

Some of these people were really, really drunk.  That's one reason why I love them.
author: David D.

description:
Yancy Shmancy! This is a great place to wind down and stretch your aching out of shape muscles after walking nearly the entire B2B course. 

Sadly, there was something was wrong with their Fat Tire Tap and I was relegated to drinking something else. We were also charged for popcorn and pretzels. And there was a random girl munching on our pretzels before we left. 

Despite all the PG-18 bromance, we weren't kicked out. 
Despite the cooler full of Smart Water, we weren't kicked out. 
Despite the camelbacks with left over booze (blasphemy!), we weren't kicked out. 



You might even see as much nekky men's ass as you would at the Folsom Street Fair. But where the hell was I when all the bewbie pictures were taken?
author: Kevo M.

description:
Lots of hanging, potted plants.  Ask the bartender why that is, and he'll say, "You know the air you breathe in here is very clean."
Not sure if they were really being green-conscious here, but indeed, I couldn't complain about the air I was breathing in there.  There is a perpetual carbon-dioxide/oxygen exchange in this place.  There are plenty of mirrors to satisfy any narcissist, and erotic photo hunt and dart boards (you have to surrender your california ID to borrow three darts) for just kickin' it with yer homeez.  ca$h money only.

( | )
author: Grace M.

description:
You know them, those towns that "are" college towns. The places that would become ghost towns were it not for the 18-22 year olds wandering around simply because they are not under the watchful eyes of their parents anymore. The places you used to go visit when you were a senior in High School on spring break because; 

a. there was always a party
b. when there wasn't a party there was a bar where you could weasel someone into ordering your underage ass drinks

Well, these towns all had a certain sort of bar that was good for the latter. It was dark and large with lots of seating, a dart board and a pseudo sophisticated feel. These bars would be dead if there was actually something more exciting to do. But there wasn't so you hung out at them as they served alcohol to your new friends of age, as you hid in the corners patiently waiting for your drinks. Once you were 21 you returned the favor, but the minute you were 23 and out of college you never ever set foot in them again. 

Thats sort of what Yancys feels like, except that it is in San Francisco, where there are plenty of things to do, so this bar is generally too empty to keep the bartenders distracted while you get your younger cousin Sally, and her entrouage in visiting from Fresno, nice and liquored up. The few people who do hang out here are definitely teetering on the edge of legal but the majority of 18-22 year olds in SF are out clubbing, riding the buses and causing a ruckus or pan handling down in the Haight. 

Yawn.
author: Drue C.

description:
Yancy's is definitely a fine watering hole that has all the proper amenities one could ask for: a multitude of TVs, darts, ancient video games, good but not great selection of draft beers, and, most importantly, a very welcoming environment.  Yancy's is the perfect place to hang out at and enjoy quality conversation with old or new friends. 

March on, Yancy's!
author: Michael D.

description:
Where is F is everyone? 

It's like a ghost town here. Eric W and I came here looking for some hot ass babes unfortunately we had a night of watching some killer bull riding and some wipeout wakeboarding videos.

WTF?! Don't ya know, the Bad Boyz of Yelp are roaming the streets of the Inner Sunset. Armed with Awesomeness and crazy talks. If there were girls here, we wouldn't be able to brush them off us, they would be omg, you guys are soooo hot! I want to have your babies. We want to be your groupies. They don't know what hit em'.

We are the bad boyz of yelp. Ready to take over this shiznatch!

oh yeah, this place is ok. Wish there was more people. I'd come again.
author: Stanley K.

description:
Yancy's is not at all nancy, or fancy pantsy

It's a mellow sports pub, with next to no grub

Where you can sit alone and think, or meet your friends to drink

It's a landmark in the 'hood, and we want it to stay for good

And not end up like PJ's Oysterbed, full of rats and dead
author: GIR ..

description:
I'll throw a couple of stars their way for the sheer number of barely legal lap dogs who make their way over from Yancy's to throw themselves at me whenever I'm studying at the Starbuck's next door. That's right. I study. At Starbuck's. When I'm not out causing trouble. 
Seriously, though: Yancy's is for you if you are:

a) between the ages of 21 and 22
b) an inner-sunset gangsta
c) looking to get drunk on the cheap because you're living on an allowance from your mama

Sure, I've been to Yancy's. But not since 1999. I walk by everyday and every day it's the same-old-same-old: A  bunch of kids getting drunk without adult supervision. I just want to march in there and send the lot of them home to their parents. It was a big night there last night because of the basketball game. I felt like I was leaving one of my old high school football games, walking through the pack of rowdies outside Yancy's. Except I wasn't wearing a cheerleading outfit (ok- maybe I was...).
author: Autumn K.

description:
Major kudos to Yancy's for handling the very drunk swarm of post B2B yelpers.

The staff was really friendly and seemed to take everything in stride.  The bathroom was clean which, given the crowd, is nothing short of a minor miracle.  There was also plenty of seating, even for such a large group.

I would totally go back here.
author: Renae H.

description:
3.5 stars.

Yancy's is one of the better "pubs" I've seen as the ones in the Richmond district are too divey. It's equipped with tons of TVs and tables/chairs so you're not being hoarded or crowded around tons of people. I came here to catch the NYK vs Lakers game on Friday (Go Lin!). It was a good time. Lots of people. There is a $1 off happy hour until 7pm-- that brings your beer at 5 bucks. Not that great of a deal, but it's fine!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
I'd like this place more if they served pitchers.  I'm all about efficiency.  Ask, Way Shawn.

I did like the wall with the row of TV's though.  The ADD in me really appreciated being able to watch basketball, baseball, hockey and MMA simultaneously.  The darts area looked fun.

I'll probably be back.  Maybe next time I can convince some females to come with me.  As much as I enjoy listening to guys give each other advice about picking up women, I prefer action over words.
author: Seong P.

description: This is the bar to go to if me and my friends can't decide on any other place! It gets pretty crowded during the weekdays, but Yancy's is quite spacious. There's tons of tables and seats. The male bartenders are super friendly, and drinks are reasonably priced. The location is great as well because there are a ton of restaurants around to get those drunchies!
author: Marilyn W.

description: Awesome place to get cheap drinks and chill with friends. I LOVE it!
author: Jonathan M.

description:
A neighborhood bar in the inner sunset where you might not remember any specific details of the bar or what you did there years ago, but you definitely remember how *good* you felt when you were there as a responsible independent young adult...  

Vague SFSU college memories of beer, darts, dancing, live music and lively conversations, after many nights of studying at the UCSF library.

*Nice place to relax after dinner at Villa Romana Pizzeria & Restaurant just across the way.
author: Olma M.

description:
Updated 3/22/07
i had to bump this place up to 4 stars. every time i come here i like it a little more. not too crowded, but still a good mix of people. the drinks are good and the waitresses that serve you at one of the tables are really patient with me after i've maybe had one too many.

***************************************
cheap drinks, large bar, I think they have darts... Screw it, it's local! When I went here there was one too many "macho men" aka a group of 10 guys all in SF Giant gear (on a day when there wasn't a game!). But if I wanna go drinking there is no easier place to do it.
author: rachel c.

description:
Great Sports Bar in the Inner Sunset!  It is a wood saloon haven for the sports and/or drinking fans.  The bar has a table and chair area, as well as seating in the "upper area". Dart board nook for 2 groups to play separately and table video card games. The piece de resistance, the Big Screen TV with couches to lounge and watch the game. 

Great day or night saloon, the front tables in the bar have big windows that open on warmer days, perfect for people watching while you drink your pint.  The crowd is fun and this bar never seems empty.
author: Frankie F.

description: A cool bar to go to with a few of your friends and chill, play some darts, drink some drinks. Also Pizza next door. :)
author: Julio P.

description:
This review is dedicated to my dear friend Aubrey, who introduced Yancy to me and two other very popular and well liked Yelpers - Patrick M. and Darin I.

1. Outside food can be brought in the bar. 
2. Ten plus - flat screen tv's all tuned into sports. 
3. Comfortable couches and seating areas
4. Designated Dart Area - Very GOOD plus , since drunken dart playing can lead to accidents. 
5. Old school PAC MAN Games

Yancy's a bit outside of my usual territory, but nonetheless still has it's charm. A good bar to visit after Friday Nights at the De Young - it's within walking distance and the waitresses are very attentive.
author: MJ T.

description:
I don't have the full experience of Yancy's perhaps, since I was one of the many Yelpers that piled in during/after B2B 08.  However, even taking to in to account the bar knew a bunch of patrons all with opinions and a yelp account were invading, even if we received half the service we received, I would be impressed.

Our drink orders were taken quickly and as far as I know, no one seemed to mind all our drunken selves.  The sleeping dude in the corner was left to rest (despite my deepest desires to draw on him) and no one was kicked out, yelled at, or unwillingly spanked.

Maybe it was Yancy's or maybe it was inspiration from B2B (and it was definitely because of alcohol) but I sure saw a lot of bare buttocks while enjoying my beer here.
author: Van W.

description:
This is a great place to go to when coming with a group. On busy nights it will be hard to find a table, but if you do then you will enjoy yourself. As I mentioned this place is great for groups. There are tables everywhere for everyone to relax. In other words, it is a great place to catch up with friends at talk.

Beer prices are good, there is a waitress always checking up on customers, and there are HD TVs everywhere.

The only reason why I am not giving this place a full 5 stars is because of the place not accepting cards. This place only accepts cash so you have to get cash across the street at the ATM. Sucks if you don't want the charging fee.

P.S. the popcorn they give you will be in a bowl you would normally find at a Pho Restaurant.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
my favorite thing to do in life is belittle my friend Curtis at everything.The easiest is the way he talks since it sounds like he always has marbles in his mouth.You can also make fun of ...well a whole lot of things but I'll spare you. But when Curtis is in that Dart lane,he is the King ,the Lord,The Savior. I write this to bow to my friend Curtis' dart superiority,cherish this buddy because everything else can be capped on.

With that said,Yancys.Yancys is not bad.ample space. pretty good drink prices.nice waitresses .

SOMEBODY NEEDS TO TURN THE FUCKING INCUBUS AND SHIT OFF THE JUKEBOX. Also I get it Usf/sfsu kids ,you hang out at Yancys.Crystal Clear.Can you not always wear your sorority sweatshirts and crap all the time ?also get out of my way.thanks
author: Lauren V.

description:
This was round #3 for me and Eugy on Friday night. Something in the champagne at Circolo had me convinced that going into the men's restroom at Yancy's was ok. I go in and the bathroom is empty. I come out of the stall and there's about 5 guys in there. 2 using the urinals. Um, HI GUYS! I smile, wash my hands and walk out of there smiling like it was nobody's business. 

Back to the table. Shots. Irish car bombs. Beer. TV's everywhere. Conversations of sharpie faces and crazy bachelor parties. Fun times. I'm usually not into these type of bars, but for some reason Yancy's just tickled my fancy. 

PS

C-A-S-H     O-N-L-Y
author: Jen D.

description:
My favorite of the Inner Sunset watering holes...   Large and open with a ton of TVs that they will gladly change to any sporting event that you may desire.  I often would get my own 48" flat panel to watch Cleveland basketball games on (wonder if they'll let me next year with LeBron gone)...

Music via jukebox and bartender's ipods was normally good and not too loud.  Tons of seating make it a great place to meet semi-large groups of friends.  And the dart boards would often make a low-key evening into a good time.

They don't serve food but will hand out some free popcorn and allow you bring in food from outside.  WIth Pasquale's Pizza and LaFonda burritos on the same block, I was always set with my eats.  

I have to admit that it is one of the few establishments that I will miss as I am preparing to move to a new neighborhood.  Might still have to venture back this way for a few games next year.
author: Karma P.

description: Great for mingling & hanging out w/ friends after dinner somewhere in the Sunset.  Most of the bars around here are walking distance, but this one caught our eyes.  It was quite crowded on a Friday night.  One waitress was friendly than the other.  Dart board games at the back of the bar was fun to watch.
author: Christine R.

description: Nice hangout spot for a few drinks and some friends. They have tv's, darts and friendly service.
author: Amy L.

description:
I remember when I went to Yancy's to kick back, converse, have a few drinks and zone out to whatever the giant tv in the back was showing.  

Now, Yancy's has a crapload of flatscreens tvs all around the bar.  You got 2 in the front, 4 in the middle, 2 behind the bar, and the big one is still in the back.  I might of missed a couple tvs lurking around.  I think there was one in the bathroom, for your convenience, while you're hunched over the bowl puking your guts out.

I think I like the change.  Came here on a Thursday night to watch the Warrior's game.  The bar filled up by tip-off.  People were bringing in boxes of Pasquale's pizza.  The smell of Naan & Curry lingered about too.

The drinks on the otherhand was pretty awful that night.  Had a funky tasting Crown and Coke.  Then I went with a Manhattan which had way too much bitter than bourbon.  Usually the drinks are pretty decent though.

The location is nice.  You got a wide selection of restaurants around the area.  Parking is pretty bad.  But muni is right at the corner.  I'd watch myself while staggering across the 9th and Irving intersection.  That N Judah is merciless.
author: Sam T.

description:
Nothing like a Sunday afternoon hangin out for some drinks and being obnoxiously loud with a bunch of Yelpers after Bay to Breakers. Thank you Yancy's for puttin up with us! They were generous to have us insanely run around and get 20 boxes of pizza from next door to chow down.  

TVs, darts, couches, and plenty of tables & chairs to sit at!  The lady working there was nice, and cleaned up after us. The usual alcoholic beverages are offered at the usual prices. But CASH ONLY!? ....bleh, excuse me, but what's cash? :\    At least the bathrooms are clean. 

A more of a calm and relaxing place for drinks I assume...unless you have people like us after b2b to rampage the place ;) 

Thanks again!
author: Catherine O.

description:
Great sports bar. Lots of room and places to sit. They have lots of TVs as well (all showing sports of course). They even have a separate cornered off area for darts. But I still think darts and alcohol are not very good mixes. But that's beyond the scope of this review. I think Yancy's only accept cash, so fill your wallets in advance (so you can empty it). The drinks were typically priced for SF bars.

Parking (in that area in general) is a pain before 10pm. But afterwards, the streets open up for your parking pleasure.
author: Sam W.

description:
frequent spot me and the wife visit.. beers are good and cheap, they got darts, video boobie games, popcorn, music and sports on all tubes.. 

place to shoot the sh*t wit your boys or kick it wit ur significant other no frill just good spot to chill, sfsu students all over the place if not across the street at tart to tart.

all times i been here it has been busy not elbow to elbow but close

only twice it has been relatively dead and relatively dead at this spot is means places to sit down. haha

food none popcorn haha
alcohol **** they make almost everything
ambiance **** sports barish without the pool tables, saloonish looking, music and people are loud
price $ regular bar not really pricey..
author: Clarence A.

description:
I've gone here several times over the years, and would call this the type of bar you stop at on your way to another bar (even though it doesn't always play out like that).

I like the front section by the big open window, the fact that it has plenty of seats and the big-screen setup for viewing sporting events, but it's still a pretty average bar (hence the 'pretty average' three star rating!).

The drinks are fairly (not cheaply) priced and they do have a section of the bar dedicated to dartboards, but the dartboards always seemed to be pretty crowded on the nights I've been there.
author: Art D.

description:
I believe this place is the most oxygenated bar on Irving Street. After enjoying the first warm San Francisco day in months (you know the type, temp above 50, skirts above knees...) I realized I just wanted a cold beer.

While strolling the inner sunset and in need of a rest, my friend and I stopped in off the street ready for adventure. The bar is old school. Old school sports bar, but fine enough for me before the sun sets.

Plants line the entire wall and hang from the ceiling. Busts of would-be historical icons line the bar above your head. Where else can the likes of the Gordon's fisherman, a pirate and Benjamin Franklin congregate on a lazy Sunday? Yancy's, of course...just don't make eye contact, I swear those eyes follow you...

A cold Guinness, a seat at the bar and red red bathrooms...if I lived in the 'hood, I'd be here quite a bit.
author: Jessica P.

description: I used to like this bar when I was in college, but since then it has been horrible. The bartender that I have heard is also the manager is extremely rude! He has no concept of customer service whatsoever! On top of that, they call last call whenever they feel like it. They have no idea on how to run a business! I am so disappointed with how this bar has turned out.
author: Terry K.

description: Though not my preferred neighborhood bar, Yancy's does the trick in a pinch. It gets crowded on weekend nights, and seems to be popular with the college crowd. I'll generally avoid it during those hours, but when it's less busy (sometimes close to empty), it's great to hang out, eat (BYO food), and play darts in the back. And let's not forget the free fresh popcorn.
author: Phuong M.

description:
The foliage makes for a tranquil bar atmosphere. It is green, lush and wonderland-like. I wondered who watered all these plants. I asked the waitress and she told me there was a designated attendant. The skylights certainly help offering a little vit-D. 

She arrived back with popcorn, a smile and couple pale ale's served in chilled glasses. 

The Giants were on the big screen. It was the Padres who the previous night came in with 3 runs at the 7th, surprisingly. But tonight the Giant's were on fire, just like the med students next to us - cheering them on as they devoured nachos and tinfoiled burritos from around the corner in a frenzy to set forth to their next stop, well fed. 

The dart room was filled with friendly competition. The jute box played "it's getting hot in here, so take off all your clothes" almost twice until an employee noticed and abruptly made the fix...it was a forgiving situation and rectified nicely with some Cardigan's. 

After the win, we decided to make our way home. The bar was full at this time, people sharing small tables and conversations, bar interactions and even a romantic dancing duo spinning by the speaker...the bartenders waved goodbye to us with authenticity and we exited feeling like we just may come back.
author: Amy E.

description:
I had been playing "text" tag with this guy I didn't really want to go out with but agreed to anyway because 1. I had nothing better to do on a wednesday night 2. Needed to throw a few back since I had an intense job interview that morning. So we finally caught up with each other and decided to meet at Yancy's. I had never been there, but he had because it is a "local" bar for him. 

I show up, and he is sitting at the bar watching the Giants game. The second I sit down, the Giants' opponent scores a home run in overtime and the Giants lose the game. Since this guy is wearing  a Giants hat, I thought maybe he would think I was bad luck and would declare the date over. In any case, he didn't and asked me if I wanted a drink. Sure, I said. Too bad the bartender was the least attentive bartender EVER. It probably took ten mins before I was able to order that first beer. And anyone on a first date knows, ten mins without a drink to sip on between awkward pauses in conversation is about as comfortable as a cheap thong.

Aside from the shitty service, the bar had a nice chill ambiance so I might go back in hopes there is a different bartender next time. With or without that same guy is a different story....
author: Ashley B.

description:
Love this place. The reason it gets 4 stars - the waitresses are kind of a bit sketch. If you order at the bar it's a different price than the waitresses and you have to tip them. So you've just been charged more.

HOWEVER! Doug - an amazing bartender. He makes great drinks and makes the experience worth going.

The bar is very relaxed, very easy going, very comfy. It's definitely a dive bar I enjoy going to.
author: Leanne D.

description:
I give Yancy's 4 Shurikens. Why? Because there is no better place to sit and watch Dice v. Ichirod on the BIG screen. This is one of the more non-sports sports bars in SF. No sporting paraphernalia or memorabilia hanging on walls or draped obnoxiously from ceiling. It's just an old time, down-to-earth bar with decent beers on-tap and free popcorn. For alternative sports, they've got 3 dart boards. Yancy's is more of a neighborhood pub than an all-out sports bar. Don't let this place fool you, it's not Sleepy Hollow. Depending upon the sporting event, things can go from zero-crazy in a nano-second. Otherwise, good neighborhood meetup. If Sam Malone didn't have friends or Cheers in Boston, he'd be tending bar at Yancy's, feathered hair and all.

NOTE TO THE LADYFOLK: This isn't a date place. Don't be hatin' on it because the date went bad. If the dude took you to Yancy's on a date...it's because he wanted to multi task by datin' while sports watchin'. So if ya hear "How 'bout Yancy's?" don't be wearin' a cocktail dress to this extablishiment.

Minus two stars for not having Chimay and cash only. Plus one because it's one of Joe's favorites too.
author: Johnny C.

description:
Cozy, good beers on tap & free darts!

Also a great place to watch the big game.
author: Elsa M.

description: The place where I take my out of town folks after dinner at a food spot nearby. They used to have sit-down arcade games, but not anymore. Good for commiserating with miserable shcmoes such as yourself, or meeting interesting new people to share stories with. Excellent bottle and tap selection and very friendly staff.
author: Rosavida C.

description:
This place is HUGE, with a long bar that it's easy to order from.  Beer is the drink of choice here, and casual is the dress code.  A very high guy-gal ratio, which you might gather from the decor.

There's nothing spectacular to be found here, and I would only call it travel-worthy if you happen to have a med-student fetish.  They are on steady supply at Yancy's.

AND, I will never forget the incident in the bathroom with the red-painted walls.  Shhhhh.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
if you're looking for a casual spot with no frills, no trendy pretty-ppl vibe, no overpriced drinks (aha! sold ya there) - this is the spot.  love this place.  it's like drinking in someone's huge ass living room.  

there are lots of tv's if you wanna catch a game. or just get together with friends in a comfy environment.  just come as you are. 

other pros:  they let you bring food in, it's good for large groups AND the jukebox is reasonably priced.  free popcorn to boot.
author: Jill L.

description: This place was cool. Besides the bartender not wanting to indulge in my jokes (not every girl who tries to strike up a conversation is flirting for stronger drinks dude, I'm just a friendly gal) I had a good time. Very spacious, lots of tables and seating!
author: Kimmie M.

description:
I didn't know there were so many folks my age in this part of my 'hood?!?!?  Damn....wait...do I see any hot guys?

No?

Meh....

I'll just watch the game and drink my beer and order pizza from a few doors down.  Delivery...(yes I am THAT lazy.)

A block and a half away from home...can't beat that!
author: Jay H.

description:
For being tagged as a sports bar, Yancy's is seriously lacking in tv sets!  I've watched a few Niner and Warriors games here, and sometimes it's hard to get a place to sit or stand where you can see the game.  It's packed with the "Inner Sunset," non-SF-Natives, who really couldn't care less what team you're there to see.  

Their mixed drinks are awesome and well worth the price!  I've never tasted a drink and told a bartender here to add more alcohol.  The beer selection isn't the greatest, but they do have Guinness and Stella on tap.  

Table service happens once in a while, but it's not always the best.  I once had a beer spilled on me with no offer to help dry clean my clothing.  The bar tenders tend to their regulars before anyone else, too.  Once they say they're closed, they'll kick people out - even if you need to use the restroom.  I've seen many people urinating on their entryway because of this! 

We once spent an entire night on the Ms PacMan table, trying to beat the top scores.  One side of the table, though, doesn't work.  They also have darts towards the back.  

Yancy's is cash only, and they won't let you start a tab.  You can't even give the bartender $100 to work down from!  

There's no food here, but they don't say anything when you bring in food from around the corner.  There's a huge variety of eateries in the area.
author: ROB L.

description:
Friendly bartenders, decently priced drinks and spacious. Smells kinda funny, but after one too many drinks, you could care less!! :D

Cash only.

3.5 stars.
author: Serena W.

description:
I really like Yancy's. This is a neighborhood bar located in the inner sunset. I came here to watch a couple Giants game and the place is always super packed. You could bring in pizza from next door and the waitresses come around and take orders so you don't have to make a trip to the bar. They have a good amount of beers on tap and pretty decent priced shots. I don't quite remember, but if I was willing to pay for 2 or 3 rounds it must have not been that bad. haha. Yancy's is super laid back, a pretty mixed crowd, and a lot tables and chairs every where. I will probably find myself wandering into this place once Giants season starts up next year! Go Giants! :)

Oh yeah, CA$H Only.
author: Jackie M.

description:
This used to be a go to place for me back in the late 1990's and early 2000's. I still think it's decent and just good straight ahead bar that you can go to with your buddies. 

There's a sports bar feel to Yancy's so if you're not ready for all the big screen tv's playing american football and baseball this place isn't for you. 

Bartenders and waiters are awesome here. There's also dart boards.

And... isn't it amazing, but you can actually hear yourself think instead of super loud music invading all your neural pathways like it does in some of the other sports bars in the city.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description:
I get to the Sunset about every other month...and while my absolute fav bar is Underdogs somewhere around 18th and Irving, I thought I should venture out and try something new.

/queue Yancy's

This is what I remember.

Red carpet and wood chairs.  Pool tables and dice games. 

Water downed drinks and bartenders who gave okay service but who weren't really all that friendly.  Maybe this is why Underdogs is my fav bar in the Sunset.  

So my quest continues....
author: Rebecca Y.

description:
A decent place to meet up with your buddies and slam a few back. It's roomy, usually smoky, and they leave the front windows open all the time for you to people watch or freeze your ass off depending on the weather.

Drug of choice? Beer. They've got a few you'll recognize on tap. 

Entertainment? Eh, bar stuff. Darts, sports on TV's, and video games.

Parking? Are you kidding? This is 9th and Irving. Be prepared to walk a distance unless 1. you get really lucky 2. it's a weird time of day. I live close by, so I walk. So should you.

Ok, so now the only reason it gets 4 stars instead of 3? Free WIFI. Usable  from the Starbucks next door even. Ssssh. It's all MINE.
author: Andrew M.

description:
There seems to be a running theme in all of my reviews.....bars and restaurants The little Sister, the BFF and the guy......AHH hell I swear I know more than three people.....Anyway, Ive been here a couple of times and never had a bad experience drinks are a little pricier than Most of my normal watering holes but hey that's the price you pay for that location....

So Super Bowl Sunday the guy and I decide to go down there to watch the game (via cab of course, no drinkin and driving ) and also for the first time meeting of HIS PARENTS.....dum dee dum dum duuuuummmmm....So we start drinkin at approximately 11am and wait for the parentals to show up which they do around 2!!! AAAAHHHHHHh thank god there are tons of TV's and a good atmosphere here otherwise I might have lost my cool.....So we meet (they are great by the way and totally loved me DUH). The game started and everyone in the bar became friends high fives were given freely and mom and I chatted about old nekkid baby pics.....

Ive had many a good time in this bar and although Id have to agree it is often filled with frat boys, or someone trying to write their term paper (IN A BAR FOR GODS SAKE) I must admit its always a good time
author: Shaunna K.

description:
living in the jungle that is southern california makes me miss the finer things in life....

-Giants baseball
-darts
-laid back chill bar to grab 1,2,10 pints during/after a game 
-and my man doug who never fails to top off all my drinks

This can all be found at my favorite watering hole, Yancys. 

Ill be back this summer. Get those Harlem shots ready (wait, was that just a promotional special?)

fine, get those jamo shots ready.
author: Jason W.

description:
Smell that, lad? This place has the ghosts of gold-rush era panhandlers trying to find a fortune in brackish streams right outside those saloon doors.   They haven't bathed since they died, and Yancy's is where they're going to haunt the entrance harassing patrons for some spare change for some well brandy, mumbling curious tales of triumphs and woes and spitting at the mention of foreigners come to steal their bread.  Wait a second... those are real live modern bums... boy things must not have changed much in bum culture.

Well, besides the one or two drunk or cracked out bums hanging right outside soliciting for a cigarette and insulting your taste in brand, Yancy's offers a spacious den of young sunset-ites having a pint and a crow of tribute to old highschool days.  Barrels are everywhere. Great place to play I-spy. There is a very large screen tv that plays anything from the NBA finals to the world Scrabble championship.  There's a well-designed dart area, a jukebox, and a general seating area with a bunch of round tables.  There is also Maxx machines popular for its Erotic Photo Hunt-- a single game can last 20 minutes and cost a quarter.  Find JCMB or dirty rotten phrases mainly in the trivia scoreboards that have passed the BadBoy filter.  Beware of time spent on these games, as some people can get very catty about their turn on the tireswing.

I remember why I like this place so much - it's one of my fave places to have a Bloody Mary in the afternoon and read my latest pick from Black Oak up the street (awesome used book store).
author: Marjorie B.

description:
I really like the feel of this neighborhood style bar.  It is divey, yet big in side and all ages of people...over 21 that is...
They have good beers on tap such as Boont, Fat Tire, etc.
My only issue is that the two times I went the bartenders were definately rude to us. I gave it 3 stars because of the bartenders, but I would add a .5 for it being a good local bar.
author: Sonya D.

description:
All the elements of a great hangout are in place at Yancy's: A unique feel with  a sizable layout along with walls that are rich in history.  The only thing it's missing? An interesting crowd.

A lush atmosphere that hearkens back to "fern bars" of the 1980's greets daytime visitors.  It has an extremely retro decorative scheme that features a well placed skylight surrounded by hanging plants and copious amounts of unique decor.  A long bar with an super-thick coat of shellac runs along the West wall, and copious table seating is available for larger groups in a different area.  Two large swing-open windows face Irving Street, and you'll find a nice area with three dart boards to the rear.  The daytime vibe is quiet and solitary, but the promise of a lively after-dark vibe hangs thinly within the air.  But come Friday night and the arrival of the weekend crowd, it's anything but lively.

Something about this place is like an airliner with no wings.  It fires up it's big Pratt & Whitney turbojets and taxis down the runway, but it never quite gets off the ground.   Most patrons seem coupled up and reserved, and the crowd of solitary drinkers are about as talkative as a grove of eucalyptus trees.

It's saving graces?  A hearty assortment of restaurants sit within walking distance, and the N-Judah stops 50 yards from Yancy's front door.  The crowd ain't chatty....but this can be a card in your favor if you're looking to escape the scene with  someone you just met at the Blackthorn or the Mucky Duck.  It's less of a destination and more of a getaway....a place to chill-out instead of pick-up.  If you're in the hood, stop by to check it out....but if you're not, don't make it a destination.
author: Mike W.

description: The building is cool, TV's and darts but when the male bartenders are working this place sucks ass! What's up prick? It is no wonder your whole bar cleared out.... sweet attitude, good luck!
author: F N.

description:
I LOVE this place!  By far my favorite bar/lounge/pub.  Ever since my friend  brought me here some time ago (back when it was much less crowded), I've been hooked.  Lots of places to sit (although it does get crowded on Friday nights) and the drink masters behind the bar are awesome.   

For anybody looking for a new drink, I'd recommend their Bay City Bomber.  It starts off looking like a chick drink w/ the juices 'n all, but when you see them topping it off with the 151, you know this drink isn't for the faint hearted.  A few of these and you're set for the night - just watch out for those pesky cops.
author: Allan H.

description:
Despite the sports bar atmosphere, I find myself here anytime a friend has a birthday or a going-away party. Why? It's easy to get free drinks here from your drunk friends when they're ordering a round of shots for everyone. But your friends might be different. 

Even so, Yancy's has a really cool decor that I find myself staring at when I don't understand what's going on in the games that are airing on the tv's around the place. There are dartboards in the back, next to the bathrooms and they have a pretty good selection of music. Granted, they'll succumb to playing Journey's "Don't Stop Believing" and Queen's "Bohemian Rhapsody" but for the most part, I've heard Cake, Weezer, along with some Radiohead. When I'm able to hear the music that is over HOW LOUD THIS BAR IS. That's the nature of bars, I understand but a space this large, sound likes to fill it. I like the bartenders, gave me free shots on my birthday and they know how to pour a stiff drink. My girlfriend likes this place cos they have cider on tap and she's not much of a beer drinker. Plus this place is roomy, they have a loong saloon space for tables and chairs and oftentimes, they'll have a cocktail waitress come and take your order, so your chair isn't in danger of being nabbed. 

Also I hear rumors that the pizza place Pasquale's down the street will deliver pizza to you right inside of Yancy's.
author: Dena R.

description:
Fun collegiate atmosphere, reminds me a lot of the places around Cal (Blake's, Jupiter's).  For me, its a neat place where you can congregate to watch ballgames, play darts, or just pull up a chair and take in the scenery and music.  I also like that it is pretty well lit (unlike Fireside) and the music is never terrible loud....good music selection at the jukebox too.

Many fond memories of going there with my former roommate Ryan, as it was our place to go on Friday nights.
author: Shaun O.

description: I love this place. Alan has been nothing but nice to me and I feel comfortable every time I come in. I live in L.A. now but this bar is one of the things I miss most about SF.
author: Rene M.

description:
Yuppies, hipsters, misplaced Marina crowd, Asian homies, randoms... and me. 

You name it, these people were there. I have concluded this is one of the most random bars ever in the city! It's a good place to go if you just want to sit down and have a drink and my be harassed by the millions of 'too cool' folk in the Marina or on Union. Beer menu is pretty extensive. People watching is just ok here, but you might run into someone you know if you're FROM the city originally. 

But bring cash. It makes transactions a little easier :)
author: Lisa L.

description:
I like the fact that this place has some foliage...doesn't necessarily fit in in with a bar, but they've made their decision, and they're sticking with it.  I respect that.

Great location, and a ton of TVs (been here for some Tourney viewing, which was a good choice), big darts area, pretty good jukebox.  Good service, even on weekends.
author: Chris M.

description:
Every once in awhile, it's good for you get out of your own element. If anything else it makes you appreciate your regular surroundings that much more. Case in point: Yancy's Saloon.

The other day two of my friends had some news for me. Going the melodramatic route, they took me out of downtown to the Sunset a la two parents taking a child to dinner to announce their divorce (fyi: their news wasn't that earthshattering). After their announcement we needed a libation to lighten the mood. Yancy's looked promising and hey the three o of us all have a love for saloons so in we went. 

The subdued vibe sat well with me at first that Thursday night. Yancy's had all the kick back feel of a good happy hour though it was way past any "appropriate" happy hour time. People were lazily playing darts, sipping beers, sitting around tables just enjoying some peace with their beer and companions. I eagerly enjoyed watching the 49ers preseason game while talking smack about one of my drinking companions love of the Raiders between swigs of beer. I instantly noticed though that when a bar is quiet, my voice carries like a horn on the bay through the fog (i.e. you can hear it everywhere). Once this discovery was made, I had a newfound appreciation for bar noise everywhere. 

The decor is what eventually became a defining factor for me. My aforementioned drinking buddy squawked out "hey doesn't this remind you of TGI Fridays or Applebees back in Milpitas or Fremont?". Once that thought was in mind, I had to agree. Then my other drinking partner commented that he felt more like he was in St. Elmo's Fire. At that point I mentally started scanning for some Emilo Estevez look alike. Instead, I felt like a cast for an updated version had been dispatched. Feelings of masters programs vs. work and do we move into together/ get married, were in the air. That's when I felt the underlying vibe of suburbia of the bar and neighborhood. Call me crazy but I can deal with the nuttiness of downtown much easier than the feeling of a domestic night out. Worth a pop in for a couple of reasonably priced beers and maybe a ball game but I don't think I'd go here without company. Cheers.
author: Veronica G.

description:
tables? check
mixed crowd? check
entertainment (darts, video games)? check
cheap drinks? check... wait, CHEAP DRINKS!?

Susy C?  I AM SO HERE!


Good luck with parking..Irving is a war zone..

My friends love this place and come here every few weeks. I'm sad that I haven't been able to join them (i'm on the wagon, but one of these days I swear i'm going to fall off), but I honestly like this bar. And I don't even really like bars!
author: Susy C.

description: Came here after a 49ers game last night and it was a nice casual college bar with a lot of draft beers to choose from.  Ran out of cash for drinks early in the evening because I didn't know that they were a cash bar.  Will definitely plan to go back.  They don't serve any food but you can bring in your own food and they are cool with that.  I've seen this place be a study/student hangout as well.  Lots of TV's everywhere makes it nice to get a view of the scrolling ESPN scoreboard ticker.
author: Ben H L.

description: Stopped in here to watch a Giants game. Had a great margarita & some popcorn. This is a cool place to watch a game. Plenty of screens and a nice crowd.
author: Daisy S.

description:
Why do I like going to Yancy's? Because the guy checking ID's will not kick me out for wearing a hoodie. Yancy's laid back atmosphere and Wyder's Raspberry Cider keeps me coming back. The decor reminds me of the television show - Cheers, except not everyone knows my name (but if you're from SFSU, you probably will run in to someone you know) and on Fridays and Saturday's the patrons are mostly 20-something's. Yancy's is definitely a good place to hang with friends. You can actually converse without yelling over 2pac!! That's awesome! And I especially love it when the jukebox begins to play 2pac and Dre because even drunk square bears know the lyrics to "California Love." Seeing that....PRICELESS. 

Recommendations: 
Friday or Saturday nights 
Grogg Coffee 
Wyder's Pear or Rasberry Cider.
Heffenwiser 
If you're like me and love the Guinness, do not order it here (totally watered down and smells like they poured your glass in the toilet)
author: Lisa T.

description:
I go here somewhat regularly because it's really close to my friend's house.  If it weren't so close, I would never go.  It's fine.  You know...it's a bar, not too crowded, they give you popcorn, cool.  

The one unique thing here is the dutch coffee.  Coffee, creme de cacao, and creme de menthe topped with whipped cream that the bartender whips when you order it.  Delicious!  It's a perfect dessert, and it makes you feel like all warm and comfortable inside like an electric blanket.

Still, if it weren't so close, I would never come here.  Really it's just another bar with flatscreen televisions everywhere and mostly crappy music that's too loud.  The worst thing is that it's a fragrant place.  It always smells like puke.  Bad plumbing?  I don't know man...gross.  

Why is it that every goddamned bar MUST have goddammned flatscreen televisions in it?  Never have I been sitting at a bar and thought, "This is fun, but man, I miss my tv.  Wait! There's one!  Thank god."
author: Michael H.

description:
I feel compelled to write a great review. I've been hear numerous times, and have always had a good time. Decently priced drinks, fun atmosphere, and darts! Last night, I went there for a friends birthday party, and I was buying drinks throughout the night. When I bought a round, I laid down what I thought to be the correct amount. The bartender called me back over and handed me back a $20, saying "you gave $20 extra." Wow! 

This is a great place to go with honest bartenders.
author: Rod M.

description:
This is a pretty chill place to hang with friends and the drinks are cheapy el cheapo.  It smells like a frat, but it's stumbling distance from my house and the dress-code is waaaay relaxed.  No fretting about searching my closet for something that's cute but not too skanky, which earrings to go with which purse and shoes, etc.  Ratty jeans, t-shirts and sneaks are just fine.  Dig it.

PLUS! They have one of those cracked-out Mrs. Pac-mans!!  You know what i'm talking about.  It's like Mrs. Pac-man on meth! Yeesh!  Playing it is so hypnotic and you gotta focus real hard cause everything happens in a flash.  It totally made my carpal act up, but so worth it!
author: Emily L.

description:
been here twice and the first time it was not as lively as the second time. my first time i was here it was like king of the hill status in there. but on a friday night, the place is cracking with young folk. there are TONS of tvs and a dart area. the place is very laid back and social.

parking can be a problem since its in the sunset and there are a lot of people that live around there. be prepared to walk a block or two but overall the place is fun

it is cash only which is not too cool.
author: edward k.

description:
Really my major problem is that Yancy's is a bit too ordinary.

There is nothing that sticks out about the bar setting Yancy's apart from any other establishment serving booze.  If I were to ask what makes Yancy's great, what could you say?  They have big tables?  There are darts?  So many straight people that even I think that girl in the corner is looking good?  Beer sold at an average price?   Yawn.

Yancy's doesn't do anything particularly *wrong*, but there is nothing standout here.  

Next time lets walk the extra block to Little Shamrock.
author: Mat K.

description:
This place has grown on me.  The first few times I went here, it felt more like a frat party than a neighborhood hang out.  But, I persevered, and it has totally grown on me a place to chill in the 'hood.  I love that they show a range of sports games and the drinks are reasonably priced.  The weekend nights here still feel like frat parties and I tend to avoid those, but weeknights are much more chill and welcoming.  Plus, they have popocorn and I love any bar that has snack food.
Unfortunately, there is this chronic vomit stench in the back area and, after a while, it starts to get to me.  
Oh, and bring cash because they don't take cards, which is kinda a pain in the ass.
author: Jessica L.

description: I love bars like this.  Laid back and relaxed with dart boards, plenty of televisions and a chill crowd.  The next thing you know you've been in here for hours watching three different sporting events and drinking yourself silly.
author: Corey V.

description:
Adding my two cents to the already abundant fan list here. Highlights include:
- the flat screen TVs showing real HD content all around the rooms 
- the dice you can borrow behind the bar
- the friendly and attentive waitresses
- the popcorn (I wish this was free but it only costs a $1)
- darts
- Boddingtons ( I wish this was on tap)
- the clientele is laid back
- you can order in food from any of the numerous restaurants within walking distance and they keep all the menus behind the bar
- came here on a random Sunday afternoon to watch a Laker game and was surprised that there was a small group of Laker fans camping out 
- some Friday and Saturday nights can get crazy, meaning really packed with some butt heads
author: Richard S.

description:
If you live anywhere near the Inner Sunset, why wouldn't you go to Yancy's?  The drinks are reasonably priced, and Alan behind the bar knows what he's doing when it comes to mixing drinks.  If you are into sports, the ridiculous amount of tvs all over the place should meet your needs, but if you're not into it (like me) they got darts, liar's dice, and local gossip to keep you entertained.  
The only thing that is missing is food, but they let you bring in whatever you want.  The music can be a little loud at times, but they'll turn it down if you ask.  Definitely a place to check out again and again.
author: Adam E.

description:
It's the carpet that really ties this place together. Well, the carpet* and the Tiffany lampshades, also the old Collier's covers from like 1917 and all those early-19th century American landscapes, with their early morning, yellow annunciation sunlight as well as the occasional nude and zaftig bather...all this stuff really makes Yancy's a place to consider returning to, because otherwise it's just a collegiate dive bar with far too many tv screens** and music that's reliably a pinch or two too high. Beer selection is okay, as far as I can tell; no word on the whiskey. Bartenders--almost always dudes--have always been adequately nice. But's a college bar, make no mistake.


*We're talking late-70's, non-shag, wine-colored, almost toile-motifed--real semi-classy shit here. Like you could totally read 'Don Quixote' in between innings. Or 'Blindness,' as the case may have been with your reviewer tonight.

**TV screens for which, admittedly, I am thankful every time I skulk in there hoping to see the night's Red Sox game.
author: T U.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of sports bars, but this place is definitely one I can frequent. It's really laid back and casual, which I like. The crowd is generally really friendly and easygoing. I have yet to go on a day when there are a bunch of rowdy assholes, spilling their drinks and trying to pick a fight with anyone who comes in contact with them (thank god). Yancy's is pretty spacious with a ton of seating. I love how they have tables that can accommodate to large groups. It's always a good thing when you can seat everyone together.. rather than having to split the group. 

The bartenders are really friendly and attentive. They have darts, old school arcade games and a ton of TVs. I've heard about the whole popcorn deal but I haven't had any myself yet. The noise level is tolerable so you can have a convo without having to scream into someones ear. Overall, an awesome place to chill with friends.
author: Rosa L.

description:
I didn't find anything too unique about this place.. I guess if you like TV's every five seconds and a bartender with the personality of a gnat it could be considered cool? The bouncer had more personality, maybe he should switch with the bartender?
This place is  eh.. Yeah... Guess it could be a nice "neighborhood" bar but not really my cup o tea.
author: Mokita s.

description:
The first time I went there was 9 or 10 years ago, and at that time it was packed to the walls with reggae-lovin' USF students. Now if there's one thing I am, besides usually over the legal limit, it's forgiving and more than willing to give a place another shot. Well this time Yancy's was a ghost town. 9PM on a Saturday night and you almost couldn't concentrate on your cocktail for the sounds of crickets. Decent drinks, a friendly enough staff and 'festive' decorations couldn't make up for the fact that I felt like I had walked into Sears an hour before opening.

It's a shame really. I've always thought Yancy's was a great space, had a fair amount of wood and more history than most other pubs in the neighborhood. Maybe I've just never been there on a good night, maybe no night is a good night.
author: Andrew L.

description: Its great place to watch a game!! I love how they have the full bar and the prices are reasonable and the size of the place is great for parties and they have darts so its a cool place with old neighborhood charm
author: Nadia N.

description:
Yancy's is pretty OK. Never my first choice, but good beer selection, staff has always been friendly, cozy in an aged fern bar kinda way. Pleasant when they open up the windows on warm days.

Losers from the Midwest, SoCal, and out East Yelp-bombing a place they've never been to because a YouTube channel they follow told them so based on a disagreement they had regarding filming is pretty lame however.
author: Joel R.

description:
Stop #3 on last night's Sunset Pub Crawl.  After that we moved on to the already-reviewed Mucky Duck & Little Shamrock, before ending at Canvas's Closing Forever Party (which I am *not* going to bother reviewing).

Yancy's is a sprawling bar, almost restaurant-esque in its design, and, come to think of it, kind of restaurant-esque in the decor. (Think Marge Simpson at Uncle Moe's Family Feedbag: "Street signs on the walls? Whaaaatever").  Also, it's lit more like a restaurant (ie, it's brighter).

As other reviewers have well mentioned, there's plenty of entertainment to be had here.  I didn't get a frat vibe from this place but maybe that's because my standards have been forever skewed by 6th St in Austin.  But it does feel like the kind of bar where the larger the group you have, the better.  It's just a broad-fun kind of place.  Also, pretty sweet that the bouncer is just a guy sitting there playing a guitar.

Ultimately, for me, Yancy's is the solid, dependable median of the Sunset bar scene: a step up from Blackthorn or Mucky Duck, but lacking the charm of Fireside or Little Shamrock.
author: Wes M.

description:
I come here occasionally.  Last night I walked in, and the place reeked like liquor as I walked in....so bad I asked my friend if we should leave....but we stayed.  Yes, I know its a bar...but damn....My friend's complaint was they were showing a spelling bee on the TVs...weird?  Anyhow, we ordered snakebites....why is there so much ambiguity on what a snakebite is?  It's Guinness and cider, okay.  Bartender kinda forgot about our requested dice cups...but we let that go.  So, doesn't sound like a good review, right?  So why 4 stars?

This place is very HOMEy.  Almost like Oconnors.  Staff might be forgetful but they are truly nice.  Spelling bee might have been lame, but it brought us laughs.  Smell was bad, but after a couple drinks, you forget.  So if you're looking for a place to relax this is a great place.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Damn, N Judah thank you for introducing us to this place.You tempt me with the ride past this place many times.

I find the place decent for after work drinks or during the start of the weekend.
author: Dani D.

description:
Bar+, alcohol+, popcorn -/+(some pieces strangely tasted like burger grease), darts+, music+, crowd+ (not very crowded on a Saturday @ 5pm)

Great play list for those of us who were born in the 70's:
Duran Duran, Violent Femmes, Frank Sinatra, Guns n Roses, U2, Cindi Lauper, etc.
author: Amy J.

description:
What I like about this bar is the layers. You can hang at the bar with locals. The upper middle part reminds one of an airport lounge with big tables of tourists. Sit in the front nook with the dogs, cars, trains and neighbors streaming by. Or you could be in a dart room with drunk girls. 

"Hows about we get 2 more pitchers?"
author: Richard S.

description:
This place ROCKS!!

The atmosphere is very cool and people are nice,that I have encountered on my visits.

Bring some friends and drink yourself into a stupor.


I am kind of sad because I used to  live up on the hill and used to walk down to the bar and stumble backwards trying to make it back up the hill.



Once a cute guy gave me a piggy back ride up the hill.


DON'T LIVE ON THE HILL
author: Mattee M.

description:
This has got to be one of the mellowest, most quiet bars I have ever set foot in. We came here about half way through the Superbowl (and yes it was packed)...the SUPERBOWL... and you could probably have heard a pin drop. I guess that's fine and dandy but I really enjoy noise at bars. Not too much noise but just enough to make me feel like I'm actually out and not alone in my apartment. 

The good things about this bar are plenty. The bartender was really cool. My friends talked him up; he was telling us all about his upcoming trip to Vegas and was playing cards with us. You can bring in as much food as you like and completely sprawl out. They serve buttery, heart corroding popcorn which is awesome while consuming large amounts of alcohol. 

The only notable bad thing was the margarita they made me. EWWWW...but that's more my fault for ordering tequila at this kind of bar.
author: Julia N.

description: Alright so this is the only place where I watched lakers games and i wasn't the only one screaming and cheering when Odom and Kobe was doin their thing.  All of the staff here rock and the crowd reflect the kinda joint they are holding down.  The kicker- you may bring in any kine food cuz they have only popcorn and nuts--sweet.
author: omar b.

description:
I like Yancy's for a few simple reasons:  1) There's a genuine "mellow-factor" here (which is a must, in my opinion, to enjoy yourself comfortably at a saloon establishment), 2) the bar staff members are super funnn-aae, and 3) the location is waaaaay convenient for us Inner Sunset kids.

I'd like to come back on a busier night and see how I'd feel about the bar, but for now I'm assigning 3.5 stars, which is a pretty deece rating to give a bar.  

I'll be back, Yancy, just you wait.  ;-]
author: Katie C.

description:
This place could be cooler. For the InSu it's definitely the 'frat' bar of choice, and with no shortage of football and hanging plants, it's usually chock full of drunken youngsters. 

Great bar to chill during off hours and find a little nook to hide out in. Just leave before all the kids show up.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Busy bar with tons of bric-a-brac (I heart bric-a-brac) everywhere, lots of flat screens showing the NBA finals on this particular night,, and really cute bartenders serving up beers on tap for reasonable prices.  

I hear it's always full of UCSF med students, but barring the superdouche scrubs-and-pager look I saw none unless they'd just assimilated into normal pubgoing humans.

The dart room in the back was sweet, as was the fact that nearly everyone had brought hot takeout dinner with them. 

I'd go back, but the intense crowd was a little much and the bartenders, while nice to look at, were not much to talk to.
author: Eric S.

description: Great bar. One of my favorite watering holes. Not too packed, but has people.  Darts, good beer, many TVs, laid back staff. Bathrooms could ve cleaner though.  Good times.
author: Arthur K.

description: Definitely my favorite bar to hang out in.  Great atmosphere, friendly and fast bartenders and their jukebox......it has everything!
author: Carlos L.

description:
3 stars because Dragon Lounge is a better place to go. Yancy's is a good Sunset backup for those weeks you have to avoid Dragon Lounge because your good buddy got drunk and insulted a bunch of the bartenders and you need to lay low. As usual, you have to deal with Irving parking, although at night it's not so much of a problem after the dinner rush ends.

The "Snake Bite" or "Snake Eyes" or whatever (beer with raspberry) is pretty good. Does that make me a girl? Bite me.

Wow, I wrote this 3 years ago. Liking Yancy's more and more.
author: Karl K.

description:
In high school, I'd occasionally hang around 9th & Irving and at 16, I said I would have my first legal drink at Yancy's! Of course, that never happened... but I did eventually come here when I was 22 years... and 8 months old, haha.

This place is suuuuper laid back but not a dirty dive bar, and has that "where everyone knows your name" vibe -- I like it. It can get pretty crowded on game nights (last night - Lakers = madness!) but still quick to get drinks. It's a nice place to have a chill night with friends.
author: Miss H.

description:
Came here to watch a game (Stanley Cup finals, go Pens!) without knowing a single person.  Not only were the bar staff friendly and cool, but the other patrons were also easy to talk to.  Well, minus the one guy who gave me the heebie jeebies (yes, I really did use that term).  

The beer on draft selection was decent (would've been better if they still had Smithwick's on tap!) and the prices decent for SF.  They have many TVs all throughout the saloon as well as darts in the back.  I will certainly come back here!
author: A L.

description: Came in after work, was initially happy with the bar seats next to the open windows. But then the bar tender dismissively told us there were no drink menus, and brought us two wrong orders, even though he wasn't serving anyone else.  He informed us that they only take cash also. Not the Friday after work fun that we were looking for, by far.  Lack luster snack choice also.  Will only NOT come again, but also recommend against them.
author: Willis S.

description:
Yancy's saloon had good drinks. The waitress was very attentive, bringing out our drinks in time and just as we ordered them.

The place was crowded on a saturday night with a steady stream of patrons. They did not however have any snacks but there is an awesome pizza place two stores down- they make some incredible pizza and you can bring it in here.

They also had some dart boards in the back.
Cash only!
author: Andy r.

description:
I can't review the food or drinks or anything, because all I did was run through, go to the back and use the can.  It was very oder-iffic, a very strong smell of urine.  And, a little bit cramped.  But they were playing Journey.

Don't Stop Believing, I tell you!!!
author: Happy C.

description:
Yancy's has given birth to a new bad habit of mine. Whether it's stepping of N Judah to walk home or on my way to dinner at Lime Tree, I find myself stepping into this place for a beer...which then ends up being two. Perhaps it's the continuous sports programming playing at the 5+ TV screens. I don't even watch sports! But at Yancy's I'm in a trance staring up at the screens and enjoying the mellow vibe that goes around. 

Hey, kudos for a place which still cards me every time I'm there.

Weeknights are calmer than weekends. The place can get kinda Animal House with guys making desperate moves to pick up girls. Quite hilarious!
author: Jonny M.

description:
My Jameson(s) were nice, heavy pours and the darts were well balanced.

For that, I can ignore the gigantic tv screens with sports games and some of the other patrons. It's in the hood, or I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Caroline C.

description: Stopped by for a drink here with a friend after work yesterday and wasn't too impressed.  The bartender was very friendly and provided us with great service, but the bar as a whole didn't do much for me.  The music was fairly annoying, and the whole place feels kinda like drinking at the bar at an Applebee's.  Maybe it's a bit better latter on in the evening, but for a happy hour bar there are better options in this neighborhood.
author: Joshua W.

description: Bummer bartender guy has no like for life as i was served w his bad attitude.... Lame
author: Adrienne G.

description: Must tell all NFL Sunday Football fans that this is as good as it gets in San Francisco. If you are hardcore NFL and want to watch all the games at once then Yancy's is the place for you. You can bring your own food, do it. I will be there to start the season, despite the fact that its way on the other side of town. See u there NFL Football madmen!
author: bob m.

description: Great spot to watch a game, chill out and maybe bring in some pizza from down the block.  The best part about this place, as long as she's there, is the fun cocktail waitress with the pixie haircut...you are awesome!
author: Harmony T.

description: Cool that they have so many screens, but when I went they were all on the same channel. Seems like a pretty average bar to me. Cash only.
author: Chris I.

description: Rednecky UCSF med students come here to get drunk, watch sports television and play darts.  My girlfriend and I sometimes come here on weeknights when it's emptier to drink beer and play a videogame called erotic photohunt.
author: Jeremiah M.

description:
I go here because sometimes I want to get blitzed, watch every dam** sports event that is happenin' on the planet (at the same time), and have room to stretch, view and expound with friends upon topics Great and Small (but mostly Great)

The place to go on a casual afternoon, for happy hour, during any sports season, or for any other time when you'd like to detour off your gal-pal's Mobius Loop of Fun/Hell into Union Square-Marina District-Fondue Night w/ the girlz.

See you there.  I'll be the one ordering drinks for the house.
author: Jim W.

description:
my favorite bar in the sunset. i love the fact its feels homey and the drinks are also cheap!

beer and darts = fun!
author: Carol Y.

description: This place is great to hang out with friends, either to just hang out or to watch a game. The atmosphere is pretty chill and the staff seems to care about their customers. Also free popcorn as a snack is a plus and the option to bring in outside food (according to other reviews) seems like a great alternative to popcorn. Also the three dart boards in the back is a great touch for people to do while drinking. Would have given it a 5 star if the place didn't look so dirty and the bathroom didn't look dirty/creepy. Anyways great place.
author: Danny W.

description:
My first experience at Yancy's involved one too many Tokyo Teas, a lot of hate stares from the old crowd in the front, and a raucous sing-along to Bon Jovi with the other degenerates in the establishment. 

And to think: I don't even go to USF!

I don't think anyone else (especially my liver) appreciated it, but I had fun.
author: Sachi T.

description:
Yancy's was the last holdout yuppy fern bar in town.  It's still the same now, only there are no yuppies left and the place is looking mighty dated.  1988 to be precise.  So it's no longer scorned by the town's scuzzier drunkards, they might even pay a visit.  There's a dartboard.  Only thing missing is an oyster bar, nachos, the bud girls.  No food at all here, actually, just popcorn.  But Irving street is a cheap ethnic food mecca.  Within a block there's Thai, Vietnamese, Chinese, New Orleans, Italian, Mexican, Japanese, Middle Eastern, Indian, Pakistani, extraterrestrial. . .

3/2007 update: they now have FREE WIRELESS ALL NIGHT LONG!!!!  But the three star rating stays the same b/c the stale beer smell permeating the carpet has gotten much stronger.
author: Gil S.

description: I don't really go to bars, but I really liked this one. The design of this bar instantly caught my attention and the atmosphere in general was very cozy and relaxing. The crowd is very down to earth and friendly, along with the staff. I'll definitely be back. After all, I need more practice on the dart boards. :)
author: Narina A.

description: On a whim I decided to check Yancy's yelp rating, and anyone who does not rate this place high is way off base. I made a damn account just to give it 5 stars.
