Yancy's is without a doubt my favorite place to go out in SF. Bartenders are awesome, atmosphere is great and so is the price of drinks. I am not saying this because I am a regular. I am a regular because everything I have said is the absolute truth. Best bar I have been to, and I will be hard pressed to find a bar I feel more at home at God forbid I move.
author: James K.

description: Really like this joint.  Friendly bartenders and very unpretentious yet a nice selection of beers and booze.  Good for a few nightcaps after a tasty meal in the 9th ave corridor.
author: Rory J.

description:
What I like best about Yancy's is that when it's dead empty, you can enjoy yourself with your friends. I figure you can do that almost anywhere, but Yancy's in particular you can kick back and chop it up with your homies.

I have never been when it's packed, thank god, but it's a neighborhood joint that maintains that vibe.
author: Charlene L.

description:
Mind you this review is for my visit on St. Patrick's Day AND March Madness. AND....UCLA won....(which had they lost, could've dramatically changed my opinion of the place... : P)

There was, as many people have already noted, a diverse crowd. It's a nice loud boisterous bar (perhaps due to the aforementioned holiday and event).

My favorite thing is when I asked the bartender for a menu and he said: "we don't serve food here." That would explain how/why people were walking in with huge pizza boxes from the place just on the corner down the street a bit.

My friend Jenny and I crossed the street to Yumma's Mediterranean food which went nicely with beer. : )  

The only bad thing is with my old age, i have old eyes and can't see too well on the smaller t.v. screens. We finally moved over to the room near the darts section and watched on the giant clear screen.

I must also mention....there was a guy wearing a kilt standing by the door.... in cold SF weather. That alone should get a whole entire star!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I used to hang out at this bar quite frequently when I lived in the neighborhood.  Shit, I've spent a couple NYEs here (sad and pathetic...i know).  What can I say?  I like this place.  The regulars at the bar on a Monday night, darts, pac man, popcorn, etc.....

I will admit though....Alan the owner/bartender is kind of a prick.  Alan, I hope you get laid soon...maybe that will change your rotten attitude.
author: Christina S.

description:
I didn't see the frat boy crowd some of the previous reviewers posted about. It seemed like a pretty cool bar, lots of people and super packed, but my friend and I were able to find a table so we had some space.

The drinks weren't bad ($7 for a long island, $5 for rum + coke), they had popcorn for $1! I'm a sucker for popcorn, so this bar gets an extra star from me. The music wasn't bumpngrind-let-me-almost-hump-you music. It was a good fun mix of 90s alt rockish stuff. So I didn't feel like I was getting harassed by assholes and their crotches throughout the night.

Servers were friendly and fast, drinks were strong, place was clean, crowd was pleasant and interesting, lots of TVs around to watch whatever sports you're interested in (winter X games!). Fun, busy atmosphere to hang out with a friend if you're not feeling like being a hermit one night.
author: Liz L.

description: 4 STARS for the all the tvs and selection, not 5 stars cause of the muchieless bar.
author: Zachary B.

description:
Casual and comfy with a good juke box...nice place to catch up with friends and enjoy a beer (many choices on tap!) and a random assortment of music.  FYI - they also have raspberry cider (I haven't seen this around much) for you non-beer lovers...

Update (2/5/07): added a star because this is a fun place for darts!
author: Joyce L.

description:
Update: 1.27.08: Yancy's has...wifi?! whoa...

This is my local bar so I'm kinda biased. I threw my last toga party here, YES, toga party. They have this fancy jukebox now so it has every song you can imagine. During the afternoon, most customers are a bit older, but after happy hour, Fridays and Saturdays there is a younger crowd. 

We usually order Pasquale's from next door bring it back to Yancy's and play Pac Man or darts.  They have one huge big screen and a couple of tvs. Drinks are inexpensive and folks are pretty laid back. Yes, they only take cash, but there is a Bank of America on 9th and Irving and a Wells Fargo and Citibank across the street. They also have restaurants/fast food places near by.
How can you not like Yancy's? 

And the bartenders are sweethearts :)

Other bars close by--Mucky Duck(up 9th), Little Shamrock (9th and Lincoln), Fireside (across the street closer to 8th), and Canvas Cafe across from Little Shamrock.
author: Kris O.

description:
Think about it for a second: a saloon conjures up all sorts of crazy images, wild west cowboys throwing open double doors to a shady dive, while winos are passed out on the bar and the pianoman plays away....

so take away the pianoman, double doors and replace them with dartboards and viney hangy planty things that are so long and creepy you'd swear they're drinking you're beer while you're not looking- or maybe that's just me.

Rough around the edges, like a nicely worn shoe, Yancys fits the bill when you want to keep it local, have  a nice beer and throw some darts- or watch a game on their mega jumbotron. No cover, no drama...just let that stale beer smell sweep you to beer-vana.....
author: Tim V.

description:
A nice bar with a friendly environment! I like the diversity, and a lot of college students from USF and UCSF frequent this location. The seating areas are plentiful, and they have a darting area in the back as well. 

Try not to dart while drunk! You might hit someone in the face with one of those! OUCH!
author: Andrew W.

description:
Wow, I REALLY like Yancy's a lot!!

It was a beautiful Sunday afternoon. We had just finished breakie at Crepevine just up the road. We were heading back home, with no agenda. We chatted about heading over to the park to soak up some rays and enjoy this beautiful day outside. We walked past Yancy's and I kinda popped my head in to see if the game was on. It was the Conference Championships, Bears  vs. New Orleans. Now, I don't give a crap about football, we just happened to be a friends house the previous weekend for the play-offs, so for some reason I was slightly interested in how the game was going. 

Anyway, back to the bar, the sandwich board outside mentioned Bloody Mary's and suddenly I had a desire to go in for a drink. "Ooh, anyone up for a Bloody?" The three of us decided to go in for "one". I was a little apprehensive to go into a dark bar on such a beautiful sunny day in January. But I brought it up so I had to comply.

The bar is great. It's clean, it's comfortable and it's a decent sized place. There were several hanging plants and lovely old school hanging lamps. 

We grabbed some tables in the front of the bar. The front had opened air windows with just the right amount of sunshine. I was so pleased here. I got my Bloody, I got my sunshine and I got a very relaxing laid back Sunday afternoon.

Kudos to Yancy's for providing a nice, clean atmosphere!
author: alexa c.

description:
Memory 1
*******************************
Que Music.....Journey's "Don't stop believing"
Brian says to me watch this.....

Que White girls only singing the chorus!  Learn the song!  Its not that hard.
*******************************

Memory 2
*******************************
Patrick goes a crazy Air Jordan like streak of defeating all comers on trivia all night long, all night long!

Memory 3
******************************
Yes that was me throwing darts, drunk, sitting from the chair, at weird angles and generally using darts like his on Jordan Vs Bird competition.  

Good times, good times.
author: patrick o.

description:
Cool neighborhood bar! It's HUGE, there's bar seating, lots of tables, couches and even an area dedicated to darts. 

The music is loud, but not too loud where you can't have a conversation, but loud enough that if you know the words to the song and it just happens to be your favorite song (at the moment) and you have to sing as loud as you can - you can do it. 

There are also a lot of TVs with different types of games for the sports lovers and the walls are decorated with all types of photographs and signage. Lots to look at - including all the people. 

The drinks were good and the service was decent. The bathroom wasn't that bad and I had a good time. I will definitely consider this bar again if I'm in the area!
author: Gladys C.

description:
Though this ain't really my neighborhood, this is what I would consider my neighborhood bar.  Does that make sense??  Well, what Yancy's is to me is that bar we go to when we can't think of anywhere else to go.  Not a bad place to fall back on.  The crowd is always diverse.  Always seems lively in there.  Sports, Beers, Cocktails, Peanuts, Friends.....  

Not much more you need in life.  Always a good time and comfortable tooo...
author: Mark W.

description:
UPDATE (3/31/08):  They replaced one of the crappy dartboards with a nice soft new one!  I helped break it in yesterday.  (One down, two to go!)
===

The other reviewers have the drink/big tv/sports bar stuff covered well, so I will target the darting experience.  Pun intended, deal with it.

Rather than get my younger brother some stupid gift from ThinkGeek on his last birthday I thought it would be cool to mix it up and buy him a set of pro darts.  He doesn't throw darts, but he's a guy and guys like any game where you can potentially lose an eye when the fun's over.

But I'm a guy too and I realized that if he's going to have 24gram pro darts, I've got to get myself a set of 25g darts and practice prior to his birthday so that, when he comes to SF for a visit, I can beat his smarmy twentysomething ass.  Gotta keep the younger brothers down as long as I still can.  Am I right, eldest siblings?

I digress.

After searching around a bit and finding some amazingly crappy dart setups at most bars/pubs I rediscovered Yancy's.  I live near Cole Valley, so it's convenient for me.  Since the birthday festivities, my brothers and I have returned, meeting fun women in the process which is always nice!

Here's the downlow on the metal hurling action.

The Good
They have three well lit dartboards.  The throw lines are clearly marked and there are plently of pens and paper pads for keeping score.  The waitress does a great job of keeping us well supplied with Fat Tire and Guinness.  This is important and appreciated.

The Bad
Dartboards themselves look like they've been broken in at a military range.  Time to replace the dartboards folks.  Once a decade whether they need it or not.  Consequently, darts frequently ricochet off the frayed metal boundaries.  Someone is definitely going to lose an eye.

Conclusion
Despite the bad part, the social atmosphere and proximity to my neighborhood makes it worth visiting every now and then, but I'm still looking for better options.

And, yes, I kicked his ass.  Fortysomethings rock!  (Though now I'm worried that I'll be surprised with a set of boxing gloves on my birthday)
author: Leon S.

description:
Nice, chill hangout spot. So nice that half of the people I went to high school with go there too. I don't know what it is about seeing people from high school that makes everyone cringe but I am not immune to it. 

They have TVs galore so you can OD on the Olympics and other sports. They also have three dartboards! 

This seems like a place people just go to before or after something else and not so much a destination because it emptied out by about midnight on a Friday night. 

They have a pretty wide selection of beers. Stick to beer here. I don't recommend buying cocktails unless you hate yourself.
author: Janelle B.

description:
nice roomy area if you can get a table, nice mixed crowds. great that waitresses take ur order for drinks and brings it to you. had a good time with friends, some henny, remy, and some other stuff.

nice crowd n area, would come again.

oh and bathrooms were kinda clean too, parking might be hard to find on busier nights
author: Christine M.

description: This bar has such a great atmosphere! We played darts in the back while the table in the corner played flip cup. There are tvs all over the place so any game you want to see it will most definitely  be on! The servers/bartenders were cool, they were tentative to us and fun to chat with.
author: Heather M.

description:
I went to Yancy's last weekend and I must say I was throughly impressed. Then again i'm not entirely sure what I expected to begin with, in any case I had a great time. 

I was loving the atmosphere that Yancy's creates, seriously everyone was sitting down and just hanging out. It truly is a place for hanging out, definitely not a place for dancing, but what do you expect in the sunset district?

The prices were extremely fair, I actually pulled out $40 when i got two beers a vodka cranberry, and a vodka tonic. Truth is, they only charged me a little over $20. Not bad right? yeah i thought so too. 

If you ever feel like just hanging out and not going all the way downtown to "pop bottles" yancy's is perfect for you.

 I APPROVE!
author: Eric T.

description: Great bar! Plenty of space and tables + waitress comes and gets your drink order. I give it 4 stars because CASH only, and no ATM inside to get cash!
author: TheOneAndOnly T.

description:
The place has a lot of space, always has a fresh air about it, especially during the day, due to the skylights and vine plants that adorn the walls and columns.  A great place to come for a Bloody Mary on a Sunday afternoon.  Bonus points for dartboards and cute employees.

Would definitely get 5 stars if the guy that runs the place wasn't such an unfriendly wanker.
author: Jackson R.

description:
I used to work around this area and have been around this area for many years but I never noticed this place until someone told us to go there and the rest is history.  My friends love this place and even though I don't really like coming here so often, it's still a pretty good bar.

Rarely is there a huge crowd that makes you want to leave because you can't get service.  There is  usually a good amount of people but it's not hard for you to find a bunch of seats for you and your friends.  The service is usually quick and the drinks aren't bad.  There are a few tvs here and there but I usually come here late night so I can't say anything about the crowd during game time.

Parking is pretty good after 10p when the restauraunts are all closed.  During the day, parking can be tough.  You might as well hop on the N Judah and everyone can get sloshed.  

The one positive (or negative) is that I rarely see anyone totally noisy and obnoxious after drinking too much.  Everyone just seems too chill here.  Sometimes I enjoy a good fight or someone revealing too much but that rarely happens.  I did see a fight evolve here but it was kinda weak.  The best part was when someone scrubbed and  knocked over a newspaper rack.  That was the most action of the fight.
author: Jason Y.

description:
You gotta know what you're getting into with this place: it's very chill, low-key, friendly, diverse but with the inevitable over-glammed Marina-type here and there. But overall, it's comfortable, cozy and a different experience every night. If you get bored watching the several TV's playing sports, you can play Mrs. PacMan, Darts or just walk around and make some new friends with friendly people, which is my favorite thing to do-- and you can do it all in your jeans and sneakers. Good, but unexceptional beers on tap and friendly bartenders/waitresses all nights of the week.

Final thought: two thumbs up
author: Esther K.

description:
Love this damn place. It's become my local neighborhood bar...even while its like 15 blocks away.
Best Long Island's AND Long Beach Ice Teas in the city for sure. It oddly empties out some Friday nights around 11:30-12, and other Friday's, thats when it gets started.
Their most awesome quality is that they have a jukebox which is pretty much a huge iPod. Current songs and oldies....if you ever heard James Brown's "get on up" then some current hip-hop, you know that I am in the house.
author: Nic K.

description:
Came here last Saturday to watch the Cal-Oregon game (which until last night was the Greatest Pac-10 Game of 2007). There isn't a bad seat in the house. TV's are everywhere. You can sit in the back with a big group and enjoy a colossal big screen, or you can sit at the bar and look up at one of three 27" flat screens fixed above.

On this Saturday afternoon Yancy's was half full. There were folks from the neighborhood dropping in for a draft, watching the game or chatting with the co-ed bartender, and of course there was a big party of rabid Golden Bear and Duck fans whooping it up in the back. I haven't been here at night, but I imagine the three dartboards see a lot of action.

Bottom line: terrific place to watch an afternoon game.
author: William L.

description:
my friend's husband had a dream, open and close a bar.

yancy's was his target. show up before the bar opens, and be the last person to walk out at closing time. yancy's opens up at 12noon saturdays, closing at 2am.

i wanted to see this so i swung by at 10pm, and i've never seen someone so tired and bloated!!

regardless, we had drinks every hour, played darts, and watched goltv.   the place got packed between 11-1, the crowd was mixed but not my ideal. free popcorn was nice too, but not very easy to access.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Great.  I was there a few weeks ago, and ghost town I tell you!!!  How great it is that?  Granted this was on a cold Sunday night, but who cares, the game was on, and the bartender was quick to serve.  

No wait, no lines, I say for a weekend game place, pseudo fern bar.  Go to it!
author: Nicole F.

description: Cool bar to hang out when you're not expecting anything big like dancing or clubbing or awesome free music. Its very simple drinks but they do have some good beer and wine list. Lots of TV to watch sports channel. The reason I love this place is because they allow you to bring food in and eat and drink and hang out without any hassle. Friendly staff!
author: Sflady S.

description: Cool bar to chillax, have a few drinks, get sports updates on their TVs, play some video games, and shoot some darts.  Nice mixed crowd with reasonably priced drinks.
author: Patrick C.

description: Cool place to hang out. Very large space, so good for groups. Prices are kinda high though. Also, I wish they would accept credit cards.
author: James A.

description:
VITO CORLEONE: You spend time with your family?

JOHNNY: Sure I do.

VITO CORLEONE: Good. 'Cause a man who doesn't spend time with his family can never be a real man. 

When I'm done being a real man, and it's a weekend night and me and my buddies have nothing better to do, we'll head over to Yancy's for a beer or three.  And there's a couple things you can be guaranteed if you go here:

(1) The waitress will be new.

(2) The drinks will not be too expensive.

(3) The waitress will be cute.

(4) C'mon, after (2) and (3) do you need anything more?

Seriously, the only real drawbacks to this place are that it's not in the most happenin' part of town, and during past visits I've been subjected to live cover bands.  I think they got rid of the cover bands, and if you came here then you're probably not after the most happenin' part of town anyway.  So Yancy's, I give you four stars.  Allez cuisine!
author: Chuck W.

description:
SF Food Inspection Score: 96

Love this place. It's been a second home to me since I was 20. 

The drinks are always top notch, the people are always friendly, and the prices are always reasonable.

It's great to go to a place that is in your neighborhood and doesn't really change. 

Sometimes, it gets pretty packed so try to get there early and save some chairs and tables.
author: Kristina C.

description:
So Yancy's may not take credit cards, and you won't find a pitcher of beer in sight...but in the end it doesn't matter.  

Yancy's is the perfect spot to gather with friends.  Kristina C. introduced me to this place and it's been our group's pow wow spot for some time now.  Go to Yancy's for fun.  The staff is friendly, the crowd that comes to drink isn't too douche-y, and there is diversity within the faces.  

The perfect spot for a chill drink or a night of craziness in the Sunset!
author: Jennifer S.

description: This bar has a nice dim-light setting. You can come and watch sports games on the TVs. There's dartboards to play with but you need to borrow the darts from the bar with an id or something. The mixed drinks were not that great.
author: Lisa L.

description: Awesome bartenders and decent vibe here. Lots of people from SFSU come here so slightly younger crowd. Doesn't accept credit cards, cash only which is a big hassle. They do have popcorn though!
author: M S.

description:
Awesome bar. Another thing that prevents me from giving this the full 5 is the crowd it attracts on weekends.

Perfect for weeknights. I know it says "sports bar" in the tagline, but it's got a very classy air to it. It's kinda like Buca Di Beppo inside.

Cute bartender too. Friend tried to bug her while she was working. (Dick.) True story.
author: Alexander D.

description: This bar reminds me of a suburban strip mall bar. There really isn't much else I can say about this place. Meh.
author: David C.

description: Everyone needs a "local," and Yancy's fits the bill nicely.  I love the decor - it's a little "divey" and "ferny," which I find comfortable. The drinks are honest and well-priced.  Service can be spotty, but there's lots of seating.  The excess of tellies is the only downside - there is no place for your eyes to escape them.
author: Therese P.

description:
I love Yancy's. When I want the perfect Long Island I go straight to Alan, my favorite bartender. They've got several flat screens all along the walls turned to various channels so you have a few to choose from or...you can watch one while the other one has commercials. The crowd is never too rowdy or crazy, it's a place where you can just go and have a few drinks with friends. They also have darts, for those who enjoy that.

Over the past few years, it has become more of a sports bar because when I first started coming it didn't have all the tvs, but unless you come during big games, it won't really affect you.
author: Tiff L.

description:
Pretty cool sports bar/local pub to get your drink on.  It had a nice relaxed vibe with a pretty mixed crowd (though more guys than girls it seemed). Being a sports bar, it had plenty of tvs all around showing various things... I'd like to add that most of the programs I saw were in HD.  I came here the Saturday before St Patty's, so the place was adorned with green and 4-leaf clovers.  

Drinks:  Contrary to another post, I had the Guinness and it did not taste like piss water... maybe it was busier that night so I got fresher beer?  My friend had recommended the Bay City Bomber, which from what I recall, was some form of Long Island Ice Tea.  I didn't have it, but based on the friends that did, the effects appeared to be devastating.

Food:  No idea, but you can order pizza from the place next door and they'll actually come into the place to deliver it to you.  Also there's an oyster bar across the street, yum.

Overall a cool place to come and hang out with your friends.  It also helped that the Heinekken girls were there giving away stuff.  Oh Misty, thanks for the lei  *heart*.
author: Horace L.

description:
Opposite of a sensory deprivation tank come here to have them blown out.  TV's surround you so gather around the one showing your sports team because we all know they would never win without us die hard fans.  LOL.  Calm down buddy.... screaming at the TV.... yeah that will totally help.  They do play music at the same time, but I am not really sure why because there was a major game on and there isn't a dance floor.  However if the ladies want to dance on the tables by all means keep the music playing.

We got a table and debated playing darts, sorry no pool table, but more importantly ordered some beers, $4.50.
Got hungry, no food, but stay positive bucko as you can bring in whatever you like from the surrounding establishments ranging from pizza, Mexican, fallafel, etc.
Got cash? That's what it'll take to procure that (insert tasty beverage here).

Overall it depends if you are an optimist or not, but role here with a good crew and it's all good.
author: Po L.

description: Besides for Alan scamming a filming crew, this place is decent enough to watch a game. Lots of TVs and places to sit. Drinks were pretty cheap. AND you can bring in your own food to eat. When I was there for the World Cup Finals, there seemed to be only one server though, so service is a bit lacking.
author: Patrick P.

description: Really nice place to come either with a friend or a group. One of my favorite places to watch a game. They have lots of TV's and one huge one (have to get there pretty early to claim the channel). Nice selection of beers, usually some seasonal. Only problem is no cards and no pitchers.  I would suggest starting at this bar for a drink before moving on.
author: Erin S.

description:
Went here after dinner. The playoffs were on the big tv and the place wasn't super packed yet.  The waitress came over, took our order and came back with it pretty quickly. She was nice.  

I drank 2 gin and tonics (needed more tonic) and a jack and coke (needed more jack), but still manged to get a slight buzzy happy feeling. However, it could've been attributed to having 3 drinks.

I would come back here again, especially with my husband on game nights.
author: A L.

description:
3.5 stars. Noisy college crowd, but a serviceable place for a drink, not as scary as (say) the Silver Spur. Sometimes awesome place for people watching. Good dartboards hidden in the back. Good place for internet and a beer. Keep an eye on nextmuni and you won't have to stand outside in the rain or with the bums.

The first or second time that girlfriend and I went there, when girlfriend went for a bathroom break, a girl came out of the ladies' room and left in a hurry, followed by a hostess. Girlfriend returned to the table and said that when she went in, the hostess had been chastizing a couple in one of the stalls: "You shouldn't be fucking in the bathroom!".
author: Joseph H.

description:
This is a nice place to hang out with a few buddies and throw back a few since it's so spacious and they have the games on....

I gave it a three because the waitress ABSOLUTELY SUCKED!!! I mean, she was completely HORRIBLE.  We sat near the door and decided to move to another table that just recently became vacant and on our attempt to move, the waitress came over to us.  So politely, we informed her that we were going to switch tables because it was to cold sitting near the doorway.  She looked at us and said, "okay?", with an attitude, paused, and said "Did you want me to clean that for you too?".....after picking my jaw back up from the ground because I couldn't believe her attitude, I said, "of course I do."  Did she seriously think I was going to remove all of the glass and wipe down the table? Not to mention she had a disgusting attitude the rest of the night so we ended up leaving early.  Seriously.  I hope the next time I go there and spend a fortune on drinks, it isn't the time of the month and she isn't treating customers like crap.

Come to think of it, if I didn't like the atmosphere so much, I would've given this place 1 star!
author: Jenny F.

description:
This is my favorite neighborhood bar in SF - always a great time here! Drinks are reasonably priced and Alan and Alisandro are always generous with their pours (is it bad when you know the bartenders by name?).  They even let you order food from the outside and bring it in (perfect for those 1 AM munchies). I have fun shooting darts and playing their video games (Run 21 Rules!). 

The crowd is always diverse, lively, and friendly. Like I said - a great neighborhood bar. Don't mistake this place for a nightclub, lounge, or a place where everybody is dressed to the nines. It's very casual. That's what I like about it. Also, a great selection of songs from their music machine. Depending on the crowd, you may hear Too Short followed by AC/DC. A final note of caution: beware of their Jagermeister machine after 1 AM unless you enjoy morning after headache and dehydration! 5 stars for Yancy's -- cheers!
author: Phil S.

description: I have been comming to yancy's for 5 years Allen,Doug,they are all great bartenders,acted a idiot many time and still they let me come back,ahah,good drinks,some hot woman,hah,and great to hang out with friends watch a game and play darts.
author: Kristopher M.

description:
I do avoid this place during certain times - mostly because I'm not a big weekend night party kind of guy, otherwise I like going

Pluses:
darts, the whole vine theme, pleasant & cheerful staff, the plants in kegs out front, the big TV in the back and the smaller ones at the bar for sports, they allow food in (they only have chips, popcorn, peanuts, etc), a good selection of microbrews and good imported beer on tap and...............

about 15 different alcoholic coffee combos - all good! And they whip up the cream for the top - worth the 5-6 bucks. Great for me since I have an uphill walk home - keeps the blood nice and warm!

I would say the prices are $ - they have happy hours with good deals - of course I mostly do beer, maybe the liquor drinks have so so prices?
author: Emmet M.

description: I like this place for a chill date or going with a few friends for drinks...the atmosphere is college like and the prices are decent. Bring cash cause they dont take cards. It can get loud on fri or sat so if its a date then go sun-thurs. They let you bring food in which is a plus. Darts and pac-man tables are not bad. I like this place and recommend it
author: Eric S.

description:
i have one question and one question only...
sup with the shrubbery?!?

carpets, darts, and plants. thats all i can really remember.
oh and a clean bathroom.
oh and a kid from north carolina who has insecurity issues.

thats about it. i couldnt tell you anything more. and for that i am sorry.
(not really).
author: A. V.

description:
Yancy's has pizza?  I had never heard of another pizza joint along Irving/9th except for Pasquale's and Villa Roma.  Hearing that the Bay 2 Breakers Yelp after-party was going to congregate here, I hoped for the best, but didn't have high hopes, as far as pizza goes.  I was more than happy when we entered the saloon and found plenty of seating and multiple flat-screen TVs displaying all types of sports.  Darts, an awesome jukebox, as well as video match-games, are all available to help pass the time.  Having just finished fighting our way through the B2B traffic (and by that I mean we cheated and got a ride from Central to Irving), we were beat and ready to relax.  And relax we did...with beer and plenty of pizza delivered from Pasquale's up the block.  While Yancy's could've passed as an old time pizza joint, they don't have pizza, but allowed us to cater it in.  They allowed the Yelp following to liven up their Sunday afternoon with some PG13-R rated shenanigans:

http://www.flickr.com/photos/30178015@N00/2511933276/in/set-72157605177207744/

http://www.flickr.com/photos/30178015@N00/2511104565/in/set-72157605177207744/

All in all, staff was great and treated us well.  Yancy's is a great place to catch a game and unwind.
author: JeFF T.

description: You know, this bar isn't so bad. Sure its got a palpable Applebee's-in-the-eighties feel about it, warped floors and smells like a frat house, but its big and roomy, has lots of tv's and tables, cheap drinks and isn't too terribly loud as many bars are.  They don't take credit cards though.
author: Rick H.

description: Yancy's is my type of place. It's laid back, reasonably priced and far from stuffy. It's a nice clean place with an easy going crowd and a fantastic location. I went on a Tuesday at about 7 and by 10pm the placed was packed so I don't know how crowded it get's on the weekends. Yancy's has a cool vibe; it's dark and plays some great classic rock. What's even better is that Pasquale's Pizza is right on the corner; we grabbed a few pizza's and enjoyed our evening. Check it out if your looking for a casual night and a cold beer. I really enjoyed myself.
author: Denise S.

description:
bar-tenders are equipped with ipods. someone played good hip hop here... like a tribe called quest good hip hop.

good hip hop+correctly poured guinness=good times with 2008 team yelp b2b

=)
author: watani f.

description: If you are looking for a place to watch major sports this place is ok, but if you are looking for that random game on a random channel this is NOT the place to go.  I once asked if they were carrying a college game onc saturday in the fall and the bartender asked if I was talking about football - hello! Much better off going to Kezar.....
author: Kevin C.

description:
[NOT an overdue entry... despite the other 2 i wrote AFTER this are, but i guess i'll dedicate today as a dedication to the SUNSET district).

11:02pm PST.
Just got in from Yancy's & because I can't seem to sleep since I'm slightly buzzed on a (great! Slaps forehead) Sunday evening... Crap! I have 8 more hours to sleep before I go to work. =( For a Sunday evening, it was pretty busy, prolly up to 30 or so heads.

Am I crazy to even wanting to THINK TWICE about coming all the way to the Sunset to Yancy's to watch a game or two? 

Duuuuuuuuude, Bayside Sports out in the Marina doesn't even COMPARE!

THIS is what I envision a true sports bar to be. This place is simply great. 

Both the crowd and Yancy's itself are both extremely kick back, chill spacey, friendly bartenders who are quick. I have to say that they got some comfy ass seats!  in the middle, there is a place where you can seriously lie down, wooden stools against the bar, and wooden tables/chairs throughout, but it's not as bad as it sounds. 

Came here once on a Friday night few weeks back and tonight, different vibe, of course, since Fri, it's more popping, but tonight, very low key.

Drinks were mighty strong.

Happy hours M-F 2-7pm. 
$3 football specials, $3.50 well drinks, $4.50domestic beers, $5 imported.

They have a great selection though, you kno the usuals (beer, MGD, Coors, Budweiser, heineken...)They even have coffee and wine for the others, oh and they even sell snacks for a buck or two. (popcorn, pretzels, chips & salsa).

They have 4 dart thingies in the rear, roughly 10-12 flat screen TVs throughout, ANDDDDDD they have those old school Pac Man games for 25c / player. YES! a QUARTER! like the good ol' days!  I didn't get to play though. whos down to play me sometimes?

Bathroom WAS acceptable, clean, given that we ARE in a sports bar, but on my normal bathroom criteria, it's yucky, but for a bar standards, quite clean, BUT, BUT BUT, they need to work on their locks because this girl walked in on me as I was wiping. (oops, lol, I kno TMI) lol...

I love how you can seriously come on in and be yourself for once, I'm actually talking to the LA folks, no pretentious, snooty 90210 airheads, or as the nor cal peeps call it, "douchebags"... *smirks* =D

If this place was in the Marina, I'd prolly come here quite often, which is why it loses .5 star since it's not local to me, but that's just me and because it's cash only, so it loses another .5 star since it's cash only,

I repeat, CASH ONLY... =(

but, there are ATMs throughout. *shrugs* But I will say, I'm being generous with my ratings because its prolly  one of my fave bars SO FAR in SF.
author: Jennifer S.

description: The bar has improved. The owner has installed hd. tv through out the bar. The only con is cash only. It would have gotten more stars. But you can hear the male bartender making fun of the customers looking to pick up someone. Oh it was 6pm Saturday. People are crazy
author: Stanley L.

description: Cool sports pub with a great beer selection and darts in the back.   Coming here on a Monday night, things were overall very chill and very cool, other than a group of rowdy 21 year olds.   Lots of space, so good for groups.
author: John H.

description: I came into the city and needed a place to just chill with friends and this place was more than satisfactory. It was a hip place with flat screen tvs and a section for playing darts. They get a fair amount of customers so it's pretty lively there. They had a good selection of beers but they were out of the Pyramid Hef, which I really wanted to try. This may not have been their fault since we showed up way passed midnight, but then again, what kind of bar runs out of beer.
author: Kevin T.

description: a fun place, one bartender is hottttt ! great place to go if you're waiting for a table at PJ's across the street. I like how the highly varnished bar counter gets all sticky and the coaster sticks, leaving an oogy mess to scrape off. anyhoo ! lots of cute young guys if you're looking, LADIES
author: Prima D.

description: This is a very biased review so consider yourself warned. Yancy's is your typical sports bar plus they have the nudy game. When I did go I prefered week nights, less crowded. Its a favorite among the Sunset dwellers. So how did this bar fall out of favor with me..... its all about trust. You must have some trust between you and your bartendar. That's all I will say.
author: Stacy F.

description: This place smells like vomit and attracts people that like Carrie Underwood and Toby Keith.  It's spacious, though, and I think they have free popcorn.
author: Liza W.

description: round five?..or six?...seven?...eight?....lost count of pub crawl....yancy's saloon final stop....large wooden saloon...x-large for big group drinking....non-crowded and just a bar....plenty of seating or standing.....tables or stools.....grubbin' good free popcorn...."seconds please!"....munch munch munch....gulping down a beer or two...or ten....lost count.....umm...darts..."let me try!!"....fling of dart to side...almost into bathroom....another to the wall...another unknown...dangerous!...drinking and darts don't mix kids....no to sharp objects while drinking....
author: Hen A.

description:
No, I would not like to hear about Fergie's humps, or the Red Hot Chili Peppers singing about the same thing on every album since they started sucking (1995, I think). I came to watch a football game; I'd like to hear it too. So would those other people asking you to turn up the sound. The bar is not that crowded, so no need to snap when I ask you politely. And when the majority of bar patrons are gathered around the big screen TV to watch the same game, doesn't it make sense to turn down Incubus, or Creed, or the Grease soundtrack, or whatever else you're playing in full rotation? 

20 minutes later someone finally came by to turn up the sound. Lo and behold, the music went up too. WAY up. Oh please, curly dark haired bartender, play your games, but not with paying customers.

Bottom line: watch the game elsewhere.
author: Mich L.

description:
If these walls and plants could talk. 

This bar has been host to many of  the highlights of my day drinking career.

 I don't feel that guilty for being inside this bar on a nice day, due to the plants and big windows. Love Yancy's!
author: Meesh S.

description:
This is the perfect "i want to drink, but have a chill night" spot

i.e. no need for heels ladies, come as casual as you want! They didn't card at the door.

AND omg no line for the girls bathroom! AMAZING!
author: elyssa w.

description:
cheap drinks, good vibe.  

so the furniture is a bit worn and the place looks a bit run down, but its a great hang out spot.  Nobody is all up in your business.  Bartenders are nice and not snooty.

Bathroom is as clean as you can ask of it.
author: AhLin C.

description: #1 one place for booze and game days!! its just crazy in there; you must see for yourself!! thats all i can say!! the mystery is for you to find out!
author: Corwin C.

description: It's a solid sports/dive bar..especially for being in the inner sunset. Lots of tables to actually *gasp* sit at with room for friends, dart boards, and parking was a breeze (on a sunday night). Oh and for all of those USF/ State freshman/sophomores..they don't seem to card. Actually the staff will probably see this review and start carding...suckas!..I don't want you kiddies to start invading this bar. Minus one star for not letting us start a tab on our table, and for the cocktail server not checking back on us to see if we wanted more drinks (we had to go find her)
author: Loe B.

description:
yancy's is my neighborhood bar.. oh wait.. i live nowhere near here... but if i did, this would be it... gets crowded later on in the week, but we usually manage to find seats.. it's just a nice place to hang out, kick back a few beers, bitch about life/work/etc, and poke other people's eyes out with my horrible dart-throwing skills. oooo and they have ms pacman here.. not that i will ever play video games in public.. probably worse than my dart throwing.. jukebox is awesome.. good range of songs.. ladies' room is usually clean, and non smelly.. 

never had a problem with service at the bar or w/ a waitress, but the last three times ive been here, they've always run out of anchor steam on tap.. im still not all learned in the beer types, but it must be good if it's out..  will try next time...

good times... boo for being far, and cash only
author: Donna H.

description:
Seen some reviews about this place being empty but it's always jumpin on the nights I come in. Always been a good crowd when I've been here, no dumbasses causing problems though I'm sure it happens on occasion. 

Lot's of TV's and they actually show MMA! I've seen boxing here too. Which is great because while football, baseball, and the like are cool I'd much rather watch MMA and/or boxing matches. Darts, table top video games, lots of seating (which includes couch/booth seating which I consider critical), and gay as it might sound, relaxing decor, haha. All the wood and plants gives it a natural, friendly ambiance. The bartenders/servers are cool and the prices are good. On top of all that they don't hassle you if you bring food in.

Note: Caesar was to beware the Ides of March, you would be wise to be wary of playoff nights if you don't believe in the awesomeness of stench de hot ass. You see, when this place gets really packed it smells, literally, like an oven of butt holes preheated to 350 degrees and left to marinate. Fortunately this is not the norm, and only tends to happen when packed to bursting. I brought my friend here for the first time and she couldn't stand it, so we chilled out front to let the aroma dissipate. Unfortunately it didn't and oozed it's way out onto the front sidewalk. Growing up with a dad and brother who I'd have farting matches with, the smell of butt is something I'm used to, I don't like it, but I can deal. My friend, however, couldn't. So we had to go somewhere else. "Does it always smell THIS bad?"  "The bar or my farts? Because if we're talking about the latter, then no, it's usually much worse. The former, far better."

Two thumbs up!
author: Sol V.

description: Sunday afternoon barkeep = 21 year old college student.  These are not places to get mixed drinks... period.  And I mean bloody's or margs... nothing fancy.  Actually, this place is for sports fans, which I am not.  So... not much love.  No disrespect guys.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: First bar I went to in the city. I like how laid back it is, even on a Friday. Seems like the type of place where I would end my night if I lived in the neighborhood.  Only things I have issues with are the maze to the bathroom and that it's cash only. Otherwise great sports bar, I need to come here during crucial games, so I feel less alone cheering at my TV.
author: Pearl R.

description: When I lived in the Inner Sunset Yancy's was one of my favorite neighborhood bars and I am still always happy to visit. I thought about going in yesterday when I was in the neighborhood, but then I realized it wasn't even 3pm yet. A little early to get started on a Wednesday, but it's just such a nice relaxing space. I once spent four hours here with people just drinking beer and playing dice. If you don't like dice they also have darts. If you don't like darts they also have alcohol and a big screen TV for sports. I will say that this is not a bar I visit for a nice cocktail though. It's really more of a beer and straight alcohol bar.
author: J F.

description:
My friends and I wanted to meet up for a mellow night of drinks and fun. We started at the Fireside bar but it was just too loud and crowded there for us to sit down, or hear ourselves think, let alone talk, so we decided to give this place a try.  It had the mellow atmosphere I was hoping to get.    Even if you're like me, and don't give a crap about sports, you can enjoy yourself here. We found ourselves a table easily, had good service, talked without having to yell, and they even sell snacks (something that, as someone who has frequented izakayas in Japan, I don't get why more bars don't do).
   I'm a little torn about posting this review as I don't want it to turn into the mob scene Fireside Bar was.
author: A J.

description:
local bar close to UCSF filled with students having a few drinks to relieve stress. i hear its the place to be to watch sports cause they just upgraded with new flat screen tvs near the bar. there's also a huge screen in another area too. 

i wish they had bar food cause bar food is the best. they only have chips and salsa for $1 which is pretty good.

had a few drinks and the waitress was really nice asking if we needed anything frequently.
author: Sharon O.

description: I started going to yancy's because it's close to home.  Drinks are pretty good price and the crowd is pretty chill...just what I like.(kinda reminds me of the bars back home)  When I first walked in I didnt feel out of place like on some order bars i've been.  No pressure! For entertainment they have TV, karaoke, darts, and I think they have a pool table (not sure on this one though).  I have nothing bad to say about this place besides their couch...its a little old and the cushion is gone...if they can change that..this place will be rockin' again.
author: Vanessa E.

description: It's a cool neighborhood bar with LOTS of room and gotta love darts in the back ;) me and the bf go there to enjoy a few drinks and play darts every once in a while, perfect since it's close to home too!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
it's midnight and a friend (male) just called from yancy's and a girl I don't recognize said hello and told me to come out and play. 

I want to give it one less star because it's so far away from me but I can't.  it's just too good.
author: Andrew P.

description: I'm not really sure why I dislike this place so much. They have dart boards and a big screen TV. Those things are nice. I think the place is just too big to be a good local pub. Also I really don't like the hanging plants all over the place. It gives this place the ambiance of a TGI Friday's.
author: Ryan S.

description: I came here on a Saturday night with some friends and had a grand time! It was fun! Lots of big TV's, dart boards, and lots of old arcade games to play! Mrs. Pacman was one player which was a bummer but still lots of fun drunk. The only downside was that after paying for our drinks the bartender decided not to give us our change back and keep it as tip. Thanks asshole! At least let us decide how much to tip you rather than take it, smile and walk away as fast as you can.
author: G G.

description: This place is nice. I like it. I'd go back if I didnt have to drive next time.
author: Cindy L.

description: Everyone may not know my name, but I run into more random friends than I would expect here. Good music, plenty of space, lots of tvs, close to home. Only darts, sparing on the free popcorn, bartenders not always on the ball for drink orders. All in all, best bar in inner sunset though.
author: Chris M.

description: I don't remember much about this place other than getting the worst hangover from several Long Islands--before I knew how potent they were.  The decor was worth a drunken rambling about...something about the tables...and maybe a rooster.  If you're in the Inner Sunset and looking to drink and kick back with friends, this dive's worth checking out.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Oh my god it's like TGI Fridays, Bennigans, and Applebees all threw up in here. With it's tacky crazy crap on the walls decor and plethora of drunken frat types, Yancy's is NOT my favorite place to go. It's packed full of people on any given night, there is no room to walk, and the bartenders are not all that attentive. Two stars only because the drinks are reasonably priced and because I enjoy watching people attempt to score a last minute hookup as the bartenders yell last call.
author: Rebecca H.

description: This is a no frills chill bar.  Most of the time you can hear yourself talk.  But when there are UCSF functions its chaotic.  The only reason you should be going here is if you are in school at UCSF.  Otherwise whats the point.
author: Fatty A.

description: we came here for some good-bye drinks for a friend and was really happy that its location was near san tung! anyway, the bar is great with the endless tvs and popcorn bar food. the drinks flow nicely and the bartender entertained my fascination with sweet tea vodka/bourbon blend! i would definitely come back!
author: Marjie T.

description: Fun neighborhood bar.  One distinction it had was the fact that it had  a little dart room with dart boards lined up for people to play with.  We went last Saturday after dinner at Park Chow.  Big, roomy, lots of tables and chairs and the drinks were cheap.  It was a full house in meaning that almost every seat was taken, but it wasn't too packed where you can't even move around.  It is somewhere you can go in jeans and a sweater after dinner, or without feeling like you have to put too much effort in getting ready for.  Definitely a fun place for a low key Saturday night where you want to go out and drink, but without having to deal with the scene downtown or at some trendy club.  Casual and low key.  :)  One downfall was that it was cash only, no credit cards.
author: Denise B.

description:
(+) the least filthy and most comfy bar in the inner sunset
(-) can't open up a tab with a credit card? or was he just ****ing with me?
(+) accommodates large groups
(-) accommodates large groups of med students (and apologetically, I am one of them)


this place just reminds me of med school, which is why i tend to avoid it ... but it's the most convenient place for me to grab a beer.
author: Anvy A.

description: Yancy's is a great place to hang out with friends. The place seems to be filled with people on any night of the week. Watch some sports on their huge TVs or play a game of darts with some friends.
author: Gabe H.

description: This is a pretty chill bar.  Friendly bartenders. Spacious. You can play Pac-Man, watch some TV, play some darts...you can even bring in your own food from outside establishments!
author: Jillian J.

description: This joint is a solid neighborhood spot and I come here once in a great while because a friend lives nearby.  Solid drinks and a good crowd, plus I am facinated by how the plants flourish in there.  Like that you can bring your own food in here.  A staple of the Inner Sunset.
author: e w.

description: Never feel pressured to drink or keep ordering...some days i drink more than others...but they never pressure you.  It's relaxed and welcoming.
author: Sir Paul L.

description: Good service, with a roomy bar.  Like it!
author: Sally R.

description: Bar is cool, you can bring your own food and eat there. I was watching the NCAA tourney here and the atmosphere was cool. A lot of college kids, and alums from different uni. Very laid back, good selection of beers and cocktails.
author: Jose S.

description: Great bartenders and decor.  Nice neighborhood watering hole.  Like the "retro" cash registers!  Free popcorn, too.  Although I don't play darts, it's great that there is a dart board area for people who like to play darts.
author: Ray K.

description: Love the vibe, love the plants, love the popcorn. Drinks aren't bad either. They have darts too.
author: Corey A.

description: It's where the straight men are. They're hard to find in SF, but here they are, the lounge-meets-sportsbar. I dumped a guy here, specifically said "stay the f--- away from me" something I never thought I would have to say. It has darts, nice booths, and a huge TV. Managed to meet a guy here once, so it's a bit of yin and yang. But in general, this is a break-up bar. They can soothe themselves with sports and male comraderie, to lessen the blow.
author: Anna B.

description: Nice little neighborhood sports bar.  Went here while waiting for a table at Koo, which is down the way; and came back after dinner.  It's a fun spot, a sports bar, so you can watch the game, play darts, and of course, drink.  I liked that this place is not frou-frou.  Just a cool spot to drink and have fun with friends.
author: Sarah F.

description: Great place to watch a game, but tends to get crowded and full of kids from UCSF. Good beer selection tho.
author: Robbie G.

description: Yancy's rocks!  There's a always a great crowd, great music and great bartenders.  'we always have fun playing dice, darts, or the touchsceen games.  The drinks are made stiff, just like we like 'em.    They have great beers on tap and great food nearby.  check it!
author: dave g.

description: It's really about time I reviewed this place. I've been going here for years, off and on. It's one of those bars that has great potential, but falls short. It's large by S.F. standards, but it could really use a good remodel. The service over the years has been OK. It's gone from bad to good at times. I'm not too picky about service at a bar, but, I have to say it like it is. The bar has a big screen for sports watching, but the angles and seat choices are limited. (not as good as Kezar by a long shot). The beer choice is decent, not great. Several taps. They have open windows at the front if you like to people watch, which is nice. I guess the most time I spent here was waiting for the now-deceased P.J.s Oyster bed (R.I.P PJ's)
author: Rich M.

description: I came here with an old friend of mine after we had dinner at Hotei.  He used to frequent this bar a lot when he lived in the area and it was just around the corner from the restaurant.  He ordered a Black Velvet, which I'd never heard of before, but apparently is a mix of Guinness and pear cider.  I ordered an Anchor Steam, but they ran out.  So I ordered a Newcastle, but they ran out.  So I went with a Sierra Nevada.  It was a slow Wednesday night.  How could they run out of beer?  Anyway, for round 2, I decided to try the Black Velvet as well.  I am not a big fan of beer, but it was pretty yum!
author: Kris L.

description: Big screen TV, plenty of seating, a clean, working bathroom (the doors don't lock but whatever, use your foot), darts, a responsive waitress, popcorn, kinda slow but nice bartenders. Overall this bar was a little empty but since I hate packed this was okay. The drinks were pretty stiff and there was a nice ambiance. I live in berkeley so I rather feel I could have just as easily come to albatross, but this was a nice casual, relaxed pub.
author: Kat C.

description: This is a very hip spot for young adults who like to listen to great music and if you have the desire, play darts! I love the beer selection and they make good strong mix drinks! Tip them well and you wont have to wait in line!
author: M C.

description: Yancy's isn't necessarily anything special for sittin around and drinkin/ talkin, but they have a ton of entertaining things to keep you occupied.  They added a bunch of TVs recently and look to be joining the Sunday Ticket NFL bars-- watch out Mucky Duck.  There's a couple of dartboards, some photo hunt and, best of all, a couple of old school Ms. Pacman tables.  Yancy's is a pretty big space and while it may get crowded at times, you never feel too jammed and can always find a place to sit.  Its also useful when you're meeting a lot of people.  The Inner Sunset doesn't suffer from an overabundance of good bars so Yancy's is definitely worth a stop.
author: Zach J.

description: A classic dive bar in the inner sunset.  this place is awesome.  has dart boards and always a lively crowd.  if i have nothing to do on a friday or saturday, i am always done for a few drinks at Yancy's.
author: Mike L.

description: Friendly neighborhood bar that I would frequent a lot when I lived in the area. Great for sports watching (especially if the Warriors ever get good again) and for the casual, evening drink. The only downside is that they don't take credit cards. Big strike against the place.
author: Garett N.

description: I must have passed this place more than 300 times on my way to work over the past 3 years. I always liked the sign/storefront and the name, but not enought to stop and break up my commute to check it out. Finally, i met a friend for a drink in there and WOW! was I ever happy with the insides of this joint. Ample seating, good music coming from the jukebox and very friendly service. I was there early evening on a weeknight and there were about 20 people there total, and it was comfortable. I have no idea what it's like on the weekends, but I'm guessing it fills up. If you're looking for a place to meet friends for great conversation over beer--this is it! Plenty of tables and seats, and many of them rather stylish. I'd be remiss if i didn't mention the decent bathroom too.
author: Stumbalina b.

description: A nice place to hang out. Wood and plants and lots of room. And i can walk there.
author: Jessica W.

description: This is a cute place to hang out with your friends or to go on a date. Service is good and its very cozy.
author: Victoria S.

description: Oh, Yancy's!  It was a very cool place, I went there for the first time last night about 11, I think.  Very cute "bouncer"- I must be getting old because all the bartenders and the door guy all looked like young boys to me, but definitely cute.  I had a black velvet or snake bite I think there also called, yummy.  It was definitely a happening atmosphere, full, but could still find a place to sit.  I would definitely take out-of-towner friends there to chill and show them a different neighborhood in SF.  The darts in the back looked fun and inviting.  Overall it was a large room divided into smaller areas to sit and talk with friends or sit at the bar or play darts.  Like I said it was a happenin' place!  (2 drafts=$10)
author: tamera t.

description: Came in here and luckily got a table.  Two different waitresses acknowledged us but did not help us in the 45 minutes we were waiting there. I understand it is busy but really? 45 minutes!!!
author: Larry C.

description: This place is pretty cool.  They have darts and TV's everywhere.  It's an awesome bar, as I have nothing else to really compare it to.  I love the mellow weekday crowd, and when it sneaks toward the weekend, it looks pretty crowded.  Be careful, though, there could be a bear named Marvin lurking around.  Fear him.
author: K L.

description: Every time I come here, I have good memories. This place has lots of things to do, including darts, old arcade games, trivia/puzzle games, jukebox, etc. I love bars that are chill and have things to do, so you can have some fun activities while you hang out. They always have free snacks for you too. Oh, and you're allowed to bring your own food! The only reason why I didn't give it all 5 stars is that it's a little dirty sometimes, but what do you expect from a local pub, rite?
author: Emy s.

description: Cool place to watch some games or meet up with some buds to start the night out, but the pours suck. Last time I was there I had 4 crown and cokes and I wasn't feelin a thing. Its like they were measuring exactly one shot and the rest coke. Im sure I will be coming here more but get it together bartenders!!!
author: spencer k.

description: My usual watering hole during the weekends.  Look at my profile pic and then come find me on a Friday.  2 out of 4 chances I would be there.  Ok, but please don't because that would be very creepy.  This is a place that is not pretentious and the atmosphere is casual.  There aren't any snobs or fakers.  It's more of a place for you and your friends to chill before heading out to a wilder bar.  There is Erotic PhotoHunt for you to play with and you can bring in outside food so grab pizza next door.  Would be 5 stars had they kept the old fashioned jukebox.
author: Chris T.

description: Happy hour until 7 on weekdays and lot's of plants to make you feel like you are still outside.  If you are into activities while you drink, they have plenty.  And free popcorn while you drink?  I'm sold!
author: Ixchel F.

description: Came here on a Monday night and had a great time. Cool vibe, plenty of places to sit and most importantly, side by side TVs that were playing Entertainment Tonight on one and sports on the other, appeasing both the men and women in the crowd. The bartender was also hilarious -- probably about 21.5, sooo eager to please and show off his fresh-from-bartending-school skills. I will definitely return if I want to chill with some friends for a few laid back drinks.
author: Lauren B.

description: Came here for the first time on Saturday to watch Game 6 (Sox & Rays) and I wonder why I've never come here before.  This is a great sports bar...lots of HD TVs, darts, etc.   Kinda hard to get a drink sometimes but no biggie.  I love the layout and they allow you to bring in other food if you get hungry.  I wish Yancy's was closer to where I live but I'll gladly be making the trip more often now.
author: Cassie B.

description: Play darts, drink beer.  Or grab a table by the big open windows.  Pretty standard beer selection.
author: James D.

description: Divey neighborhood bar with lots of dartboards. Not a bad place to grab a drink and chill out with some friends. Mostly younger college crowd.
author: Linda C.

description: A definite hot spot in the Irving area especially on a Friday and Saturday night.  Big crowds, good bartenders, great selection of beer, attractive waitresses, a number of TVs, a good size dart area, Yancy's a great hangout spot.  When you want to relieve yourself from a dinner, want to watch a sporting event, or just want a place to take the stress off from your day, this is a great place to go.
author: Kris A.

description:
Yancy's is definitely my go-to place. They have a great selection of beers and if you've given up beer like I have, they make pretty good mixed drinks. Add some fresh-popped popcorn and you're set.
Darts, pac-man, flat screens and a decent jukebox round out the picture.
There are lots of places to sit, good for larger groups too. They also have large front windows which would be great for hot weather, a rare treat.
Can't beat the location either; if you're having dinner in the area, stop by Yancy's for a drink and good conversation.
author: Lauren K.

description: Happy hour is meh. Same as other places. Parking can be a pain on Fridays and weekends. The one thing I do like is that there are flat screen TVs everywhere! Any seat you take will have a game on. Some of the tables in the front are kind of small which isn't good for a group of friends. The atmosphere is great when there's a game on. Had fun watching Warrior games here. Oh, and there isn't a great selection of snacks.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Yancy's is just a great place to chill, have some good drinks, and actually hear what your buddies have to say. Yancy's is the kind of place you go to escape the clubs, and just bloody enjoy yourself. As an added bonus, there are usually some prim-lookin star gazers here...although sometimes its a damn sausage fest! It doesn't matter though. Yancy's is definitely not a singles kind of place, you go here to just have a great time and then grab some effin delicious doughnuts down the street! Everyone knows that the best bars have a place to grab some snacks afterwords! I found the doughnut shop by following a homeless lad who borrowed a dollar for "some dougnuts." **eh hem-- Beer!***Best dollar I ever spent! Yancy's +doughnuts = God I love Friday nights!
author: Mike M.

description: Walking down the street and ran into a few friends sitting by the big open window.  Very cool bar, cash only and full bar.   Very friendly staff and the popcorn is excellent.
author: Matt W.

description:
for some reason i always end up here on like, tuesday nights.... 

there is a ton of seating, a fair selection of beers, and deft cocktail waitresses. It isn't that everybody knows your name,  but you will probably run into someone you know. Also, their bathrooms were very clean! I agree with Sam W, parking on Irving can be a beast, but if you are going later it is usually okay.

so far my best night here was when they were showing a rodeo on one of the line of tv's. they are a sports bar, and we are talking all sports.
author: Rachel B.

description: One of my favorite small, non-descript Inner Sunset bars. It's the perfect place on a Sunday night in late summer early fall when it's warm outside. Grab a beer and a table by the window and drink til the sun goes down.
author: Michael E.

description:
ah yes yancys. it wasn't long when i said this was my first time here.. now i don't know how many times i've been. it's a good place if you want to just chill talk and drink. the music isn't ridiculously loud. there's tables for you to sit around as well as the bar. darts if you do that. 

they sell some chips. but also give out popcorn if you ask for it. and you can bring your food in to eat and drink.

the service is good. you can order at the bar or at the table you're at. someone will eventually come to you. but if it's a busy night and you want you're drink, just get up and go get it from the bar. it's faster. 

the only downer is that its cash only. and i never hold on to that much cash. for b of a people, there is one across the street. if you forget cash like me last night, drinks on others. 

not like the best bar ever, but it's chill.
author: Natalie B.

description: So...  is it me, or does this place feel like an applebee's built in the mid '80's?  Besides all of that...  decent bar: cheap drinks, darts, etc.  Great place to bring some friends when all of the other places are too crowded.   The cocktail waitresses are suprisiingly efficient!
author: Robert R.

description: It smells funny in here, but I really like the juke box, all playing old Samhain songs right next to Blue Oyster Cult. The plus side are the amount of televisions with sports. If you wanna see the game you want to watch next to the game your betting on, go to Yancey's. This is definitely a funky place, which is exemplified by the warped floors.
author: Jon F.

description:
reminded me of the cheers bar with the lighting fixtures and the dark brown wood... 

plus for having video game monitors... i love me some erotica photo memory games... 

laid back atmosphere... ample room to move around...

bathrooms could have more attention paid to them...
author: Jana A.

description: I wish the lights were lower, but it's an okay sporty bar and PJ's is right across the street for oysters.
author: T-Bone L.

description: This is as everybody said a typical neighborhood bar. The drinks are cheap as hell, and they have ms pacman in the back. They also have darts. The idea of darts in a bar has always intrigued me. What genius said "Let's get people fucked up, and give them sharp objects to throw."   Sounds brilliant :).
author: Srinivas R.

description: That this bar was pretty cool, but not all that great. They have this drink called the lunch box special... THAT DRINK IS SOO GOOD! It's such a creeper though. haha.
author: Brian P.

description: Ahhhhh...Yancy's, the neighborhood bar!! Nothing fancy for surez, just a nice little spot to chill and get together with your friends for a few drinks. I've been going here since I could drink (legally...). =) Sigh...the sweet memories! Drinks are cheap and plenty of spots to plant your ass. Just remember, go up to the bar to get your drinks cuz its sooo much faster bc there just ain't enough servers sometimes.
author: Angela T.

description: i asked bartender for water, he gets a glass, picks the nozzle up - stops - looks at me and says 'actually come back in 5 minutes, im really busy pouring drinks' puts the nozzle down and walks off.
author: virna d.

description: I'm not exactly into the bar scene, but I usually still have a great time hanging out and enjoying the atmosphere.  But some how this place was just "bleh"'...not much to say about this place.  The bartender was quick to serve us, but the drinks weren't strong.  Overall, this place is like a frat house with video games and dart boards.  And the music sucked big time..
author: hello k.

description: If you ask 10 different people how you'd decorate a bar, i think a place like yancy's would come out. There's a hodge podge of things in this bar that I dont get (whats up w/ all the plants and random posters???).  I do like the games thats there though (darts, liar's dice, pacman).  Weekend crowd is a turn-off. I heard its better on a weekday
author: Amelia S.

description: Chill place. $5 for a Sprite and vodka. The music is not atrocious and it's not too loud either. Not bad. Not bad at all.
author: Chung N.

description: Friends and I came here to have a beer after having finished dinner at Ebisu.  Pretty standard bar with a bunch of TVs and a lot of tables for groups.  Can't go wrong with that.  Only issue for me was the fact that the bar didn't accept cards.  It annoys me when bars don't take cards.
author: Joel J.

description: I went here with a group of friends after seeing the Andy Warhol exhibit at the De Young last night. We had a good time. The girls got drunk while the guys played darts. I left my phone there and somebody turned it in. So I guess I'll be making my second trip out there to pick up my phone. Its a good spot for a group to meet for drinks. Friendly service, I don't remember the people. I was pretty wasted.
author: bonnie b.

description: I didn't drink anything, but I like how they allow you to bring in your own food! Like a whole box of pizza for your party. They just require you order drinks from them. Well lit bar, not dark.
author: Annie L.

description: I used to really like Yancy's when I lived in the neighborhood a few years ago. I returned recently with nostalgia, but found quite a different bar. It was fine at first until some infantile people behind us(with who there had been no previous interaction) not unlike most of the patrons, launched a specials menu at our table hitting my sister smack in the face. Apparently this was hilarious- to the table behind us and the bar. There was no apology, and the bar management refused to offer any recourse, citing "this guy has been like this since second grade". We're all for good bar fun and humor, but this was ridiculous. If you like juvenile bars and being hit in the face by assholes, go here. Otherwise, save your time and face, and go to the Mucky Duck.
author: Clare C.

description: I get it, its a midwest bar in san francisco.  Its not bad, the drinks were cheap.  This place has the biggest table i have ever seen.  Come here if you want to play darts, watch games, drink beer.
author: Marc M.

description: I wish I had one of these places next to my home.  Good crowd, can actually hear myself speak, which if you know me, is a WONDERFUL THING... for you.
author: Scott Y.

description: Best local bar to go to in SF if you're looking for plenty of drinks in bright lighting with tons of plants.  I wonder how long it takes to water them.
author: Pelle Y.

description: Nice kickback, relax, and reminisce about your grammar school days amongst your grammar school classmates!  If you went to Saint Anne's, this is your spot.  I rarely order cocktails at this place, because the beer does it.  The most enjoyable part about going to Yancy's is their VideoArcade machine towards the back near the dart boards.  My favorite games among them all are Erotic Matching and Word Racer.  You'll get hooked.
author: Michael B.

description: Greattttt neighborhood bar... I love goin here to hang out--my guy friends love to come here to watch sports.  Drinks are good--and strong.  There's an area for darts, and some video game tables.  Service is pretty good, no complaints.  The location is really good--right by loads of great restaurants, so its a great place to grab a bite to eat, then go to Yancy's to drink and buzz up before hitting up a club or (as is my experience) some drunken karaoke in J-town.  I highly recommend this place if you're lookin for a low-key place to chill with friends.
author: suzanne l.

description: Yancy's is probably my favorite bar to go to in the Sunset. Sometimes it get's too crowded, and the people who hang out there can be a little much (frat looking guys belting out Journey at the top of their lungs), but I love coming here with a group of people on a mellower night. The bartenders usually seem nice too. And you can get free popcorn. Oh and they have women who will bring drinks to your seat. Doesn't get any better than that.
author: Bam H.

description: Not my favorite, but it's in a good location and has decent-priced drinks. The music IS bad and loud, as others have noted--though not so loud that we couldn't hear the election news over it. =0 Like any bar, it can take a long time to get service when it's at all crowded. Free popcorn (albeit not very good) with your drinks.
author: Ramon E.

description:
dear yancys,

as it is the time for holidays once again, i am coming home for the celebrations. undoubtedly, i will more than likely visit you on a nightly basis this week. please keep the atmosphere relaxed, the music rockin', and the beers cold. please tell your neighbor pasqualis i will be hitting them up too. see you tomorrow.

love,
geoff
author: geoffrey l.

description: I grew up coming to this bar. So everytime i come here I always see old friends. This is a great Giants bar with a mixed sunset crowd. Drinks are priced right and this is a cash only bar.  This place gets really crowded on the weekends they have a lot of tv's, darts, and table top ms PAC man who wants some? They don't serve food but will allow outside food if your hunger strikes while drinking a few. I recommend this place over mucky duck and blackthorn which are bars close by
author: bo c.

description: I like all the TV's and the darts but the crowd is young and annoying and the place has a funny smell to it.
author: Noah T.

description:
All right, I'm man enough to admit when my tastes may not be representative of broader social conventions.  For instance, everybody seems to like throngs of people and chances to be with people who are similar in a racial, economic, and age setting.  I like cozier bars with a lot of different characters I can meet.
If you are a 20's something white college kid who likes to be jam packed into a bar with other 20's something white college kids this is the place for you.  This is unfortunately also the best place on Irving to meet a girl.  I guess I can equate the vibe of this place to a giant houseparty thrown by a popular crowd that you either fit into or don't.  I have always been a nerd, so I find myself suspicious of the bro crowd (and the hot yet oftentimes vacuous women who seem to love them).
I'm not going to say its a bad bar, because that's not a fair assessment,.  Its just not my style.
author: Matt R.

description: 15 Tv's means your a sports bar. Celtic's vs. Knicks game sound  should be a priority not your I-pod playlist!
author: Steven H.

description: I want to like this bar, but everytime I come in, it feels like it 's flat-lining. Nothing fun ever goes on in here.  And even when it's packed, it feels dead. Definitely not the place to come if you wanna get lucky. Or drunk. I can't seem to make it past two drinks  before I get bored and head to the Mucky Duck. The linoleum under the bar, however, is the same as my kitchen. For that  alone, they earn some stars.
author: Laurie A.

description: I've also passed this place about a million times and finally, after going in for a drink, found it to be pretty much exactly what you'd expect. It is pleasant enough, and quiet in the early evening so you can have a happy hour drink and conversation. I was pleased by the happy hour selection: three dollar ciders equals happy me.
author: Kathleen B.

description: Good bar/sport bar to hang out at night. The drinks are decently priced and plenty of places to sit and lounge around for the most part. Parking is plentiful AT NIGHT only. I probably been here once too many times with my friends but at least is spacious enough to listen and talk with my friends while having a nice drink.
author: Peter L.

description: Gaming waterhole, whether it is darts, liar's dice, cards, pac-man, or even sports on TV. This place is a great option when trying to avoid snooty bars and clubs in San Francisco. The place is big. It can hold all your friends. Just remember to bring your spurs.
author: Ni G.

description: Pretty much my favorite bar, whether just to hang out or for watching sports.  This place has really stepped up the amount of televisions in the past year.  Very spacious, though it can get really crowded during big games.  3 huge dart boards in the back, couches and tables everywhere, some old school sit down video games.  No kitchen, but bring in your own food from around the neighborhood.  No pitchers, but a friendly wait staff comes around to the tables.
author: Kenton W.

description:
Cool chill place for the West part of town, don't gotta trek across the city for a chill night to sit over a beer with friends and watch any and every sport. Good crowd, everyone is there to be casual, music selection is up-to date. Great cocktail waitresses that are on top of their game. 

Being recognized a month later gets my, plus un of star. TVs are plentiful, and last but not least they serve Boddington's here, if any of you are like me, and would have Boddy's pumped right through our veins if we could then you understand. I've had Boddy's in both can and draught, but I actually like the can better, dunno why, maybe it's the noise-maker inside the can that makes it taste so damn good.

It is definitely spacious, ample-seating, got 3 dartboard lanes so you can burn off your alcohol with some exercise if you like. Good neighborhood bar overall. Def-Rec.
author: V T.

description: Take it for what it is and you'll learn to love this place like I have.  Yancy's is a great local bar in the inner sunset offering plentiful seating space, cheap drinks, darts, and a big screen TV for local sports coverage and ESPN.
