This is the place to come to when you want to drink and chill without the scene.  They even allow you to bring in food from the neighboring restaurants!  How can you hate on that?
author: Brandon C.

description: I am reviewing this from the sports bar point of view, it might differ the rest of the week.  A wide range of beers, and a staff that kept up with a crowded bar.  Most importantly, lots of TVs... I was able to experience the information overload that only trying to watch 5 games at the same time can cause.  Plus, they let you bring in food from other places in the neighborhood, mmmm.   A great place to watch football.
author: Alured P.

description: I've had some great times at Yancy's. We use to meet up here for post-soccer drinks. There are various types of games and TV that adorn the bar. But, what this bar may be known for the most is all the plant life! We'd usually go for some bevies and conversation, though people clamor for the dart boards, and other features that the bar has to offer. It's a locals/neighborhood bar. I never really planned a night around this bar unless something was going on, or we took a vote after a game and that was the winning selection.
author: M S.

description: Yancy's is a decent place to have a drink, but there are lots of places with a little more character in the neighborhood.  Drinks are average priced and there's a lot of space to spread out, including a dart area.  The crowd is mostly made up of UCSF students on the weekends, so it's busy without ever really getting too rowdy (I mean that as a compliment to you UCSF students!).  There's a really nice place people watching place to sit near the sidewalk when they open up the windows on warm afternoons.  Overall, it's civilized and decent if you're in the area.  A good neighborhood spot for friends and conversation.
author: Laura C.

description: One of my favorite go-to spots to unwind with a beer. Very casual, neighborhood joint- great place to chill with friends, watch sports, play darts, and the best part- Pacman! Completely unpretentious and just a very comfortable place to hang out at. Drinks are pretty cheap and it's not a bad place to start at before a night out. 1/2 star docked off b/c parking is awful around this area.
author: Luce T.

description: Relaxed atmosphere, which I love! Darts and games add a fun aspect to the night.  Friendly bar staff.  Bring cash, they don't accept credit cards.  Price is pretty good considering it's a bar in the city.  It's a good place for big groups, just get there early enough to claim a few tables.
author: Julie Z.

description:
Pros: Full bar, lots of tvs, good crowd.

Cons: It smells like Yancy's. Imagine a drunk Antique Roadshow crowd. Cash only
author: Francisco C.

description: Adequate beer selection in a pleasantly comfortable pub environment. Parking is hard to come by.
author: Christopher K.

description: I always liked this place.  I hadn't been in years until last night.  It's a mix between a sports bar and hotel bar.  It now has flat screens everywhere, but plants still hang from every beam in the joint.
author: Jake N.

description: Yancy's is your ideal neighborhood bar.  I'd give it three stars if I didn't live near, but since I am three blocks away, it gets 4.  It's roomy (for SF) so a great place to meet friends for a couple of drinks before moving on.  Good beer/liquor selection, not really any food but there are plenty of places near by.  There's darts, TV's, a jukebox, Ms. Pacman, some other video games, and plenty of tables.  So yeah, if you live in the IS, you've been there, if you don't live near, it's worth meeting your friends who do live near.  Yeah, I'm talking to you Mission wannabe hipster friends of mine who never come out to the sunset.
author: matt d.

description: One of my fave places in the city. It's not packed, unpretentious and the booze is cheap. Nothing extravagant, just a good place for catching up w/ old friends
author: Walter P.

description:
Ah Yancy's, a neighborhood "dive" of sorts. Me and a bunch of friends went there to unwind after work one day. If you're looking for good entertainment for the night while you down a few, this is a mediocre venue. The few dart boards they have set up are usually taken. The crowd is mostly UCSF folks with a few locals mixed in eg. my group. Female to male ratio is poor. Perhaps it has to do with the ambiance of this place. Not exactly inviting to the after work crowd despite it's proximity to MUNI etc. 

Eh it's a decent place to have a few beers with the friends before heading out for some mischievous behavior.
author: Vince F.

description: Great place to go if you simply want to get drunk and watch some sports. Kinda smells bad in here, but the bar tenders are friendly and there are tons of TV's with sports on 'em. Oh, and if you are into darts... they have like 5 or so boards set up.
author: tyrus s.

description: I think this place is great.. Its kinda big inside, alot of TVs, Darts, and those little game machines with (PHOTO HUNT) ext.... The bartenders are nice and drinks are good.. Nice neighborhood bar for sure
author: T S.

description: Beer was cold.  Football was great.  Atmosphere was terrific.  Perfect bloody sunday!!!!
author: Nick T.

description: Cheap, fun, cleaner than your average dive. I love the dartboard area, which is sectioned off from the seating area so that you feel extra sporty. There's always plenty of tables and it's easy to talk with your friends. The prices are a relief, especially if you just ate dinner at one of the many local restaurants.
author: Leslie L.

description: Had a great drink. I love the little area where the windows open up in front with all the plants. Server was kind of a jerk, she was annoyed that we tried to pay with a credit card... but overall, will go back.
author: Thomas W.

description:
my other local bar.  alan the bartender is awesome.  great sports bar!  good place for larger groups.  can bring food in (like pizza or mex food from next door).  cash only, but there are 4 banks a half block on either side.  

dart boards, big screen tv's, popcorn, chips & salsa, booze, loud!

the occasional marina-type douchebag finds his way in, but is easily spotted.  also, some guys try to pick you up by pretending to be doctors at UCSF.  but us smart girls figure that out quickly too.
author: gail g.

description: beer and darts...just a run of the mill friendly neighborhood bar.  nothing particularly special about it, but it's close by and so by default i go...
author: Roshni R.

description: You know, I know when I walk into a dive bar and I'm dressed up because I came in fresh from a library conference that I might be looked at funny. As a bartender, I've made the mistake of thinking people might not be cool because they are dressed up. I think they might be high maintenence. I am sooo not high maintenence. I ask for a vodka soda in a bucket and the bartender says, (sneering) "what's a bucket" O.k. So I tell him, he says, "oh, you meen a ROCKS glass?" Yeah, but when I walk into a low end bar I'm not going to ask for a rocks glass, I'd feel like an asshole. So we got our drinks, chilled and tipped fat. So we sat with empty glasses in front of us for a good five minutes while the bartender wandered around aimlessly. I will be patient if you are busy, but fill me up buddy. So after round two and once again tipping fat, I'm thinking we will be fine. Noooo, we wait just as long for round three. Done. If I lived in this neighborhood, this would not be my neighborhood bar.
author: Tracey W.

description: Went here last night (for my bday)  a lot of fun...The darts were hit, the drinks are strong...really a good place...fun on a tue night...very low key....
author: Matt S.

description:
this is my very first Yelp! review

yancy's is my all-time favorite sports bar, I'm always there during NBA playoffs, sometimes for niner game too

the seating is hella comfy, esp around pac-man by the big screen, i love how you can bring any food in from outside, most people get pizza or burritos, justin and i get stinky thai food sometimes

it was too crowded that one year the warriors went to playoffs, but don't have to worry about that happening again anytime soon

only bad things: 1) one time i went for the cal game and they did not have the channel so i had to go to underdog and 2) cash only, but not a biggie
author: Ashley H.

description: It's a bar.  It's a living room.  It's a play room.  Yancy's is the kind of bar you can take your mom (who doesn't drink) to--which I did.  It's clean and woody and has that kind of golden feel about it, much more so than Cheers from tv.  There are overstuffed chairs on one side and coffee tables so people can carry on a comfy conversation.  There's a even a dart board in the back.  And half of the place is a nice long bar.  A friend of mine was visiting from the Caribbean and I brought her here to watch the Superbowl (back when Steve Young played) and she felt quite comfy, not afraid of getting hit on or anything.  I can't remember what the pricing was like.  I just like this bar because it is all people friendly and it's not a fern bar or pick up bar (although you can meet people here).  And sometimes they serve food too.  There are tvs all over the place so you don't have to miss a minute of your team.
author: Kai T.

description: awsome bar. i love a bar with a mixed crowd. been coming here for awhile now and always left having a good time. Alan is an awsome bartender...ALWAYS and i mean ALWAYS hooking us up drinks. a big thumbs up for a dope bar in the sunset.
author: Tuan D.

description: honestly, it may not be the bar but the people who actually frequent this place that makes it suck so bad but I would rather walk ten blocks in the cold to the Silver Spur than order a watered down beer from an asshole bartender here. that's sounds so harsh but, shit, I live a block away, it could be so easy for them because I drink a lot!! stars for having darts and a decent, i repeat decent jukebox.
author: courtney b.

description: A great bar from top to bottom: from the barside, to the tables, to the dart boards, even to the stockroom.
author: JP B.

description: What happened??  I used to live in the 'hood 4 years ago and this place was great - cheap beers, darts, local residents...now it is an overcrowded frat bar that reeks of stale beer.  If you're into that sort of thing this place is a gem, but I am getting a bit old for those shenanigans.  I still come here every once in a while after eating in the neighborhood, but more for old times sake than anything else.
author: Matt A.

description: I love the bar but am not a fan of the bald bartender/manager....what a douche bag!  Fire him and they will have a GREAT bar.
author: Andi W.

description: My favorite neighborhood bar.  Drinks are cheap and you can bring your own food.  The bartenders are friendly and usually remember you if you come in regularly.  The place gets pretty packed on Friday and Saturday nights but it makes for fun people watching!  Every sports channel imaginable and SpikeTV are usually on every tv.  Its a good spot for me and the hubby or with a group of friends.
author: Lori A.

description: so i went back to yancy's to watch the warriors game last night.  it was wasn't quite as packed as thursday night.  luckily, 2 fine gentlemen were leaving and scooped up bar seats right in front to the newish flat screens.  the ventilation is poor.  i was thankful it wasn't as packed as it could have been.  they have fans, but it provides little relief.  when halftime rolls around, all the kids bolt for some air.  cash only, but no worries there's a wells fargo and b of a across the street.  they seem to tap out of a lot of beer early.  so don't be too particular.
author: Sharlene C.

description: when all else fails there is always Yancy's, when its crowded its a pain, its definitely a casual hang out spot , no D-bags in sight. parking is pretty easy to find even on satudays. if you are with boring friends they have plenty of lcd tv lined across the wall. "im sorry what were you sayin?"
author: Wei W.

description: huge bar. there's darts, old school video games, a jukebox, and plenty of flat screens to watch games and whatnot. good place to hit up with friends if you want to make it a chill night.
author: Linda N.

description: Cool place; roomy, LOTS of TVs everywhere..good beer on tap selection, mixed crowd. Parking's a bitch, but what else is new in SF? They had a Ninendo Wii hooked up in the back and I think a PS2 also. Definitely going back.
author: Steve K.

description: it was nice... i got to sit and drink and talk with my friends... people seem to be there for some no nonsense good chillin time... it was a nice late20's to 30's crowd when i went...
author: Isa C.

description: this is definitely a nice place to relax when in the irving area.  pretty laid back, sports bar feel, with a younger crowd. drinks are decent and not overpriced.  if you play darts, this may be the place for you. no pool table, tho...but plenty of TVs for big games.
author: Roy N.

description: I always liked coming here. Place is spacious and lots of dart boards. I have many good memories of when I used to come here when I was younger. Great location. Kind of hard to find parking during dinner hours.
author: Happy G.

description: decent size and clean joint for being in the sunset, would definitely visit again if i was in the area and wanted a sports bar atmosphere.
author: Syonora A.

description: I had every intention of making Yancy's my new neighborhood bar, but I guess it hasn't lived up to my dream of what it should be. I like the atmosphere, and the abundance of seats, but its just sorta blah. The bartenders aren't too friendly, its cash only, and I guess I've just never had a very memorable experience here. It is down the street though, which is definitely the reason for some of the stars...and you can bring food in, but other than that it's just so-so.
author: Annie L.

description: this place was pretty cool.  i went there to hang out with my cousins for one of their bdays on a wednesday night.  seems like a very nice neighborhood bar.  beer and free popcorn is always good!  service is good too.  and only a short walk away from good eats around the area.  there are plenty of tables to sit around and just chill.  lots of tv's and 3 dart boards.  fun stuff!!!!  there were a couple tables where students were studying.  i'd definitely come back here and hang out.
author: Fran H.

description: For some reason after I left this place my feet ended up virtually black.  I also was very wasted, and I think about 20 people received drunk dials from me :0)  Sorry if you were one of them.
author: Buddy Garrity L.

description: they used to have like 5 hot bartenders and either a big raging partyer or an aussie who checked IDs at the door. this was probably 4 years ago. there were hidden cameras in the fake plants in the rafters, too. i don't think i ever got kicked out of this place, which is impressive. that fact alone adds a star.
author: ultra p.

description: it was a good bar when they had the old crew there about 4 years ago. they all got the boot and then the bar got lame. the drinks were still good but it lost something. i cant say ive gone back to try and find it. dirty ol sunset bar
author: Serra C.

description: hmm not much to say. it was pretty ordinary to me. There's darts, cards and pacman. chill place to kick it. smelly bathrooms! dirty chairs! ok midori sours and ok snakebites.
author: Bob S.

description: for many years, yancy's was my "cheers."  i was born and raised in the sunset and went to elementary school at st. anne's just a few blocks away.  so i guess it was only natural that when my buddies and i returned from college, looking for a watering hole to call home, we ended up here.  and i can tell you that i've spent more money, put away more beers, and lost more games of darts here than i care to remember.  (and i've probably played "freebird" on the jukebox more times than lynyrd skynyrd has ever actually performed it.)  i can remember new year's eve there 1997(?), the last night you could legally smoke in a bar in california.  that was a great night.  over the years, i've seen bartenders and waitresses come and go.  but they've always been great.  and there are a helluva lot more tv sets in there now.  making yancy's much more of a sports bar than it used to be.  but the crowd has generally remained the same:  locals, old timers, college kids, med and nursing students from ucsf, and sports fans on game nights.  i don't get out there too often any more, but i try to visit whenever i'm in town.  they're still cash only, which is probably a good thing, cause if you could start a tab, you'd probably end up drinking way too much.  but the bottom line is:  comfortable, friendly, fun.  can get a bit crowded on the weekends or on game nights.  but some of the most enjoyable nights of my life have been spent with my buddies at yancy's playing liar's dice over some beers and pizza from milano's.  try it.  you'll love it.
author: Feodor C.

description: nice place to chill and catch the game.  gets a bit busy on weekends though.  staff is friendly.  cool place if you want to keep it low key.
author: James C.

description: i'm always disappointed when i'm here. a very diverse crowd, lots of greenery inside, the bar is huge. lots of darts, but i've never had a good time there.
author: jack d.
